**Other Conditions -** - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student, who is regularly studying in a recognized institution and is receiving any scholarship, can be allowed to do part-time work.

Rajya Pratibha Khoj Pariksha Chhatravrit.details:
The scheme &quot;Rajya Pratibha Khoj Pariksha Chhatravriti Yojana&quot; was implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, students are provided with scholarships or a one-time incentive for pursuing education up to the postgraduate level, after being selected through the State Talent Search Examination organized by the Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, Ajmer.
Students studying in Classes 10 and 12 in all government schools, recognized private schools, and Swami Vivekanand Model Schools in the state, who have secured a minimum of 50% marks in Classes 9 and 11 respectively, are eligible to apply for the examination. Students selected through this examination will be entitled to the benefits provided under the scheme.

Scheme for the Award of Scholarship for.details:
The &quot;Scheme for the Award of Scholarship for the Under Graduate Meritorious Students of Various Faculties of Junagadh Agricultural University&quot; launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide monthly financial assistance to eligible Under Graduate students at Junagadh Agricultural University. Scheme for the Award of Scholarship for.benefits:

ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship.details: The Fellowship is aimed at promoting original, socially relevant, and policy-focused research in the social sciences. The fellowship provides financial support through a monthly grant of ₹20,000 and an annual contingency grant of ₹20,000 for up to two years, with an initial award period of one year, which is renewed for the second year subject to fulfilment of requisite criteria. It also offers institutional and short-term fellowships including a six-month short term fellowship for scholars nearing Ph.D. submission (minimum three years of completed PhD research) and a standalone contingency grant of ₹62,500 for specific research needs. Applications are invited through ICSSR’s website and social media platforms. Fellows are expected to pursue full-time research, submit regular progress reports, and provide a final submission that includes published work, a book-length thesis, and audited financial records.  Given India's social science ecosystem, it seeks to promote research excellence, evidence-based research, and scholarship that is also relevant to policymakers.
ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship.benefits:
1)	Monthly Fellowship amount @ Rs.20,000 per month
2)	Contingency Grant @ Rs.20,000 per annum
ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship.eligibility:
1)	Applicant must be an Indian citizen.
2)	Must be a full-time bonafide Ph.D. scholar in a social science discipline in a UGC-recognized university, deemed-to-be university, institute of national importance, ICSSR Research Institute, or college with approved Ph.D. programme.
3)	The Ph.D. topic must have been confirmed by the DRC/authorised statutory body of the institution on or before the last date of call for applications.
4)	Age must be below 40 years as on the last date of application.
5)	Age relaxation of 5 years allowed for SC/ST/OBC-(NCL) candidates and Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwD).
6)	Must have secured a minimum of 55% marks in post-graduation, with 5% relaxation for reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC-(NCL)/PwD).
ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship.exclusions: 1)	Those who are not fulfilling the eligibility criteria.

application process.process: Step 01: Visit  ICSSR website  - www.icssr.org - and navigate to Fellowships section. Step 02: Click on Doctoral Fellowship Scheme. Step 03: Register/Login to the ICSSR portal. Step 04: Fill the online application form. Step 05: Upload documents and submit.

Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskr.details: The scheme “Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskrit Textbooks” is implemented by the Directorate of Sanskrit Education under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote Sanskrit education by providing free Sanskrit textbooks to students studying in Classes 1 to 12.
Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskr.benefits: **Each student is provided annual financial assistance under the scheme as follows:** - Classes 1st to 5th: ₹250/- per student - Classes 6th to 8th: ₹400/- per student - Classes 9th to 10th: ₹600/- per student - Classes 11th to 12th: ₹700/- per student
Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskr.eligibility: 1. The students studying in Classes 1 to 12 at Sanskrit schools across Uttarakhand are eligible.

Sero Positive Illness Scheme.details: Launched in 2009, the scheme &quot;Sero Positive Illness Scheme&quot; by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to support the education of children affected by or born into families impacted by Sero Positive illness. Through this scheme, financial scholarships and support for school uniform, books, tuition fees, food, and hostel expenses are provided to destitute and orphaned children across education levels—from primary school to postgraduate studies. The scheme is implemented by the Director, Social Security Department, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar, and at the district level, by the District Social Security Officer or District Child Protection Officer.

Educational Loan Scheme (GMFDC).details: The "Educational Loan Scheme" is implemented by the Gujarat Minorities Finance and Development Corporation (GMFDC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the form of loans for all types of education, including various technical and non-technical courses, that help beneficiaries gain employment or enhance their job prospects. Under this scheme, low-interest loans are offered to eligible students from minority communities to pursue graduate and postgraduate courses in technical, vocational, professional, and medical fields, either in India or abroad.
Educational Loan Scheme (GMFDC).benefits: 1. For studies within India, a maximum loan of ₹1,50,000/- per year and up to ₹7,50,000/- for a five-year course can be obtained. 1. For medical courses within India, ₹2,50,000/- for 1 year and ₹12,50,000/- for 5 years can be obtained. 1. For abroad studies, a maximum loan of ₹3,00,000/- for 1 year and ₹15,00,000/- for 5 years is provided. 1. The annual interest rate on this loan is 3%. **Note 1:** If the applicant’s annual family income is up to ₹98,000 in rural areas or ₹1,20,000 in urban areas, the loan is provided at a concessional interest rate of 3% per annum. **Note 2:** According to the National Corporation's Credit Line-2, for families with an income of ₹1,20,000/- up to ₹8,00,000, the interest rate is 5% for female students and 8% for male students. **Note 3:** The loan and interest amount is to be repaid in 60 equal monthly installments within five years from the date of completion of studies or from the date of getting a job, whichever is earlier. **Note 4:** Penalty interest at the rate of 2% is payable on delayed payments.
Educational Loan Scheme (GMFDC).eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to a minority religious community (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist, Parsi, and Jewish) or a linguistic community (Sindhi, Marathi, Urdu) of Gujarat State. 1. The applicant or any family member should not have received a loan from Gujarat Minorities Finance and Development Corporation Limited, Gujarat Backward Class Development Corporation, Gandhinagar, or any other central/state government corporation/institution or bank. 1. The annual income of the applicant's family should be: - ₹98,000/- for rural areas. - ₹1,20,000/- for urban areas. - However, families with income exceeding ₹1,20,000/- and up to ₹8,00,000/- are also eligible, albeit with different interest rates 5. The applicant's age should be between 16 and 32 years.

Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.details: The scheme "Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Class" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to promote education among socially and educationally backwards students. Through this scheme, scholarships per annum are provided to boys and girls studying in Standards 1 to 10 in government and aided schools. The scheme is implemented by the Director, Developing Caste Welfare, Gandhinagar, Gujarat.
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.benefits: 1. **For Boys (Std. 1 to 8):** ₹750/- scholarship.1. **For Boys (Std. 9 to 10):** ₹1000/- scholarship.1. **For Girls (Std. 1 to 5):** ₹500/- scholarship.1. **For Girls (Std. 6 to 10):** ₹1000/- scholarship.
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC). 1. The applicant should be studying in Standard 1 to 10. 1. The applicant should be enrolled in a Government or Aided Primary/Secondary School. 1. For applicants studying in Standard 1 to 8, there is no family income limit. 1. For applicants studying in Standard 9 to 10, the annual family income of the applicant’s family should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Educational Loan Scheme (GBCDC).details: The scheme "Educational Loan Scheme" is implemented by the Gujarat Backward Classes Development Corporation (GBCDC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial support for higher technical and professional education to students belonging to belonging to socially and educationally backward classes. Under this scheme, loans are provided at concessional interest rates to eligible students pursuing approved graduate and postgraduate professional & technical courses in fields such as engineering, medical, MBA, MCA, etc.
Educational Loan Scheme (GBCDC).benefits: 1. The maximum loan limit under this scheme is up to ₹ 15,00,000/-. 2. **The interest rate:** - 4% per annum for male students. - 3.5% per annum for female students. 3. **Loan Contribution Breakdown:** - 90% by the National Corporation. - 5% by the State Government. - 5% by the beneficiary. 4. **The loan amount will include the following:** - Admission fees and tuition fees - Accommodation and food expenses > **Validity:** This loan is to be repaid in 60 equal monthly instalments, including interest. The loan must be repaid within 6 months of completing the course or 1 month after getting a job, whichever is earlier.
Educational Loan Scheme (GBCDC).eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to a socially and educationally backward class. 1. The total annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The student must have secured admission through a recognized entrance examination conducted by the Central or State Government, or through a selection process, with at least 50% marks in Class 12 or the qualifying examination. 1. The applicant should have secured admission in a recognized institution for one of the following courses: - MBA or its equivalent (recognized by AICTE) - Master of Computer Applications (MCA) or its equivalent (recognized by AICTE) - Graduate-level engineering courses conducted by IITs or other institutions (recognized by AICTE) - Medical or allied education such as Ayurvedic, Homeopathy, Unani, etc., from institutions recognized by the Medical Council of India - Diploma course in Hospitality Management recognized by the National Council of Hotel Management > **Note:** Priority will be given to applicants whose family income is up to ₹1,50,000/- per annum.

The loan amount will be sanctioned after deducting the amount received under the Mukhyamantri Yuva Swavalamban Yojana.

Foreign Study Loan.details: The scheme "Foreign Study Loan" implemented by the Gujarat Unreserved Educational and Economical Development Corporation (GUEEDC), Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, provides financial assistance to students from non-reserved categories pursuing higher studies abroad. The scheme provides overseas study loans of up to ₹15,00,000/- for specific courses, including Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery, post-graduation courses (valid even if obtained after diploma), post-graduation diploma, and equivalent courses after Class 12th. To be eligible, the applicant must have scored 60% or more in Class 12 and belong to a family with an annual income of ₹6,00,000/- or less. The loan carries simple interest at the rate of 4% per annum with repayment terms varying based on the loan amount.
Foreign Study Loan.benefits:
**Loan Amount:** Up to ₹15,00,000/- for overseas study. **Interest Rate:** Simple interest at 4% per annum. **Repayment Grace Period:** 1 year after completion of study before repayment begins. **Flexible Repayment:** Borrower can repay the loan before the stipulated time limit.
**Repayment Schedule** - For loans up to ₹5,00,000/-: Equal monthly installments over 5 years. - For loans above ₹5,00,000/-: Equal monthly installments over 6 years.
Foreign Study Loan.eligibility: - The applicant must belong to the non-reserved category. - The applicant must be pursuing higher studies abroad. - The applicant must be enrolled in Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery, post-graduation courses (valid even if obtained after diploma), post-graduation diploma, or equivalent courses after Class 12th. - The applicant must have scored 60% or more in Class 12th. - The applicant must belong to a family with an annual income of ₹6,00,000/- or less.

application process.process: Step 1: Register on the Official Portal Open the  official website . Navigate to the “How to Apply” section and select “Foreign Study Loan.” You will be redirected to the  e-SamajKalyan  Portal. On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘ Please Register Here ’. Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. Log in using your credentials once registration is complete. Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form After logging in, locate the application Form. Enter personal, academic, and family information in the respective modules: Name, gender, category, address, educational background, institution details, passport number, family income, occupation of guardians, and bank details (to be used for loan disbursement). Use dropdown selections in the "Patrata Column" (પાત્રતાની કોલમ) to correctly indicate your eligibility parameters. It is mandatory to select from the dropdown so that your application is processed under the right criteria. Step 3: Prepare and Upload Required Documents Scan and upload clear, legible documents in the upload section. Ensure each file is within the portal’s size and format limitations (usually PDF, JPEG or PNG) and named properly to avoid confusion during review. Step 4: Review and Final Submission Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Save a local PDF copy of the completed form for your records. Click “Final Submit”. Step 5: Application Verification by GUEEDC Upon submission, your application and uploaded documents will be reviewed by GUEEDC officials. You may be contacted via phone or email if: Any clarification is required, Additional documents are needed, or Corrections must be made. Maintain active communication channels and respond promptly to any such requests. Loan Sanction and Disbursement If the application is accepted, a formal sanction letter will be issued. You may be asked to sign an agreement accepting the terms and repayment conditions of the loan. The sanctioned loan amount will be disbursed directly into your verified bank account. If any post-sanction verification or usage confirmation is required, comply as per instructions provided by GUEEDC.

Scholarship to SC students studying in s.details:
The scheme "Scholarship to SC students studying in selected schools under Talentpool Scheme" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide the best education to meritorious Scheduled Caste students in high-quality residential schools to help them build their careers and improve their living standards. Through this scheme, financial assistance per student is provided to the meritorious Scheduled Caste students. The scheme targeted 330 students across 33 districts, with 5 meritorious students from Std-5 and 5 from Std-10 from each district. The scheme is implemented by the Office of the concerned District Deputy Director (Ajak).
The following 8 schools have been empanelled out of 15 schools: 1. Late P.U. Chavda Edu. Trust operated Nalanda Vidyalaya Educational Complex, Bhorigada, Amreli. 1. Futurelink School, operated by Gujarat Child Development Board, Vill. Kharedivav, Tal. Jambughoda, Dist. Panchmahal. 1. Shri J.R. Desai School, operated by Gujarat Bal Vikas Mandal, Mora, Morwa, Dist. Panchmahal. 1. Shri Neelkanth Education and Social Welfare Trust, Bayad, Aravalli. 1. Shri Brahmanand Vidya Mandir, Chaparda, operated by Brahmacharishree Bhagwati Nandji Education Trust 1. Satkeval Vidyamandir, Sarsa, run by Gyan Sampradaya Kelavani Trust 1. Chanakya Education and Charitable Trust (Takshashila Vidyalaya), Halvad, Morbi. 1. Nalanda Vidyalaya, run by Shri Swami Vivekananda Education and Welfare Trust, Puna Village, Ta. Choryasi, Surat.
Scholarship to SC students studying in s.benefits: 1. Financial assistance of up to ₹40,000/- per student is provided.
Scholarship to SC students studying in s.eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste. 1. The applicant should from Standard 5 and Standard 10. 1. The applicant should be studying in a school selected under the Talent Pool Scheme. 1. The applicant's parents' income limit should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-. (whose income is between ₹2,00,000/- and ₹3,00,000/-, are eligible for 50% assistance). 1. The applicant must be a student.

application process.process: Visit the nearest Deputy Director, Scheduled Caste Welfare Office of the district. Collect the application form from the office and fill it out correctly. Submit the completed application form along with all the required attachments to the Deputy Director, Scheduled Caste Welfare Office of the district in which the school has been selected.

Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.details: The “Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes Castes” was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to reduce school dropout rates and improve educational access among students belonging to Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes. Under this scheme, annual financial scholarships are provided to students from classes 1st to 10th studying in government and aided primary schools, ensuring they continue their education without financial hardship.
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.benefits: > **Scholarship Amounts:** - Boys (Class 1st to 8th): ₹750/- per annum- Boys (Class 9th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum- Girls (Class 1st to 5th): ₹500/- per annum- Girls (Class 6th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to Notified Tribes or Denotified Tribes as recognized by the Government of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student and studying in standard 1st to 10th. 1. The applicant must be studying in a government or government-aided primary or secondary school. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. There is no income limit for students from standard 1st to 8th. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/- for classes 9th to 10th.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 01:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 02:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 03:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 04:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 05:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 06:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 07:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 08:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 09:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 01:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 02: Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 03:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. Note 04:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 05:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 06:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 07:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 08:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) students pursuing M.Phil. or Ph.D. to encourage higher education and research.

The applicant should be pursuing M.Phil or Ph.D at a recognized institution. 1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Coaching Assistance for Pre-preparation.details: The scheme "Coaching Assistance for Pre-Preparation for Competitive Exams of All India Level like IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU and IELTS, TOEFL, GRE for Going Foreign" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to financially support SEBC and economically backward students preparing for national-level and international entrance exams. Under this scheme, eligible candidates receive up to ₹20,000/- or the actual tuition fee paid, whichever is lower, as assistance for coaching fees.
Coaching Assistance for Pre-preparation.benefits: **Financial Assistance:** - ₹20,000/- or actual coaching fee paid (whichever is lower) for pre-preparation of one competitive exam (IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU, IELTS, TOEFL, GRE) **Mode of Disbursement:** - Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to trainee’s bank account.
Coaching Assistance for Pre-preparation.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must belong to the SEBC or Economically Backward Class category. 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed Class 10 or Class 12 (SSC or HSC). 1. The applicant must be preparing for one of the eligible competitive exams (IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU, IELTS, TOEFL, GRE). 1. The applicant must have paid tuition/coaching fees for the exam preparation. 1. The annual family income of the applicant must not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NE.details: The “Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NEET, JEE, GUJCET Examination to both Socially and Educationally Backward Class Trainees/Students and Female Students and Economically Backward Class Students” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide financial aid to underprivileged students for coaching support. Under this scheme, students from SEBC or Economically Backward Class categories receive coaching fee (whichever is lower) for one exam-NEET, JEE, or GUJCET.
Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NE.benefits: **Financial Assistance:** - ₹20,000/- or actual coaching fee paid, whichever is lower. **Applicable Exams:** - NEET (National Eligibility cum Entrance Test) - JEE (Joint Entrance Examination) - GUJCET (Gujarat Common Entrance Test) **Mode of Disbursement:** - Amount is credited via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the student’s bank account.
Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NE.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must be from the SEBC or Economically Backward Class category. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC/Class 10). 1. The applicant must be enrolled in or preparing for NEET, JEE, or GUJCET. 1. The applicant must have paid a coaching fee and be able to submit a valid receipt. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.details: The 'Full Time PhD Candidate' is a component of the scheme “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics and IT”, implemented by the Digital India Corporation under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. It is an institutional scheme, where PhD seats are allocated to the institutions and the institutions enroll PhD candidates on these seats following their admission procedures. ***Objectives:*** - To enhance the number of PhDs in Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/IT Enabled Services (IT/ITES) sectors in the country. - Give thrust to R&D, create an innovative ecosystem and enhance India’s competitiveness in these knowledge intensive sectors. ***Salient Features:*** - 1000 Full Time PhD seats in the areas of ESDM & IT/ITES - One time support for selected 250 Full-time PhD candidates (50 candidates/year) for 6 months Visit to Labs Abroad - Support for International Conference up to Rs. 1.50 Lakh/ per Full Time PhD once under the support tenure - Contingency Research Grant @ Rs. 1.20 Lakh/ year per Full Time PhD
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.benefits: [***Financial Support for Full-time PhD candidates***](https://phd.dic.gov.in/guidelines/SOPFullTime.pdf)***:*** 1. **Fellowship:** ₹38,750/- per month in 1st & 2nd year and @₹43,750/- per month in 3rd, 4th and 5th years of PhD. (support till PhD completion or 5 years whichever is earlier). 1. **Reimbursement of Rent (RoR):** This component is linked with the fellowship of a PhD Candidate. The rate of RoR is 24%, 16% & 8% (of fellowship) for X, Y & Z class cities/towns respectively. 1. **Institutional Overheads:** An amount of ₹25,000/Year/Full-time PhD candidate for support duration of PhD candidate to be given to the institution. The institutional overhead will be released after completion of required tenure by the respective candidate on pro-rata basis. 1. **Research Contingency Grant Support:** An amount of ₹1,20,000/Year/Full-time PhD candidate for support duration of the PhD candidate. 1. **Support to attend selected International Conferences** up to ₹1.5 Lakh per Full Time PhD candidate from 3rd year. 1. **One time support for selected 250 Full Time PhD candidates from 3rd year for 6 months “Visit to Labs Abroad”.** The support would be available to the selected Full Time PhD candidates with following guidelines: - During the visit, the Monthly Fellowship will be ₹1.50 Lakh. - The Travel/Visa expenses up to ₹1.50 Lakh is provided. - During this period, the domestic Fellowship and Reimbursement of Rent (RoR) will be suspended.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.eligibility:
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme is an institutional scheme wherein eligible institutions submit proposals requesting Full Time PhD seats against an active call for proposal by Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme, DIC, MeitY. 1. The call for proposal for Full Time PhDseats is notified by PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal https://phd.dic.gov.in/ 2. Proposals for allotment of Full Time PhD seats are to be submitted by eligible institutions only. Suitable number of seats would be allotted to institutions for further enrollment of Full Time PhD fellows on these seats following the scheme guidelines. 3. The institutions with PhD seats, allotted under the scheme, would conduct their admission process for enrolment of candidates on those seats. 4.**** Only the candidates enrolled/registered for PhD during the period of the scheme would be eligible to apply for the financial support. This scheme will be applicable for new PhD Scholars after notification of the scheme 5. Candidates already availing financial support from other government schemes are not eligible.
***Terms and Conditions for support*** 1. The support will be for additional PhD candidates taken up by an institution. No support would be provided for current levels of enrolment in the PhD programme at the institutions. Transfer from other scholarship schemes would not be permitted. 1. Only the candidates enrolled/registered for PhD during the period of the scheme would be eligible to apply for the financial support. This scheme will be applicable for new PhD Scholars after notification of the scheme. 1. The candidate would be eligible for Fellowship for the period during which the candidate is in good standing, and fulfills the requirements of the PhD successfully. The maximum period for which the support would be available for any Full-time candidate would be five years or till the completion of PhD whichever is earlier. 1. The participating Institution will ensure that a candidate receiving fellowship under this scheme is not receiving any financial support for PhD from any other scheme of Government of India/States etc. at the same time, The candidates who have availed support for their PhD from any other scheme of Government of India/States etc. will be automatically be disqualified for support under this scheme. 1. The PhD seats allotted for a particular year should be utilized in the same academic year only as per the prescribed timelines. The unfilled seats would be automatically pulled back to the general pool of the scheme. 1. The institutions, in the event of any drop-out, need to report it to PhD Cell/DIC immediately. The institutions cannot enroll a substitute candidate on their own. 1. The institution will be responsible for furnishing utilization certificates of the funds released to them based on the scheme parameters, and as per conditions of the sanctioned grant-in- aid.

Interested candidates need to contact respective institutions for admission formalities.

Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.details: The “Part Time PhD Candidate” is a component of the scheme “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics and IT”, implemented by the Digital India Corporation under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. The scheme aims at generating a total of 150 Part-time PhDs in emerging research areas of Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/IT Enabled Services (IT/ITES) sectors over a period of 5 years. ***Objectives:*** - To enhance the number of PhDs in Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/IT Enabled Services (IT/ITES) sectors in the country. - Give thrust to R&D, create an innovative ecosystem and enhance India’s competitiveness in these knowledge intensive sectors. Part-Time PhD seats are provisioned for professionals working at a reputed place/organisation. The seats are allotted to the institutions based on the assessment of the proposals of the institute, research strength, and the working places of the prospective applicants.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.benefits: - Part-time PhD candidates will receive a one-time incentive of ₹3,00,000/- upon successful completion of their PhD degree and reporting of the same to PhD Cell through their institution with PhD completion documents.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.eligibility:
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme is an institutional scheme wherein eligible institutions submit proposals requesting Part-time PhD seats against an active call for proposal by Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme, DIC, MeitY. <br> 1. The call for proposal for Part-time PhD seats will be notified by PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal https://phd.dic.gov.in/. 2. Proposals for allotment of Part-time PhD seats are to be submitted by eligible institutions only. Suitable number of seats would be allotted to institutions for further enrollment of Part-time PhD fellows on these seats following the scheme guidelines. &lt;br&gt; &lt;br&gt; - Part-time PhD seats are provisioned for professionals working at reputed places/organizations. - The selected candidates should not be availing any PhD Fellowship/scholarship from any other scheme of Central or State Government.
***Termination of the Support*** PhD Cell, DIC, MeitY reserves the right to hold/ stop/ terminate the support for this component at any stage, including but not limited to: -  Appropriate progress is not being made. -  Violation/ Non-compliance of guidelines. -  Any other reason, which is deemed appropriate by PhD Cell, DIC, MeitY.

Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.details: The “Young Faculty Research Fellowship (YFRF)” is a component of the “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics and IT”, implemented by the Digital India Corporation under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. The objective of the scheme is to promote R&D, create an innovative ecosystem, and enhance India’s competitiveness in the knowledge-intensive sectors of Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/IT Enabled Services (IT/ITES). This fellowship is meant for Young Faculty having regular position at their institution and proven track record in research. Support is provisioned for 50 candidates, for an initial period of support of 2 years, extendible till 5th year based on performance review.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.benefits: ***Nature of Support:*** - **Research Fellowship:** ₹20,000/- per month, in addition to the regular salary - **Research Contingency Grant:** ₹5,00,000/- per year for a maximum of 5 years - The fellowship is tenable only in India and can be implemented in any of the recognized & eligible academic and R&D institution. - Research Contingency Grant can be used for minor equipment, consumables and domestic travel. The host institution should provide necessary administrative and infrastructural support for YFRF. - The fellows are not eligible to receive any other fellowship from any Government or Non-Government source during the tenure of the fellowship. - YFRFs are non-transferrable. The research work is to be carried out in the same eligible institution though which YFRF proposal was submitted. ***Duration of Support:*** - The fellowship is purely a temporary assignment, and is tenable for a maximum period of 05 years. - The award will initially be for 2 years and further extendible, based on performance review.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be an Indian citizen. 1. The applicant must have obtained PhD degree from a recognized University with first class (in terms of grades, etc.) in all preceding levels and a good academic record throughout. 1. The applicant must have a regular position in the institute and should be engaged in research. 1. The upper age limit for the fellowship is 40 years on the date of submission of application. 1. YFRF under Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme can be availed only once by a candidate in his/her career. 1. The applicant availing any other fellowship is not eligible to apply. 1. Proposals for allotment of YFRF are to be submitted through eligible institutions only. 1. Each institution in the proposal may submit up to three nominations for the award for each round of call for applications. ***Discontinuation of the Fellowship:*** 1. The performance of YFRF would be reviewed periodically as per the discretion of PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY. 1. A detailed performance assessment/review of award would be conducted annually and decision on continuation of YFRF would be taken accordingly. 1. If any fellow wishes to discontinue the fellowship, the institution should inform Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme immediately. One month's notice is to be given to DIC through the institution before the date of discontinuation. 1. The implementing institution should not incur any expenditure from the date of termination of the project or the date of resignation of the fellow. The institution will ensure the submission of work report and other requisite documents from YFRF awardee. 1. PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY reserves the right to hold/ stop/ terminate the Fellowship at any stage because of reasons including, but not limited to the following: - Appropriate progress is not being made. - The grant is not being utilized properly. - Violation/ Non-compliance of guidelines. - Any other reason, which is deemed appropriate by PhD Cell, DIC, MeitY.

application process.process: The scheme is an institutional scheme wherein nominations for YFRF are submitted by the eligible institution againt Call for Proposal (Invitation for Nominations) by PhD Cell, Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme Selection & Mode of Application:  PhD Cell invites nominations periodically from eligible institutions for award of YFRF under the scheme. Subsequently the nominations are evaluated by experts and accordingly, the fellowships are awarded. The call for applications for YFRF will be notified by PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal  https://phd.dic.gov.in Each eligible institutions can submit up to a maximum of three nominations for the YFRF award to PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal  https://phd.dic.gov.in/ The proposal should define clear objectives, outcomes and deliverables against the award. The eligible institutions will be allowed to submit nominations for the award once in a year against a call for nominations by PhD Cell. PhD Cell will scrutinize and evaluate these nominations periodically. The stages of evaluation will be decided by PhD Cell considering different aspects including but not limited to: No. of nominations received. Suitability of the received nominations, etc. Note: PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY reserves the right to screen and consider suitable candidates. Just fulfilling the minimum eligibility criteria would not entitle one to be selected. PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY may change the T&C at its discretion, if deemed necessary. ( User Manual )

Shridev Suman State Merit Scholarship.details: The "Shridev Suman State Merit Scholarship" scheme is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students who qualify in the eligibility test conducted by SCERT Uttarakhand. The scholarship is awarded to the next five students from each development block of Uttarakhand who are not selected for the Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship.
Shridev Suman State Merit Scholarship.benefits: - On the basis of the declared results of the eligibility test conducted by SCERT Uttarakhand, the scholarship is awarded to the next five students from each of the 95 development blocks of Uttarakhand (95 × 5 = 475) who are not selected for the Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship. - Each selected student receives ₹1,000/- per month for a duration of 10 months.
Shridev Suman State Merit Scholarship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be an institutional student of Class 8 in any government, local body, or government-aided school (excluding central and residential schools) in Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must have passed the annual Class 7 examination with a minimum of 50% marks (40% for reserved categories). 1. There is no restriction on the annual income of parents or guardians. 1. The scholarship will be awarded for a period of 4 years, from Class 9 to Class 12.

application process.process: To appear in the scholarship examination, students can obtain the application form from the office of the Block Education Officer or download it from the School Education Department’s website ( https://schooleducation.uk.gov.in ) or SCERT Uttarakhand’s website ( https://scert.uk.gov.in ) during September–October every year. A photocopy of the application form is also valid. No application or examination fee is charged. While filling out the application form, students must attach a passport-size photograph, Aadhaar card, Class 7 mark sheet, caste certificate, and disability certificate (if applicable). All information must be filled in correctly, and the completed form should be submitted to the Principal of the school where the student is enrolled. The Principal will verify the form based on the attached documents and school records, attest the photograph, and forward the verified form to the Block Education Officer’s office by the tentative date of 12 November. After submission, the Block Education Officer issues the admit card. Students can collect the admit card either from their school or the Block Education Officer’s office. The examination is conducted every year in the month of January. After the successful completion of the process, the school Principal informs the student. The student must provide their Aadhaar card and Aadhaar-linked bank account details to the school, following which the scholarship amount is transferred directly to the student’s bank account.

Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Puraskar Yo.details: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Puraskar Yojana” was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to encourage academic excellence among students and provides cash prizes to those who secure first, second, or third positions in their graduation or post-graduation studies at the university level.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Puraskar Yo.benefits: **At the university level, students securing first, second, and third positions in graduation examinations are awarded:** - 1st Position: ₹50,000/- - 2nd Position: ₹30,000/- - 3rd Position: ₹15,000/- **Students securing first, second, and third positions in post-graduation examinations are awarded:** - 1st Position: ₹75,000/- - 2nd Position: ₹60,000/- - 3rd Position: ₹30,000/-
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Puraskar Yo.eligibility: 1. This scheme is applicable to the top three students who have obtained the highest marks at the university level after completing their courses in the Arts, Science, and Commerce faculties at the graduate and post-graduate levels in the state’s Shridev Suman University, Kumaon University, Soban Singh Jeena University, and their affiliated colleges. 1. Students who have obtained less than 60% marks will be ineligible under the scheme. 1. Students who have appeared in improvement examinations in graduation or post-graduation, backlog examinations, or those who have dropped out in any year and then progressed to the next class will also be ineligible for the scheme.

application process.process: The department requests a faculty-wise list of students who have obtained the highest marks in government universities and their affiliated colleges. The scholarships are credited directly to the students’ accounts after their data is verified through the Samarth portal. Students do not need to apply for this themselves.

Rishi and Milan Khosla Scholarship Schem.details: The scheme “Rishi and Milan Khosla Scholarship Scheme” was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote higher education among girl students in the state by providing scholarships to those pursuing their first year of post-graduation in various government colleges across Uttarakhand.
Rishi and Milan Khosla Scholarship Schem.benefits: A scholarship of ₹51,000/- per student is given to 50 girl students enrolled in the first year of post-graduation at various government colleges across the state.
Rishi and Milan Khosla Scholarship Schem.eligibility: 1. The applicant (girl student) must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The girl student must be studying in a government college in Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in the first year of a postgraduate (PG) course. 1. The applicant’s family annual income from all sources should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-. 1. The girl student must have obtained a minimum of 60% marks in graduation.

application process.process: The scheme is implemented under a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of Uttarakhand and the Rishi and Milan Khosla Foundation, Noida, Uttar Pradesh. Applications are generally invited by the Department of Higher Education during December–January, after informing the respective colleges. To avail the scholarship, the girl student must apply online at  www.vidyasaarathi.co.in  during the specified period. Along with the application, the student is required to submit her Aadhaar card, bank account details, permanent residence certificate, income certificate, mark sheets of all years of graduation, college ID, and proof of admission in post-graduation.

Sanskrit Chhatra Pratibha Samman.details: The scheme “Sanskrit Chhatra Pratibha Samman” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to encourage and motivate students to pursue higher studies in Sanskrit by rewarding those who achieve top positions in the subject at the high school, intermediate, undergraduate, and postgraduate levels.
Sanskrit Chhatra Pratibha Samman.benefits: **Awards:** • First Place: ₹5,100/- • Second Place: ₹4,100/- • Third Place: ₹3,100/-
Sanskrit Chhatra Pratibha Samman.eligibility: Students securing First, Second, or Third position in Sanskrit subject in the following examinations will be eligible: - High School Examination (Uttarakhand Vidyalaya Shiksha Parishad) - Intermediate Examination (Uttarakhand Vidyalaya Shiksha Parishad) - Purva Madhyama Examination (Uttarakhand Sanskrit Shiksha Parishad) - Uttar Madhyama Examination (Uttarakhand Sanskrit Shiksha Parishad) - Shastri and Acharya Examinations (Uttarakhand Sanskrit University, Haridwar and Central Sanskrit University, Campus Devprayag, etc.) - Graduate and Postgraduate classes of higher education institutions (on the basis of marks obtained in Sanskrit subject).

application process.process: The Academy obtains information about the highest-scoring students in Sanskrit in the relevant High School and Intermediate Examinations through correspondence with the Secretary of the respective Board. Similarly, the list of students securing First, Second, and Third positions in Sanskrit at the undergraduate and postgraduate levels is obtained through correspondence with the Controller of Examinations/Registrar of the respective University. An award ceremony is organized, during which payment is made through cheque, and the students are honoured with certificates and other recognitions.

Saksham Scholarship.details: The “Saksham Scholarship” is implemented by the Department of Technical Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support meritorious differently-abled students pursuing graduate-level studies in the state by providing them with financial assistance in the form of scholarships.
Saksham Scholarship.benefits: Financial assistance of ₹50,000/- per annum is provided for Graduate-level studies.
Saksham Scholarship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must have at least 40% disability. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.

application process.process: These scholarships are administered by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). Under the AICTE scheme, applications are invited through the  National Scholarship Portal  (NSP) between September and December, and scholarships are awarded on the basis of merit. Applicants are required to submit their high school and intermediate mark sheets and certificates, along with an income certificate. For the Saksham Yojana, a valid disability certificate of at least 40%, issued by the competent authority, is also mandatory. For all AICTE schemes, students must first apply online through the institute where they are studying. The application is verified by the Principal of the institute, then by the State Level Officer (S.L.O.), and finally forwarded to the AICTE, New Delhi, for approval.

Vidhya Sadhana Yojana Gujarat.details: The "Vidhya Sadhana Yojana" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to encourage Scheduled Tribe girls to continue education beyond class 8th, especially in remote areas where schools are located several kilometers away. Under this scheme, free bicycles are gifted to Scheduled Tribe girls studying in class 9th, enabling them to commute conveniently to schools.
Vidhya Sadhana Yojana Gujarat.benefits: - Free bicycles given to the scheduled tribal girl students as a gift.
Vidhya Sadhana Yojana Gujarat.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a girl student. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category. 1. The applicant should be studying in class 9th in a recognized school.1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 2:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 3:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 4:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 5:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 6:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 7:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 8:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 9:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 1:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 2:  Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 3:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. Note 4:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 5:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 6:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 7:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 8:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Higher Education Assistance Scheme.details: The "Higher Education Assistance Scheme" by the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board, Labour & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide encouragement to children of workers and reduce the financial burden of education by offering higher educational assistance to meritorious students, addressing the economic challenges faced by workers' families in pursuing quality education for their children. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹20,000/- for students securing admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery courses and ₹10,000/- for students securing admission in any other graduate level courses for students who have passed Standard 12 board examination in the year 2024 with 70 percent or above percentile. The applicant must be a child of a worker whose parent is working in a factory or institution in Gujarat state and whose parent has been contributing to the Labour Welfare Fund office for the last one year. The applications for this scheme are accepted online. The application deadline is the last date of February of the respective year.
Higher Education Assistance Scheme.benefits: > **Financial Assistance for Medical Education** Direct Benefit Transfer of ₹20,000/- for students securing admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery courses. > **Financial Assistance for Other Graduate Courses** Direct Benefit Transfer of ₹10,000/- for students securing admission in any other graduate level courses.
Higher Education Assistance Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a child of a worker employed in a factory or institution in Gujarat state. - The applicant must have passed 12th Standard board examination in the respective year. - The applicant must have secured 70% or above percentile in 12th Standard board examination. - The applicant must have secured admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery or any other graduate level course. - The applicant must ensure that their parent is working in a factory or institution located in Gujarat state. - The applicant must ensure that their parent has been contributing to the Labour Welfare Fund office for the last one year continuously. - The applicant must submit the application by the last date of February of the respective year. - The applicant must have completed 12th Standard examination specifically in the respective year.
Higher Education Assistance Scheme.exclusions: - The applicant must not have secured admission in any foreign educational institution. - The applicant must not be pursuing education abroad under this scheme.

application process.process: Registration Process Step 1:  The applicant must visit the  Sanman Portal  of the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board. Step 2:  On the home page, navigate to the ‘Citizen Login’ tab, and click ‘Please Register Here’. Step 3:  On the Registration page, provide your Aadhaar Card Number, select user type and then enter your Labour Welfare Fund Account Number. Click on ‘Fetch’ & verify the details. Enter user details and create a password. Application Process Step 1:  The applicant must visit the Sanman Portal: https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/ of the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board. Step 2:  On the home page, navigate to the ‘Citizen Login’ tab, and click ‘Login’. Login using your User ID and Password. Step 3:  Navigate to the Online Application Page of the scheme. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. For each uploaded document, the corresponding document number must be entered wherever required. Step 4:  Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. A confirmation email with the application Number will be sent on the registered email ID. *Applications made with incomplete/wrong details will not be entertained. *The final decision regarding assistance will be with the Welfare Commissioner. The jurisdiction will be Ahmedabad.

6% Interest Subsidy on Loans taken throu.details: The "6% Interest Subsidy on Loans taken through Banks for Study Abroad" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to support Scheduled Tribe (ST) students pursuing higher education abroad by reducing their financial burden. Under this scheme, beneficiaries receive an interest subsidy on education loans with a maximum subsidy for three years.
6% Interest Subsidy on Loans taken throu.benefits: - Interest subsidy of 6% per annum on loans taken through banks for foreign education. - Maximum subsidy of ₹1,50,000 for 3 years. - Applicable on loans up to ₹25,00,000.
6% Interest Subsidy on Loans taken throu.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat’s tribal areas. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe category. 1. The applicant must have passed Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) or equivalent examination. 1. The applicant must have secured admission in a recognized foreign university for higher studies.

application process.process: Step 1:   The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) at the office of the Project Administrator, Gujarat Tribal Development Corporation, Gandhinagar, and all tribal district offices and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attestted, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Tribal District Sponsorship Administrator. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the office of the Tribal District Sponsorship Administrator. to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Scholarship Scheme for Students Studying.details: The “Scholarship Scheme for Students Studying in Government Colleges” was implemented by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to encourage higher education by providing financial support to meritorious students in government colleges. Under this scheme, students of Science, Commerce, and Arts streams receive annual scholarships to pursue higher education.
Scholarship Scheme for Students Studying.benefits: > Scholarships are provided to students: - Science stream: ₹3,000 per annum. - Commerce stream: ₹2,000 per annum. - Arts stream: ₹1,000 per annum.
Scholarship Scheme for Students Studying.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat state. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be studying in a government college in Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be pursuing higher education in Arts, Commerce, or Science stream. 1. The applicant must have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. 1. The applicant should have secured a rank in the first, second, or third position at the university level in Arts, Commerce, or Science.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 2:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 3:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 4:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 5:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 6:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 7:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 8:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 9:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 1:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 2:  Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 3:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. Note 4:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 5:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 6:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 7:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 8:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Enhancement of Spoken English Programme.details: The scheme “Enhancement of Spoken English Programme” is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance the spoken English skills of students of Classes 9 to 12 studying in all government schools across the districts of the state.
Enhancement of Spoken English Programme.benefits: The programme was implemented for approximately 39,000 students of Classes 9 to 12 across 109 government schools in all districts of the state.
Enhancement of Spoken English Programme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student of Classes 9 to 12 from one of the 109 selected government secondary schools in Uttarakhand.

application process.process: All students from the 109 selected schools, chosen based on factors such as internet connectivity, student strength, and availability of devices for online programmes.

Amit Gautam Memorial Scholarship (B.Tech.details: The “Amit Gautam Memorial Scholarship (B.Tech in Electronics Engineering - 4th Year)” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support meritorious students pursuing a B.Tech in Electronics Engineering who are in their 4th year of study by providing a one-year scholarship.
Amit Gautam Memorial Scholarship (B.Tech.benefits: The eligible student will receive ₹7,000/- per year as a scholarship.
Amit Gautam Memorial Scholarship (B.Tech.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in the 4th year of the B.Tech (Electronics Engineering) course at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar. 1. The scholarship is awarded for a duration of one year only.

application process.process: First, applications are invited from students in the prescribed format. Thereafter, a committee constituted by the Vice-Chancellor evaluates the received applications as per the prescribed procedure. Based on the committee’s recommendations, the Vice-Chancellor grants approval, following which the selected students receive the scholarship amount.

Hands-on Training and Exposure Visits un.details: The scheme “Hands-on Training and Exposure Visits under Experiential Learning” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Science Education and Research Centre (USERC) under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to enhance scientific understanding and practical skills among researchers, professors, and students by providing one-week residential hands-on training and exposure visits in collaboration with reputed institutions.
Hands-on Training and Exposure Visits un.benefits: Free residential one-week hands-on training (certificate programme) sessions are being organized on various subjects to provide practical knowledge to the researchers, professors, and students of the state in collaboration with various institutions, in which UG/PG students, researchers, and teachers from higher education institutions across all districts of the state are participating. Meals are also provided free of cost during this residential training.
Hands-on Training and Exposure Visits un.eligibility: 1. Graduates/postgraduate students, researchers, and professors from all educational institutions (both government and private) across Uttarakhand are eligible to participate.

application process.process: Students must first have their applications forwarded by their respective college or university and submit them to USERC through a Google Form. USERC then carries out the selection process (complete applications with the desired training subject and required qualifications are selected on a first-come, first-served basis), after which the selected students receive free residential training.

One-day Seminar on Vedic Mathematics.details: The scheme “One-day Seminar on Vedic Mathematics” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a common platform for officers, teachers, and students from universities, colleges, schools, and other departments to actively participate and gain knowledge about the simplified curriculum of Vedic Mathematics and its easy-to-apply methods.
One-day Seminar on Vedic Mathematics.benefits: Participants of the seminar will gain knowledge about the simplified course of Vedic Mathematics and learn its easy and practical methods.
One-day Seminar on Vedic Mathematics.eligibility: 1. Officers, teachers, and students from universities, colleges, schools, and other departments are eligible to participate in the seminar.

application process.process: After finalizing the date, time, and venue of the seminar, the convener will submit the list of invitees, who will then be formally invited through letters issued by the Academy Secretary.

Ashramshalas (Grant in Aid).details: The scheme "Ashramshalas (Grant in Aid)" was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide comprehensive educational support to Scheduled Tribe students who cannot afford education due to weak economic conditions, addressing the issue of children being forced into traditional occupations or other jobs to support their families instead of attending school. The scheme provides residential schooling facilities with complete boarding and lodging arrangements, where tribal students receive free education, hostel facilities, books, food, and items of daily necessity through 100% grant-in-aid to Non-Governmental Organizations operating these schools across standards 1st to 12th.
Ashramshalas (Grant in Aid).benefits: ##### ***Financial Grant to Ashramshalas*** A grant of ₹1,500/- per month is provided to the Ashramshala for every enrolled child to cover all expenses related to education, boarding, and lodging. _*The grant is provided on a monthly basis to the Ashramshalas for continuous support of enrolled students._ ##### ***Benefits Provided to Students*** - Free education without any tuition fees. - Free hostel facilities and accommodation. - Free books and educational materials. - Free food and meals. - Items of daily necessity free of cost. _*All benefits (education, boarding, lodging, food, books, and daily necessities) are provided continuously throughout the academic year._ ##### ***Conditions*** - The Ashramshala must maintain the minimum enrollment requirements as specified in the eligibility criteria. - The Ashramshala must continue to provide all stipulated facilities (education, boarding, lodging, food, books, and daily necessities) to the enrolled students. - The Ashramshala must comply with all regulations and guidelines set by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat.
Ashramshalas (Grant in Aid).eligibility: ##### ***For Ashramshalas (Educational Institutions)*** - The Ashramshala must enrol a minimum of 15 boys and 15 girls for the first time on inception. - The Ashramshala must enrol a minimum of 10 boys and 10 girls every year till 7th standard after the inception year. - The Ashramshala must be operated by a Non-Governmental Organization working in tribal areas. - The Ashramshala must be located within any district of Gujarat. - The Ashramshala must provide education for standards 1st to 8th (Ashramshala), standards 9th to 10th (Uttar Buniyadi Ashramshala), or standards 11th to 12th (Uchchattar Uttar Buniyadi Ashramshala). ##### ***For Students (Beneficiaries)*** - The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe category. - The applicant must be seeking admission to an Ashramshala for education from standard 1st to standard 12th.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Alternatively, the interested applicant may visit the Tribal Development Department, Govt. of Gujarat, and request the hard copy of the  prescribed format  of the application form from the designated staff. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Prepare a detailed proposal outlining your organization's capabilities, infrastructure facilities, proposed location, staff arrangements, and plan for providing education, boarding, and lodging to Scheduled Tribe students. Submit the completed application form along with the comprehensive proposal and all supporting documents to the Tribal Development Department. Inspection and Approval The Tribal Development Department will conduct an inspection of the proposed Ashramshala premises to verify the infrastructure, facilities, and readiness to operate the residential school. Cooperate fully during the inspection and provide any additional information or clarification requested by the inspection team. Upon successful verification and approval, the Tribal Development Department will issue a formal sanction letter approving the grant-in-aid with terms and conditions, grant amount of ₹1,500/- per month per student, and guidelines for operation.

Establishment and Operation of STEM (Sci.details: The scheme “Establishment and Operation of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) Laboratories” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Science Education and Research Centre (USERC) under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to establish STEM laboratories in schools across Uttarakhand to provide students of classes 6 to 12 with hands-on science, technology, engineering, and mathematics learning opportunities and strengthen their practical understanding of scientific concepts.
Establishment and Operation of STEM (Sci.benefits: Under this, 41 STEM laboratories have been established across the state to strengthen practical science education for secondary and higher secondary level students and to provide hands-on learning activities for students of classes 6 to 12, enabling them to conduct science-related experiments in these labs.
Establishment and Operation of STEM (Sci.eligibility: 1. Students must be studying in classes 6 to degree level in a school in Uttarakhand. 1. Students from schools with a STEM laboratory, as well as those from nearby schools, are eligible to use the STEM laboratories.

application process.process: All students of schools with STEM laboratories can conduct experiments in the laboratories established in their schools, while students from schools without laboratories can avail of this benefit by visiting nearby schools that have STEM labs.

Scheme To Provide Grant To The Instituti.details: The scheme "Scheme To Provide Grant To The Institution(s)/Individual(s) For Long Term Project In The Field Of Art And Culture" was launched by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to give financial support to the institution(s)/individual(s) involved in long term projects in the field of Art and Culture. The scheme provides grants up to 80% of the total expenditure involved, subject to a maximum ceiling of ₹5,00,000/- per annum. It also aims to encourage young talents in the State to excel under guidance outside the State and provides financial support to students seeking basic or advanced education/training in Art and Culture by way of scholarships. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Art and Culture/Government. The applications for this scheme are accepted when the Sub-Committee is constituted and meets as and when required to consider applications.
Scheme To Provide Grant To The Instituti.benefits: - ***Financial Grant:*** Eligible institutions or individuals shall be entitled for a grant to the extent of 80% of the total expenditure involved.- ***Maximum Ceiling:*** The maximum financial grant limit provided under this scheme is ₹5,00,000/- (Indian Rupees Five Lakhs) per annum.- ***Support for Talent and Education:*** The scheme encourages young talents in the State to excel their talent to reach the highest possible standard/merit under the guidance of a renowned teacher/artist outside the State.- ***Scholarships:*** Financial support is given to students seeking to get basic or advanced education/training in any field of Art and Culture by way of scholarships.- ***Disbursement Conditions:*** The actual financial grant received shall be decided by the Sub-Committee/Department of Art and Culture/Government. This decision is based on the nature and scope of the project, the reputation of the institution, and taking into consideration the overall impact on the society.- ***Fund Restriction:*** The Department/Government may restrict the number of institutions according to the availability of funds.- ***Disbursement:*** The amount is disbursed to the eligible institution(s)/individual(s) in the form of a cheque, after the Director of Art and Culture obtains Government approval based on the Sub-Committee's recommendations.
Scheme To Provide Grant To The Instituti.eligibility: ##### ***For Institutions*** - The applicant must be registered under the Society’s Registration Act, 1860. - The applicant must be registered under the Indian Trust Act. - The applicant must be involved in a long term project in the field of Art and Culture. ##### ***For Individuals*** - The applicant must be from the Goan community. - The applicant must be a resident of Goa for 15 years or more. - The applicant must be involved in a long term project in the field of Art and Culture. - The applicant must have contributed at least 15 years in the relevant field.

application process.process: Step 1: Application Submission in Writing The applicant, whether an eligible institution or an individual, should apply for financial assistance under the scheme by submitting an application in writing. This written application must be submitted along with all the stipulated documentation relevant to the applicant type (Institution or Individual), such as the Detailed Project Report and eligibility proof documents. Step 2: Consideration by Sub-Committee Once the application is received, the appointed Sub-Committee shall meet as and when required to consider the applications received under this scheme. The Sub-Committee is responsible for assessing the applications and giving its formal recommendations, including the names of the approved institutions and the specific amount sanctioned to each, for further government approval. Step 3: Obtaining Government Approval After the recommendations are formally received from the Sub-Committee, the Director of Art and Culture is responsible for obtaining the necessary Government approval for the recommendations. This government approval confirms the sanctioning of the grant amount to the eligible applicant(s). Step 4: Disbursement of Financial Assistance Following the successful obtaining of the Government approval, the Director of Art and Culture shall disburse the sanctioned amount to the eligible institution(s) or individual(s). This financial assistance will be provided to the beneficiary in the physical form of a cheque. Help & Support / Grievance Redressal If any grievance arises out of implementation of this scheme, the concerned matter shall be heard and decided by the Minister for Art and Culture. The decision rendered by the Minister for Art and Culture regarding such grievances shall be considered final.

Scheme To Provide Assistance To Students.details: The scheme "Scheme To Provide Assistance To Students Seeking Education Outside Goa In Any Field Of Art And Culture" was launched by the Directorate of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage and give opportunity to the young talents in the State to excel their talent to reach the highest possible standard/merit under the guidance of a renowned teacher/artist outside the State. The scheme provides financial support to students seeking to get basic or advanced education/training in any field of Art and Culture, such as music, dance, theatre, fine arts, folk arts, or photography (fields of visual and performing art). The applications for this scheme are accepted when the Directorate of Art and Culture releases an advertisement/press note on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications. The scheme shall remain in force up to 31st March 2027.
