Note 4:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 5:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 6:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 7:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 8:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hoste.details: The “Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hostels (SC)” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide free residential facilities, meals, and educational support to scheduled caste (SC) students. Under this scheme, students who have passed class 10th and are pursuing further studies are accommodated in government-run hostels with free food, lodging, and academic resources.
Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hoste.benefits: - Free Accommodation in Government Hostels. - Free Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner). - Free Educational Facilities such as textbooks and study material.
Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hoste.eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed class 10th (SSC) or higher from GSEB/CBSE.1. The applicant must be enrolled in a regular course in a college within the same district as the hostel. 1. The boy student's annual family income must not exceed ₹2,50,000. No income limit for girl students. 1. The applicant must have scored at least 50% marks in the last annual exam.

application process.process: Step 01:  The eligible applicant may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal:  https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/ Step 02:  On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘ Please Register Here ’. Step 03:  Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. Step 04:  After successful registration, the applicants can login through their User ID and Password. Step 05:  Now, click on ‘User Profile’ to update your profile. Step 06:  Fill in all the mandatory information and then click on ‘Update’. Step 07:  After updating the profile successfully, select the scheme appearing on the home page; an application form will open. Step 08:  Fill in all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the relevant documents. Step 09:  Now agree with the terms & conditions and click on ‘Save Application’. Step 10:  Submit the application form and take out the print of the application for future reference. The applicant can note down the application number to track the application status by logging into the portal using their User ID and Password. User Manual

Sainik School Scholarship Located Outsid.details: The scheme "Sainik School Scholarship Located Outside the Uttarakhand" is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from Uttarakhand who are studying in classes 6 to 12 at Sainik Schools located outside the state.
Sainik School Scholarship Located Outsid.benefits: **Rate of Scholarships:** - ₹40,000/- per annum for students from families with a monthly income up to ₹12,000/-. - ₹30,000/- per annum for students from families with a monthly income of ₹12,001/- to ₹15,000/-. - ₹20,000/- per annum for students from families with a monthly income of ₹15,001/- to ₹18,000/-. - ₹10,000/- per annum for students from families with a monthly income of ₹18,001/- to ₹22,000/-.
Sainik School Scholarship Located Outsid.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. - The applicant must be studying in Classes 6 to 12 in a Sainik School located outside Uttarakhand. - The scholarship will be awarded on the basis of the applicant’s family income. - The applicant is not eligible if the monthly family income exceeds ₹22,000/-.

application process.process: The student studying in a Sainik School located outside Uttarakhand will apply for a scholarship in that school. Along with the application, the student must submit the following documents: a valid family income certificate issued by the tehsil, permanent residence certificate, Aadhaar card, and proof of an Aadhaar-linked bank account. All Sainik Schools located outside the state will forward the applications to Sainik School Ghorakhal. Sainik School Ghorakhal will compile the applications, prepare a proposal, and send it to the department. The department will allocate funds to the concerned schools through Sainik School Ghorakhal, and the schools will disburse the scholarship to the students via DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer).

IELTS & TOEFL Training Assistance.details: The "IELTS & TOEFL Training Assistance" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to empower Scheduled Tribe (ST) students aspiring to pursue higher studies abroad after class 12th. Under this scheme, the tribal students receive structured guidance, IELTS and TOEFL training, and financial assistance to prepare for admissions to reputed foreign universities, with additional support for visa and passport processes.
IELTS & TOEFL Training Assistance.benefits: - Financial aid of ₹3,10,000/- per student to cover IELTS and TOEFL training expenses.
IELTS & TOEFL Training Assistance.eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. 1. The applicant must be a student and must have passed class 12th (HSC).1. The applicant should be residing in a notified tribal area of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must intend to pursue higher education abroad. 1. The applicant must require IELTS or TOEFL training as part of their admission preparation.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Project Administrator's Office of all districts and the head office of Gujarat Tribal Development Corporation, Gandhinagar (all tribal districts), and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Project Administrator's Office of all districts.

Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.details: The “Post-Doctoral Fellowship (PDF)” is a component of the “Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics and IT”, implemented by the Digital India Corporation under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India. The objective of the scheme is to promote R&D, create an innovative ecosystem, and enhance India’s competitiveness in the knowledge-intensive sectors of Electronics System Design & Manufacturing (ESDM) and IT/IT Enabled Services (IT/ITES). This fellowship is meant for those who have a proven track record as evident from their research publications and recognitions. Support is provisioned for 225 Post-Doctoral Fellowships for candidates for a period of one year, to encourage specialized research in emerging areas.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.benefits: ***Nature of Support:*** - **Research Fellowship:** ₹1.08 Lakh/Month - **Contingency Grant:** ₹1 Lakh for 1 year (on re-imbursement and pro-rata basis depending on the period spent under the award). The claim would be submitted by the awardee through respective institution to PhD Cell in prescribed format. - The fellowship is tenable only in India and can be implemented in any of the recognized & eligible academic and R&D institutions. - Contingency Grant can be used for minor equipment, consumables and similar items relevant to the research work. The host institution should provide necessary administrative and infrastructural support for the PDF fellow. - There is no provision for providing research personnel support under the scheme. The fellow is expected to undertake the research objectives by himself/herself during the entire duration of the fellowship. - PDF is a full-time assignment. The fellows are not eligible to receive any other fellowship from any Government or Non-Government source during the tenure of the fellowship. - Post-doctoral positions are non-transferrable. The research work is to be carried out in the same eligible institution at which PDF seat is allocated and the fellow is enrolled. ***Duration of Support:*** - The fellowship is purely a temporary assignment, and is tenable for a period of 1 year. - The award will be for one year initially and extendible based on performance review by PhD Cell, DIC, MeitY.
Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme for Electronics.eligibility: Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme is an institutional scheme wherein eligible institutions submit proposals requesting PDF seats against an active call for proposal by Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme, DIC, MeitY. <br> 1. The call for proposal for PDF seats will be notified by PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal https://phd.dic.gov.in/ and/or email. 2. Proposals for allotment of PDF seats are to be submitted by eligible institutions only. Suitable number of seats would be allotted to institutions for further enrollment of PDF fellows on these seats following the scheme guidelines. 3. The institution may design/have its own application form for advertisement of PDF; however, the guidelines for PDF are to be followed which must include the following: <br> 1. The PDF applicant should be an Indian citizen. 1. The PDF applicant must have obtained PhD degree from a recognized University with first class (in terms of grades, etc.) in all preceding levels and a good academic record throughout. 1. The eligible participating institution must ensure that the PDF applicant should have completed PhD within the past 5 years on the last date of submission of application to the institution. 1. The upper age limit for the fellowship is 40 years on the date of submission of application to the eligible participating institution. 1. A suitable Mentor/Guide under whom the proposed research would be carried out, must be identified by the institution. 1. Mentor/Guide of PDF fellow must hold a regular academic/research position in a recognized institution in India. He/she should hold a Ph.D. degree in Science or Engineering. 1. Preference would be given to the PDF applicants who have active industry linkages and their research proposal is directed towards industry specific problems. 1. The research proposal of the PDF applicant, to be submitted to the institution, should define clear objectives, outcomes and deliverables against the award. 1. PDF applicants currently in regular employment will not be considered. However, scientists or researchers with temporary positions in academia or research institutions would be considered however, they would be required to relinquish their current roles if selected for the fellowship. 1. PDF applicants should not have completed their PhD at the same institution where the PDF fellowship is to be awarded. 1. The applicant must have a proven track record as evident from their research publications and recognitions. 1. The applicant should not be availing any other fellowship. ***Discontinuation of the Fellowship*** 1. If any fellow wishes to discontinue the fellowship, the institution should inform PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY immediately. One month’s notice is to be given by the institution before the date of discontinuation. 1. The implementing institution should not incur any expenditure from the date of termination of the award/project or the date of resignation of the fellow. The institution will responsible for submission of work report and other requisite documents. 1. In case the post-doctoral fellow undertakes any full/part-time assignment, his/her PDF award under the scheme would be discontinued. 1. PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY reserves the right to hold/ stop/ discontinue the fellowship at any stage, if - Appropriate progress is not being made. - The grant is not being utilized properly. - Violation/ Non-compliance of guidelines. - Any other reason, which is deemed appropriate by PhD Cell, DIC, MeitY.

application process.process: Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme is an institutional scheme wherein eligible institutions submit proposals requesting PDF seats against an active call for proposal by Visvesvaraya PhD Scheme, DIC, MeitY. Mode of Application: Proposals for allotment of PDF seats are to be submitted by eligible institutions only. Suitable number of seats would be allotted to institutions for further enrollment of PDF fellows on these seats following the scheme guidelines. The call for proposal for PDF seats will be notified by PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY through the web portal  https://phd.dic.gov.in/  and/or email. The institution may design/have its own application form for advertisement of PDF; however, the guidelines for PDF are to be followed. Note: Just fulfilling the minimum eligibility criteria should not entitle a candidate to be selected. PhD Cell, DIC; MeitY may change the T&C at its discretion, if deemed necessary.

Residential- Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidya.details: The "Residential - Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidyalaya/ Rajiv Gandhi Abhinav Vidyalaya" scheme is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide free and accessible education for children from Class 6 to 12 by offering free education, accommodation, meals, study materials, sports facilities, etc. across all Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidyalaya / Rajiv Gandhi Abhinav Vidyalaya in the state.
Residential- Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidya.benefits: - Students from Class 6 to 12 are provided with free accommodation, education, meals, sports facilities, and other essential services. - In these schools, 50% of the total seats are reserved for girls and 50% for boys, with 80% of the seats reserved for students from rural areas and 20% for students from urban areas. Reservations for SC, ST, OBC, EWS, orphans, and other eligible categories are applicable within these seats. - Admissions to these schools are only for Class 6.
Residential- Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidya.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be studying in Class 5 in Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must have passed Classes 3 and 4 from the same school where the applicant is currently studying in Class 5.

application process.process: For admission, the Uttarakhand Board of School Education, Ramnagar conducts an entrance examination. The Board invites applications from students through advertisements published every year from September to December. The application form can be downloaded from the Board’s website:  https://ubse.uk.gov.in /. Along with the form, the applicant must attach and submit the following documents to the school where they are currently studying: photograph, Aadhaar card, caste certificate, Economically Weaker Section (EWS) certificate (for general category), orphan certificate, mark sheets of Classes 3 and 4, and the admission card of Class 5. All completed application forms are submitted to the Block Education Officer’s office by the respective school. After submission, the applicant receives the admission card from the school and must appear for the entrance examination in February. Based on the merit list, the school informs the selected applicant, who then takes admission in Class 6 at a residential Rajiv Gandhi Navodaya Vidyalaya / Rajiv Gandhi Abhinav Vidyalaya.

Combined Merit Scholarship.details: The scheme "Combined Merit Scholarship" by the Higher Education Department, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial assistance to students of Assam studying in first semester degree courses and master's degree courses in any recognized colleges or universities in the state and other states of the country, focusing on students with uniformly good academic records and at least 60% marks in last qualifying examinations. The scheme provides access to poor students of the state and helps them achieve the benefits of higher education through merit-based scholarship support for undergraduate and postgraduate studies. The applicant must be selected and admitted in degree or master's degree courses in any recognized universities or colleges and must be domiciled in Assam. The scheme is implemented by Higher Education Department. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
Combined Merit Scholarship.benefits: > **Financial Assistance** - For Degree Courses: ₹300/- per month. - For Master Degree Courses: ₹500/- per month. - The scheme provides 200 scholarships for degree students (three years duration) and 100 scholarships for master degree students (two years duration). **Selection:** Based on merit and budget allocation. **Coverage:** Students pursuing general degree and master degree courses in Arts, Science, and Commerce disciplines. > **Mode of Disbursement** **Mode:** Direct Benefit Transfer system. **Conditions:** Subject to selection by the selection committee and financial sanction approval. > **Conditions for Availment** - The applicant must maintain enrollment in the respective degree or master's degree course throughout the scholarship period. - Academic performance standards must be maintained as per institutional and scheme requirements. - Regular attendance and compliance with all institutional rules and regulations. - Bank account must remain active and updated for Direct Benefit Transfer disbursement.
Combined Merit Scholarship.eligibility: - The applicant must be pursuing general degree or master's degree courses in Arts, Science, or Commerce discipline in any recognized institution. - The applicant must be domiciled in Assam (Permanent Resident Certificate document mandatory). - The applicant must have obtained minimum 60% marks in Higher Secondary examination for those applying for Combined Merit Degree Scholarship scheme. - The applicant must have obtained minimum 60% marks in General Degree (Three Year Degree Course) examination for those applying for Combined Merit Master Degree Scholarship scheme. - The applicant must possess relevant qualification from any recognized institution. - The applicant must have a valid bank account in their name (preferably in State Bank of India).

application process.process: Step 1:   Online Application Submission Visit the official website of the  Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Assam , and complete the online application form within the specified application period with all required personal, academic, and bank account details. Step 2:   Document Upload and Verification Upload scanned copies of all required documents including Permanent Resident Certificate, mark sheets, institutional certificate, photograph, and signature as per the prescribed format and specifications. Step 3:   Application Form Printout After successful online submission, take a printout of the completed application form and ensure all information is accurate and complete before proceeding to the next step. Step 4:   Physical Submission to Institution Submit the printed application form along with necessary copies of certificates and testimonials to the Registrar, Principal, or Head of the Institution where currently enrolled for verification and forwarding. Step 5:   Institutional Verification and Forwarding The Registrar, Principal, or Head of the Institution will collect, verify, and submit the hard copies of online forms along with all relevant certificates and testimonials under their seal and signature to the Directorate of Higher Education, Assam, Kahilipara, Guwahati - 781019. Step 6:   Selection Process The selection committee will evaluate applications strictly on the basis of merit in all cases and selection will be restricted as per budget allocation for the respective categories. Step 7:   Benefit Disbursement Selected beneficiaries will receive scholarship amounts through Direct Benefit Transfer system directly to their registered bank accounts on a monthly basis. *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference and correspondence with the implementing authorities.

Right to Education Act 2009 - Uttarakhan.details: The “Right to Education Act 2009” is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide free education, textbooks, uniforms, and the benefits of the PM Poshan Yojana to children up to Class 8 in private schools, targeting rural and urban children from weaker and deprived sections of Uttarakhand.
Right to Education Act 2009 - Uttarakhan.benefits: - Under Section 12(1)(c) of the Right to Education Act, children from weaker and disadvantaged sections in rural and urban areas of Uttarakhand are provided free education, textbooks, uniforms, and the benefits of the PM Poshan Yojana up to Class 8 in private schools. - In private schools, 25% of the total seats in the entry-level class are reserved for children from weaker and disadvantaged sections under Section 12(1)(c) of the Right to Education Act.
Right to Education Act 2009 - Uttarakhan.eligibility: **Children from the following categories will be eligible for admission up to Class 8 in private schools:** 1. **Children from weaker sections:** Those whose parents/guardians have an annual income of ₹55,000/- or less, or are BPL card holders. 1. **Children from disadvantaged classes:** SC, ST, and children belonging to the non-creamy layer of OBC, with a family annual income of up to ₹4.5 lakh. 1. Orphan children. 1. Children with physical disabilities. 1. Children living with HIV/AIDS or those dependent on parents who are HIV/AIDS positive. 1. Children dependent on disabled parents or parents affected by leprosy, with a family annual income of less than ₹4.5 lakh. 1. Children dependent on a divorced or widowed mother, with an annual family income of less than ₹80,000/-.

application process.process: Online applications are invited through an advertisement issued in February-March. Parents or guardians can apply online through the official portal or with the help of a cyber café. Before applying, the following documents are mandatory for children from weaker and disadvantaged sections: passport-size photograph of the child, Aadhaar card of the child and parents/guardians, caste certificate, permanent residence certificate, BPL certificate or income certificate (as applicable), disability certificate (if applicable), husband’s death certificate (in case of widow), divorce certificate (in case of divorcee), and orphan certificate (if applicable). After filling in the address details on the portal, the parent/guardian can view the list of schools available in their ward and must select the nearest school. Once the form is submitted online, a printout of the application, along with self-attested copies of the required documents, must be submitted to the office of the concerned Deputy Education Officer / Block Education Officer. All submitted documents are verified by a committee at the development block level. The details of students found eligible are updated and verified on the online portal. If the number of applications exceeds the available seats in private schools, the selection of children is done through an online lottery conducted at the state level.

Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme.details: The scheme "Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage higher education by providing financial assistance to meritorious students who have passed Class 10th or Class 12th and secured admission in diploma, degree, or higher education courses. The scheme provides varying amounts of financial support based on the course type and merit.
Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme.benefits: **Benefit Type****Details of Assistance****Number of Beneficiaries**Financial Assistance for Medical and Dental CoursesUp to ₹5,00,000/-250 StudentsFinancial Assistance for Engineering/Technology, Pharmacy Diploma to Degree, Ayurveda/Homeopathy, Nursing, Physiotherapy, Para-medical CoursesUp to ₹1,00,000/-1,130 StudentsFinancial Assistance for Diploma CoursesUp to ₹50,000/-120 StudentsFinancial Assistance for Higher Education CoursesUp to ₹10,000/-1,000 Students
Chief Minister Scholarship Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must be a student. - The applicant must have passed the Class 10th or Class 12th examination. - The applicant must have secured admission in a diploma course, a degree course after diploma, or a degree course after Class 12th. - The applicant must be pursuing medical, dental, engineering, technology, pharmacy, Ayurveda, homeopathy, nursing, physiotherapy, para-medical, or higher education courses. - The applicant must have a family annual income of less than or equal to ₹4,50,000/-.

application process.process: Step 1:  Students must register on  the  Official Website  using their Standard 10th or Standard 12th seat number. Do not use any spaces or special characters when entering the seat number. Step 2:  Students applying for a Diploma to Degree course should use their Diploma enrollment number for registration. Step 3:  The student's name must be entered exactly as it appears on their Standard 10 or 12 original marksheet. Step 4:  Enter the passing year according to the marksheet (e.g., 2024). Provide a personal mobile number that will remain active throughout the entire course of study, as important updates will be sent via SMS to this number. Step 5:  Enter and verify your 12-digit Aadhaar card number. Step 6:  Fill in the correct ration card details, including the ration card number and the student's member ID number. Step 7:  Provide accurate bank account details and an active email ID. Step 8:  Enter the percentage from the marksheet; if percentages are not available, calculate them according to the rules of the university or board. Step 9:  When selecting a stream, students from Arts and Commerce streams should choose "General Stream," while Science students should select "Science Stream".

Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana.details: The scheme "Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to create ample opportunities for technologically educated and skilled youth in the state by encouraging students to enter and complete science stream education up to Class 12th. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹25,000/- over two years to students of Class 11th and 12th to support their education in science and help them complete their board examinations successfully.
Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana.benefits: - **Class 11th Benefit:** ₹10,000/- per annum, paid as a monthly stipend of ₹1,000/- for 10 months. - **Class 12th Benefit:** ₹15,000/- per annum. Students will receive a monthly stipend of ₹1,000/- for 10 months (₹10,000) - **Additional Benefit:** ₹5,000/- after passing the Class 12th board examination.
Namo Saraswati Vignan Sadhana Yojana.eligibility: - The applicant must be a student. - The applicant must have studied in a government or grant-in-aid school in Class 9th and 10th. - The applicant must have scored 50% or more in the Class 10 board examination. - The applicant must have taken admission in the science stream in a government, grant-in-aid, or self-financed school recognized by GSHSEB (Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board) or CBSE (Central Board of Secondary Education). - If the applicant has studied in a recognized self-financed school for Class 9 and/or 10, the family’s annual income must be ₹6,00,000/- or less.

application process.process: Student Registration:  Schools must register eligible students on the Child Tracking System (CTS) portal of Vidya Samiksha Kendra. Verification:  The Director of Schools will verify applications with the help of the District Education Officer, and upload the final list of eligible students on the dedicated "Namo Saraswati" portal. Payment:  Assistance is disbursed directly into the beneficiary’s mother’s bank account (or the student’s account, if required) through DBT.

Orientation Courses in Dramatics.details: The scheme "Orientation Courses in Dramatics" by the Tiatr Academy of Goa aims to improve the quality of tiatr performances. The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops covering script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These workshops are conducted as per the syllabus formulated by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, led by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field. The training is preliminary, intended to help tiatr artistes enhance performance standards. The applicant must be an individual interested in training in tiatr's various aspects, including song and music performances, and must submit a self-attested copy of their Aadhaar Card with the application. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Applications for this scheme are accepted through the local press or by invitation to Konkani Dramatic Troupes.
Orientation Courses in Dramatics.benefits: • **Training and Skill Enhancement:** The scheme provides orientation courses and workshops in various aspects of dramatics, including script writing, lyrics composition, direction, acting, stage setting, stage craft, background music, light effects, costumes, make-up, and the history of tiatr. These courses and workshops are intended to help tiatr artistes improve the standard and quality of tiatr performances. • **Expert Instruction:** Workshops are conducted by graduates of the National School of Drama or Kala Academy School of Drama, with tiatr-specific aspects handled by personnel involved in the field of tiatr, to ensure high-quality and relevant training for participants.
Orientation Courses in Dramatics.eligibility: - The applicant must be an individual. - The applicant must be interested in getting trained in various aspects of tiatr, including its song and music performances.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. *The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds.

Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technic.details: The "Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technical Diploma in Professional Courses" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to promote educational development among scheduled tribe (ST) students by supporting them in technical and professional training. Under this scheme, stipends are provided to the students undergoing training in state government or government-recognized Private industrial training institutes (ITIs) and centers, enabling them to meet academic and living expenses.
Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technic.benefits: - A monthly stipend of ₹400 for 12 months for the ITI and professional courses.
Swami Vivekanand Scholarship for Technic.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. 1. The applicant should be enrolled in a state government industrial training institute (ITI), or a government-recognized Private ITI, or a recognized one-year professional course. 1. The applicant’s family annual income should not exceed ₹1,20,000 in rural areas. 1. The applicant’s family annual income should not exceed ₹1,50,000 in urban areas.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 2:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 3:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 4:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 5:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 6:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 7:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 8:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 9:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 1:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 2:  Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 3:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. Note 4:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 5:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 6:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 7:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 8:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Educational Travel Promotion Scheme.details: The scheme "Educational Travel Promotion Scheme" by the Department of Education, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote the overall personality development of students, enhance their observation skills, and satisfy their curiosity to learn new things by supporting educational tours within the state. It provides financial assistance of ₹500/- per student per year to government secondary and higher secondary schools (including RMSA and Model/Model Day schools) to enable students to study with pleasure.
Educational Travel Promotion Scheme.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** ₹500/- per student per year is allocated to the school for organizing educational tours within the state.
Educational Travel Promotion Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a student. - The applicant must be enrolled in a government secondary and higher secondary school (including RMSA, Model/Model Day) of the state.

application process.process: The applicant school should submit an application as per the prescribed checklist with resolutions related to the plan and five high-resolution photographs related to the educational tour/project.

Samriddhi – Scheme for Scheduled Caste/S.details: The scheme "Samriddhi – Scheme for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Students for Setting Start-Ups" was launched by the All India Council for Technical Education. The scheme aims to provide opportunities for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students to design, launch, and run their own business or startup after formal education is completed or during their final year of education. The scheme provides a limited one-time financial assistance of ₹20,00,000/- (of which ₹1,00,000/- per year is a recurring grant) to the institute, which then selects nine registered startups of Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students and provides ₹2,00,000/- seed money to each startup.
Samriddhi – Scheme for Scheduled Caste/S.benefits: - Total funding provided is ₹20,00,000/-. - Limited one-time financial assistance of ₹20,00,000/- is provided to the Institute. - Seed money of ₹2,00,000/- per startup will be given, and this amount is non-refundable. - Funding is allocated for nine startups of Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students. - ₹2,00,000/- will be given to the institute specifically for meeting the expenditure associated with the selection procedure. - ₹1,00,000/- per year shall constitute a recurring grant portion of the total funding. > ***Other Details*** - The total duration of the Scheme shall be for a period of 2 years. - 100% of non-recurring funds are released at the time of the award of the scheme. - ₹1,00,000/- each is released as recurring funding for two consecutive years. - The seed money is provided to passed out or present students for starting their own enterprise after completion of the formal education from the same institute. > ***Conditions*** - The Institute must set up a committee to select nine already registered startups of Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students. - It is essential that the center has dedicated faculty serving as the Principal Coordinator and dedicated support staff to ensure smooth functioning and effective meeting of its objectives. - The Institute must devise a feedback mechanism to assess the importance of the program. - Feedback shall be obtained after each program from each of the beneficiaries. - If deemed necessary based on feedback, the Institute can update its curriculum for these programs. - Exclusions from Benefit - Startup beneficiaries who are already receiving benefits from other schemes of the All India Council for Technical Education or the Government of India will not be entitled to this scheme.
Samriddhi – Scheme for Scheduled Caste/S.eligibility: - The applicant must be an All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) approved institute or an All India Council for Technical Education approved University Department. - The applicant (Institute/University Department) must have been in existence for a period of at least 10 years. - The applicant (Institution) must possess a good incubation center. - The incubation center's activities must have been happening for at least 5 years. - The applicant (Institute) must have a minimum of 50 Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe students enrolled on average during the last 3 years. - The applicant (Institute) must comply with the guidelines of the Tribal Sub Plan and the Scheduled Caste Sub Plan of the Government of India. - Student Eligibility (For selection by the Institute) - The applicant (Student) must be in the final year of their degree or diploma course. - The applicant (Student) must have a registered company or startup in their name.

application process.process: Step 1: Accessing the Portal and Initial Login The applicant (Institute) must first log in to the existing  All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) Portal  utilizing the credentials previously provided by the All India Council for Technical Education. Following successful login, the institution must navigate to the All India Council for Technical Education Quality Improvement Schemes (AQIS) Application screen by clicking on the designated tab. Step 2: Reviewing and Inputting Institute Details The system will automatically populate various Institute Details on the AQIS Application – Institute Details form, such as the Permanent Institute Identification, Name of the Institute, Address, and Institution Type; these fields cannot be edited by the Institute. The Institute must then manually complete the required editable details, including the Institute District, Percentage Grant received from the Government, Permanent Account Number (PAN) details, the reference number of the Extension of Approval letter for the current year, and the official Email Identification of the Institute. Step 3: Entering and Confirming Bank Details The Institute must provide comprehensive Bank Details, specifying the Name of Bank (selected from a dropdown), Branch details, Account Number (entered and re-entered, converting to asterisks for security), Indian Financial System Code (IFSC Code, entered and re-entered, requiring 11 digits), Bank Magnetic Ink Character Recognition (MICR) Code, Bank Code, and Pin Code. After entering the data, the applicant must check the Declaration flag and click the "Save Bank Details" button, which renders the fields read-only and activates the "Confirm Bank Details" button. The institution must click "Confirm Bank Details" and then "Ok" to finalize the bank details, which makes this section read-only and enables the "New" button necessary for starting the AQIS Application. Step 4: Starting the Application and Scheme Selection The user must click the "New" button, which is enabled only after confirming the Bank Details, to create a new All India Council for Technical Education Quality Improvement Schemes (AQIS) Application. An error message will be displayed if the Institute is not approved by the All India Council for Technical Education. A unique AQIS Application Identification will be generated, and the applicant must select the "SAMRIDDHI-Programme Centre for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Students" from the scheme dropdown list. Step 5: Defining the Principal Investigator (PI) Details The Institute must click the selection menu icon in the Faculty Identification field to add the Principal Investigator’s details, selecting the Faculty Identification from the subsequent list. Data such as Title, Name, Designation, Date of Birth, Qualifications (Undergraduate/Postgraduate/Doctorate), and contact information are auto-populated from existing faculty records. The Institute must then fill in mandatory fields for the Faculty, including the Technical Field of the Proposal, Abstract, Objective, Expected Outcome, and required details such as the Principal Investigator's Aadhaar Card (Unique Identification Document, 12 digits long) and Permanent Account Number (PAN, 10 digits long). If the faculty added is not Full Time and Regular, an error message will be displayed. Step 6: Completing Mandatory Application Tabs The applicant must navigate through and complete several required tabs applicable to the SAMRIDDHI scheme, which include: AQIS Application Details, Budget Estimates – Non Recurring Samriddhi, Academic Credentials of Coordinator, Justification of Project, Credentials of Institute, and Budget Recurring. Step 7: Inputting Budget and Credential Specifics For the "Budget Estimates – Non Recurring Samriddhi" tab, the Institute must click "New" to add details for proposed startups, specifying the Student's Name, Qualification, Phone Number, Email, Project Specification, and the Estimated Cost in Indian Rupees (₹). In the "Academic Credentials of Coordinator/PI/Applicant" tab and the "Credentials of Institution/Department" tab, the user must add exactly one record for each required Parameter/Criteria by selecting values from dropdown lists and providing associated Counts/Numbers and Details. Step 8: Final Application Validation After completing all required data entry in the necessary tabs, the user must click on the "Validate Application" button located on the AQIS Application tab. This action initiates a complete validation of the entire AQIS Application, and upon successful completion, a confirmation message will be displayed. Error messages will appear if required fields are missed or validation rules (like data length or format) are violated.

Akhil Bhartiya Veda Sammelan and Akhil B.details: The scheme “Akhil Bhartiya Veda Sammelan and Akhil Bhartiya Jyotish Vastu Sammelan” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a platform for scholars engaged in the study, teaching, propagation, and research of Vedas, Astrology, and Vastu Shastra to participate in the conference.
Akhil Bhartiya Veda Sammelan and Akhil B.benefits: In the conference, scholars gain the opportunity to understand the subtle knowledge of Vedic literature, Astrology, and Vastu Shastra; interpret the scriptures from a contemporary perspective; exchange knowledge and receive certificates of participation.
Akhil Bhartiya Veda Sammelan and Akhil B.eligibility: 1. Scholars engaged in the study, teaching, propagation, and research of the Vedas, Astrology, and Vastu Shastra will be eligible to participate in the respective conference.

application process.process: As per the information letter, the application form must be submitted via email, or information about your arrival has to be given on the phone of the coordinator.

CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar.details: The scheme “CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar” was launched by the Directorate of Education, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to celebrate the unique contribution of some of the finest teachers in the state and to honour those teachers who through their commitment and industry have not only improved the quality of school education but also enriched the lives of their students. The scheme provides State Awards to Teachers, with each award consisting of a cash amount of ₹1,00,000/- (Rupees One Lakh) and a citation.
CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar.benefits: **Cash Award:** ₹1,00,000/- (Rupees One Lakh). **Citation:** Provided with each award. **Total 10 Awards:** - Primary Teacher: Two Awards (One in each District). - Secondary Teacher: Four Awards (Two in each District). - High School Headmaster: Two Awards (One in each District). - Higher Secondary Teacher: One Award (One in entire State). - Higher Secondary Principal: One Award (One in entire State). _*The recipients will be felicitated at the hands of the Chief Minister of Goa during the Teacher’s Day function._ _*The selected teachers will have to make a presentation before the State Level Committee._
CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar.eligibility: ***Target Group Definition*** ◦ The applicant must be a school teacher, special educator, or Head of School. ◦ The applicant must be working in a recognized government or aided primary, middle, high, or higher secondary school. ◦ The applicant must be an in-service teacher. ◦ The applicant must fulfill the required academic and professional qualifications as per their cadre for the State Award to Teachers. ***Service Requirements*** ◦ The applicant, if an in-service Regular Teacher or Special Educator, must have completed at least 15 years of regular teaching service in the State of Goa as on June 30th of the academic year for which they are applying. ◦ The applicant, if a Headmaster, must have 5 years of administrative experience out of the required 15 years of regular teaching service in the State of Goa. ***Preference/Reservation*** ◦ One award out of the 10 is reserved for a differently abled teacher or Head of the School/Special Educator from Regular or Special Schools. ◦ The applicant applying for the Differently Abled Category must attach a disability certificate indicating more than 40% disability.
CM-Vashistha Guru Puraskar.exclusions: - The applicant must not be due for retirement for the year to which the State Awards relates. - The applicant must not have indulged in tuitions. - The applicant must not be a contractual teacher. - The applicant must not be a Para Teacher. - The applicant must not be a Part-time Instructor. - The applicant must not be a National Skills Qualifications Framework Instructor. - The applicant must not have any vigilance or criminal case pending against them. - The applicant who has been penalized by the Goa Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (GBSHSE) shall not be considered. - The applicant against whom any inquiry is being conducted shall not be considered.

application process.process: Step 1: The applicant must visit the official website of the Directorate of Education at www.education.goa.gov.in and take a printout of the prescribed format of the application form. The prescribed forms and guidelines are also available at the office of the respective Taluka Assistant District Education Inspectors (ADEI’s) and Educational Zones. Step 2: The applicant must complete Part I (Mandatory) and Part II (If applicable) of the form. In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Inspectors (ADEI’s) and Educational Zones. Step 3: The applicant must submit the completed application and portfolio by hand directly to the respective Zonal Head. The registration for self-nominations for the 2024-25 cycle is accepted from June 24, 2025, to July 31, 2025. Submission must occur at all Educational Zones located at Panaji, Mapusa, and Margao. Help & Support/Grievance Redressal The Directorate of Education, Alto - Porvorim, Bardez - Goa, can be contacted via Email at dir-educ.goa@nic.in or by Fax at 0832-2416136. Telephone numbers are 0832-2416023, 2416033.

S.T. Bus Pass Fee Concession Scheme For.details: The scheme "S.T. Bus Pass Fee Concession Scheme For Government/ Non Government Primary, Secondary & Higher Secondary and Higher Technical Education Students" was launched by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide concession in bus fare fees to the students studying in Primary, Secondary, Higher Secondary, and Higher Secondary Technical Education in Government and Non-Government schools. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Road Transport Corporation (GSRTC). The application for this scheme is accepted online.
S.T. Bus Pass Fee Concession Scheme For.benefits: Concession in Fees of the Buses of Gujarat State Road Transport Corporation (GSRTC).
S.T. Bus Pass Fee Concession Scheme For.eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must be a Student. - The applicant must be a Girl. - The applicant must be studying in Primary / Secondary / Higher Secondary / Higher Secondary Technical Education. - The applicant must be studying in a Government or Non-Government School.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the Official GSRTC E-Pass System website at  https://pass.gsrtc.in . Alternatively, use the GSRTC mobile app (available on the Google Play Store). Step 2:  From the list of "Pass Type" categories, select "Student Pass". On the next page, click "New Pass Request". Step 3:  The online application form will open. In the form, fill in the following mandatory fields: Personal Details Full name, complete postal address, date of birth, and gender. Category details (General, SC, ST, SCBC) and educational qualification level. Mobile number and email address for communication. Organization/Institution Information Name and address of the educational institution or workplace related to the pass application. Travel Route and Service Details Journey details including starting and destination points with route code. Add any via places and select the bus pass issue location. Class of bus service required options include Express, AC Seater, AC Sleeper, City Service, Volvo, Luxury, etc. Duration and number of days for the pass validity. Step 4:  Upload the following mandatory attachments in the specified format and size. A recent passport-size photo (less than 10 KB in size). Step 5:  The form displays fees for bus pass, ID card amount if applicable, and any toll charges. The student concession will be applied automatically. Make the payment via UPI or counter payment at bus depots. Step 6:  Check the box agreeing to GSRTC's terms and conditions. Authenticate application submission by entering OTP sent to the registered mobile number. Submit the completed application form. An application number will be received for future tracking and status updates. Important Information Valid identity proof and enrollment certification from the educational institute may be required during verification. Students are eligible for up to approximately 82.5% fare concession on the pass fare. The pass is valid only on GSRTC buses as per the specified routes and class. The online system supports registration, new applications, renewals, and application status inquiries. Video tutorials and guides in Gujarati are available online to assist applicants throughout the process. The GSRTC app facilitates easy access to pass details, bus schedules, and related services.

Organization of Various Conclaves and Fe.details: The scheme “Organization of Various Conclaves and Felicitations to Encourage Women, Women Scientists, Teachers and Young Students” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Science Education and Research Centre (USERC) under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote and enhance scientific attitude and skill development of women, women scientists, teachers, and young students of the state by organizing conclaves and felicitating them.
Organization of Various Conclaves and Fe.benefits: Under this scheme, to promote and enhance scientific attitude and skill development among students, teachers, and women of the state, the following conclaves are organized and felicitations are given: - Yuva-Bal Samagam: Medhavi Chhatra Samman - Teacher/Science Conclave: Vigyan Prasar Samman - Woman Scientists Conclave: Utkrisht Yuva Mahila Vaigyanik Samman - Mahila Prayogdharmi Samman
Organization of Various Conclaves and Fe.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand state. 1. The applicant must be a student, teacher, woman, and the general public.

application process.process: USERC organizes district-wise Bal Yuva Samagams. The top five meritorious students from each district, who achieve the highest marks in High School/12th Grade under the Uttarakhand Board, are honored. The merit list is provided by the District Education Officer of the respective district. The Science Teachers' Conclave honors Uttarakhand’s science teachers and science-oriented educators with the Vigyan Prasar Samman to encourage and promote the exchange of ideas. Applications are invited from teachers across the state for the award, and advertisements are also published in newspapers. USERC organizes the Women Scientists Conclave and the Utkrisht Yuva Mahila Vaigyaanik Samman Programme every year to encourage women scientists. Applications are invited from women scientists across the state, and advertisements are published in newspapers. To identify and encourage women making exemplary contributions to the integration of science in the state, they are honored with the Mahila Prayogdharmi Samman on the occasion of International Women’s Day.

Loan For Foreign Study (E.B.C.).details: The scheme "Loan for Foreign Study (E.B.C.)" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide students belonging to the Educationally Backward Class (E.B.C.) with financial assistance for higher education abroad. The scheme provides a maximum loan of ₹15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakh) for higher studies in foreign countries. The applications for this scheme are accepted online via the official website [https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/).
Loan For Foreign Study (E.B.C.).benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** - A maximum Foreign Study Loan of ₹15,00,000/- is provided for higher education abroad. - The loan is offered at a simple annual interest rate of 4%. - The loan covers costs such as air tickets, registration fees, tuition fees, education fees, hostel fees, books, and other expenses associated with the first year of the course abroad. ##### ***Disbursement Conditions*** - The full loan amount of ₹15,00,000/- will be disbursed to the student in a single installment. - The money will be deposited into the student's bank account after the submission of the original registered mortgage deed. ##### ***Post-Selection Obligations*** - After the sanction order is received, the student's parent or guardian must obtain the prescribed mortgage deed form from the District Office. - The property presented by the student's parent/guardian or the guarantor must be registered as a mortgage in favor of the government. - The loan repayment must begin one year after the completion of the student's study. - The loan must be repaid in monthly or quarterly installments. - The principal loan amount must be fully repaid within a maximum period of 10 years. - The interest amount must be fully repaid within a maximum period of 2 years. - The student must ensure all required documentation is completed within the prescribed time limit.
Loan For Foreign Study (E.B.C.).eligibility: - The applicant must belong to the Educationally Backward Class (S.E.B.C.). - The applicant's family annual income must be less than ₹10,00,000/-. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 60% or more marks in 12th standard. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 50% marks if they belong to Notified Tribes/De-notified Tribes (NT/DNT), More Backward, or Extremely Backward categories. - The applicant must be pursuing higher education abroad. - The applicant must be pursuing a Diploma, Graduate, Post Graduate, Post Graduate Diploma, Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.), or higher-level courses in any field. - The course must be for a minimum duration of 1 (one) academic year or more, or at least two semesters. - The applicant must apply before traveling abroad or within six months of arriving abroad. - The applicant must submit one solvent guarantor.

application process.process: Registration Step 1:  Visit the Official Website of  eSamajkalyan . Step 2:  In the right pane of the home page, click " New User? Please Register Here! ". You will be taken to the Registration Form. Step 3:  In the form, provide all the mandatory fields, fill in the captcha code, and click "Submit" to complete the registration process. A popup will appear acknowledging successful registration and displaying your User ID for Login. Application Step 1:  Visit the Official Website of  eSamajkalyan . In the "Citizen Login" section provided in the right pane of the home page, provide your User ID and Password, fill in the Captcha Code, then click "Login". Step 2:  In the ribbon provided at the top of the website, click the "Corporation" menu, then click "Gujarat State Divyangjan Finance and Development Corporation". A list of schemes will be displayed. Select the scheme you intend to apply for. Step 3:  You will be taken to the online application form of the scheme. In the form, provide all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make corrections, if any. Step 4:  Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. Note down your Application Number for future reference. You can also take a printout of the submitted application form. Step 5:  Following the successful online submission, the applicant must take a printout of the final application form. Two identical physical copies of the complete application set, along with attached enclosures of all uploaded documents, must be prepared. These two copies must then be deposited at the respective District Office (District Social Welfare Officer) applicable to the student.

Police Internship Scheme.details: The "Police Internship Scheme" was launched by the Home Department, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to familiarize meritorious students with the functioning of the Madhya Pradesh Police Department and to encourage research in policing and law enforcement. > **Internship Period** Selected students are offered a six-week internship opportunity at district police stations, where they gain practical experience in administrative, legal, and investigative procedures.
Police Internship Scheme.benefits: **Professional Exposure:** Interns gain firsthand experience of police administration, law enforcement, investigation procedures, and public dealing. **Research Opportunity:** Each intern submits an analytical research paper of 3,000 words on an approved topic related to policing. **Certification:** A Police Internship Certificate is awarded upon successful completion by the respective unit head (Superintendent of Police). **Supervised Training:** Each intern is placed under the supervision of at least a Sub-Inspector or higher-ranking officer, who mentors and evaluates daily work. **Practical Learning:** Interns maintain a daily duty record, authenticated by their supervising officer the following day. **Placement Structure:** Large police stations (in Indore, Bhopal, Jabalpur, and Gwalior): 2–3 interns **Medium police stations:** 1 intern **Mode and Duration:** Internship duration: 6 weeks (June 1–July 12) Mode: Full-time, in-person at designated police stations. **Honorarium:** The scheme is unpaid. No salary or stipend is provided. Lodging and food arrangements must be made by the interns themselves. **Disciplinary Provisions:** No leave is permitted during the internship period. Lack of interest or misconduct may result in termination by the Superintendent of Police.
Police Internship Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. 1. The applicant should be a student enrolled in a recognized educational institution. 1. The applicant must be between 21 and 26 years of age as of May 1 of the application year. 1. The applicant should be pursuing one of the following courses: - Five-Year Integrated Law Course - B.E. / B.Tech. - Master’s or Postgraduate Program from any UGC-recognized institution - MCA / BCA / PGDCA - CA / CS - Diploma in Police-Related Subjects (e.g., Human Rights, Criminology) - Ph.D. or Research in Police-Related Subjects

application process.process: The District Superintendent of Police (SP) contacts major universities and colleges to invite applications. Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the application form (Annexure K) from the official website. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective District Superintendent of Police (SP) Office. Post-application Process Applications are reviewed based on eligibility, academic merit, and interest in policing. Qualified students are allotted police stations according to training capacity: 2–3 interns for large stations, 1 for medium stations. Interns begin work on June 1, with supervision by designated officers. Interns maintain daily duty logs and submit a 3,000-word analytical research paper. Successful interns receive a Police Internship Certificate signed by the unit head. Each district submits a list of selected interns by June 15 and completion details by August 1 to the Police Training Headquarters.

Interest Free Loan Scheme To Teachers Fo.details: The scheme "Interest Free Loan Scheme To Teachers For The Purchase Of Laptops" was launched by the Directorate of Education, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to get full exposure to changing technology for teachers, who need to handle computers daily and enhance the quality of teaching through visual effects, Multimedia presentation, and Graphics in schools in the State of Goa. The scheme provides an Interest Free Loan up to a maximum of ₹1,00,000/- for the purchase of a Laptop, which is issued via Cheque through Messers Goa Education Development Corporation (GEDC), Government of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted through the respective educational institution and subsequently forwarded to the Directorate of Education.
Interest Free Loan Scheme To Teachers Fo.benefits: - An Interest Free Loan up to a maximum amount of ₹1,00,000/- is granted for the purchase of a Laptop. - The loan is disbursed in the form of a Crossed Cheque. - The Cheque is drawn in favor of the dealer. - The Cheque is issued through Messers Goa Education Development Corporation (GEDC), Government of Goa. ***Conditions*** - _The purchase of the Laptop must be made from any registered or authorized dealer of the branded manufacturer._ - _The Cheque amount sanctioned shall not exceed the maximum amount of ₹1,00,000/-._
Interest Free Loan Scheme To Teachers Fo.eligibility: - The applicant must be a regular/permanent full-time teacher. - The applicant must be teaching in Secondary schools or Higher Secondary schools. - The applicant must be working in a Government school or in a Government Aided school. - The applicant must be covered under the Administrative control of the Directorate of Education in the State of Goa.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant must obtain a quotation for the laptop from a registered dealer of their choice, which includes details such as a pre-receipt, specifications, and the cost of the laptop, to be submitted along with the application. Step 2:  The applicant must obtain the prescribed format of the application form of the scheme from the institution where he/she is currently working. Step 3:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 4:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Head of the Institution. The application must be recommended by the respective Head of the Institution. The Head of the Institution must forward the recommended application to the Directorate of Education. Post-Application Process Step 1:  Processing at the Directorate of Education and Forwarding The Directorate of Education takes utmost care to process the application forwarded by the applicant teacher within a period of forty-five days. Once processed and approved, the Directorate of Education forwards the application and related documentation to Messers Goa Education Development Corporation (GEDC). Step 2:  Final Verification and Release of Payment Messers Goa Education Development Corporation processes and verifies the application for the release of the payment or Cheque. This processing and the release of the Cheque are dependent upon the availability of funds. Step 3:  Cheque Issuance to the Dealer The Crossed Cheque, amounting to the price of the Laptop, but not exceeding the maximum sanctioned amount of ₹1,00,000/-, is drawn in the favor of the dealer chosen by the teacher. This cheque is then released by Messers Goa Education Development Corporation to the respective party.

Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship.details: The scheme "Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship" was launched by the Tea Tribes Welfare Department, Government of Assam. The scheme aims to provide stipend to Pre-Matric and Post-Matric Scholarship to the students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community for the benefit of poor students. The scheme is also intended to provide financial assistance to students of the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community pursuing their studies at the post-matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education. The applications for this scheme are accepted through the SIRISH-Online Application Portal.
Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship.benefits: - The benefits are to provide stipend to Pre-Matric and Post-Matric Scholarship to the students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community for the benefit of poor students. - The scheme is to provide financial assistance to the students of the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community pursuing their studies at the post-matriculation or post-secondary stage to enable them to complete their education. ##### ***Conditions for Availment/Continuation*** - _The scholarship holder under this scheme shall not hold any other scholarship or stipend disbursed by any Government Department._ - _Students who are also undergoing coaching in any of the pre-examination training centers with financial assistance from the Government will not be eligible._ - _In case of detained students, he or she shall not be eligible to apply for scholarship for the same class twice._ - _The applicant eligible for the "Post-Matric Scholarship" will not be eligible for other schemes, except for the scheme "Simon Sing Horo (Special Post-Matric) Scholarship," if eligible, in the same year._
Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam. - The applicant must belong to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi Community. - The applicant must produce a valid Caste certificate which is duly certified or issued by the District Commissioner of the concerned district or his or her designated officer. - The applicant must submit an undertaking on the annual family income stating that it is not exceeding ₹5,00,000/- per annum. - The Pre-Matric Scholarship is awarded to students from Class 9th to Class 10th. - The Post-Matric Scholarship is awarded to students pursuing studies from Class 11th to normal Three Years Degree Courses (Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Business Administration, Bachelor of Commerce, Bachelor of Science, Integrated Graduate plus Post Graduate courses like integrated Master of Business Administration / Bachelor of Arts-Bachelor of Law / Bachelor of Arts-Bachelor of Education / Master of Social Work, etc.). - The scholarships are available for all recognized post-matriculation or post-secondary courses in recognized institutions. ##### ***Special Provisions*** - All children of the same parents or guardians are eligible. - Students studying through correspondence course are also eligible to apply.
Pre-Matric & Post-Matric Scholarship.exclusions: - The scholarships are not available for identified Higher Studies courses and Vocational 3 (three) years Degree Courses or equivalent. - The scholarship holder shall not hold any other scholarship or stipend disbursed by any Government Department. - Students applying repeatedly from different Sub-Divisions shall in no case be considered for the scholarships. - Students who are undergoing coaching in any of the pre-examination training centers with financial assistance from the Government will not be eligible. - In case of detained students, he or she shall not be eligible to apply for scholarship for the same class twice. - The applicant eligible for the "Post-Matric Scholarship" will not be eligible for other schemes except for the scheme "Simon Sing Horo (Special Post-Matric) Scholarship," if eligible, in the same year.

application process.process: Step 1:  Portal Access and Scheme Selection A. Navigating to the Portal:  The applicant must first open the official Tea Tribes Welfare Department URL, www.ttwd.assam.gov.in, and then click the "Online Application" link to be redirected to the  SIRISH application portal . B. Initial Login or Registration:  New users must register themselves on the online portal, while existing users will log in using the username and password created during prior registration. C. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community pursuing higher studies. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
Financial Assistance for Higher Studies.benefits: - Financial assistance for students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. - This assistance supports students pursuing higher studies such as Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS), Master of Business Administration (MBA), Engineering, and such other technical/higher education. - The assistance covers higher studies in Administration, Medical, Engineering, Law, Research, and Education within and outside the State/Country for the students.
Financial Assistance for Higher Studies.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam. - The applicant must belong to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. - The applicant must be pursuing higher studies such as Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS), Master of Business Administration (MBA), Engineering, and such other technical/higher education. - The applicant's family income must not exceed ₹5,00,000/- per annum. - The applicant should not be a Government Service holder. - Students studying through correspondence course are also eligible to apply.
Financial Assistance for Higher Studies.exclusions: - In case of detained students, the applicant shall not be eligible to apply for scholarship for the same class twice. - The applicant eligible under this scheme will not be eligible for other schemes except for the scheme “Simon Sing Horo (Special Post-Matric) Scholarship,” if eligible, in the same year.

Coaching For Higher Studies.details: The scheme "Coaching for Higher Studies" was launched by the Directorate of Tea Tribes and Adivasi Welfare, Government of Assam. The scheme aims to provide coaching to students of Tea Tribes and Adivasi community for preparing them for various competitive examinations like Civil Services, Medical, Engineering, Staff Selection Committee (Graduate level), Banking (Probationary Officers), etc. so that they are able to compete with other candidates and succeed. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
Coaching For Higher Studies.benefits: Provision of coaching to students for preparing them for various competitive examinations like Civil Services, Medical, Engineering, Staff Selection Committee (Graduate level), and Banking (Probationary Officers), to enable them to compete with other candidates and succeed.
Coaching For Higher Studies.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam. - The applicant must belong to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. - The applicant must secure the requisite percentage of marks in the qualifying examination prescribed for the desired coaching, based on subject matter and on the available seats. - **For Undergraduate students who are preparing for medical entrance examinations,** the applicant should be from the science stream with Physics, Chemistry, and Biology.- **For Undergraduate students who are preparing for engineering entrance examinations,** the applicant should be from the science stream with Physics, Chemistry, and Maths.
Coaching For Higher Studies.exclusions: A candidate who underwent coaching for any examination under financial assistance from this Directorate shall not be eligible for any other coaching in the same year.
