Assistance for Purchasing Study Material.details: The scheme “Assistance for Purchasing Study Materials for Medical and Engineering Students from Socially and Educationally Backward Classes” was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from socially and educationally backward classes pursuing medical and engineering diploma and degree courses, in order to support their education and reduce their financial burden. Under this scheme, eligible students receive a one-time grant for purchasing study materials.
Assistance for Purchasing Study Material.benefits: > **Financial assistance per student:** - For Medical Student: ₹10,000/- - For Engineering Student: ₹8,000/- - For Diploma Student: ₹3,000/-
Assistance for Purchasing Study Material.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a student belonging to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC) category. 1. The applicant should be pursuing a medical, engineering, or diploma/degree course within the state of Gujarat. 1. The annual family income of the applicant should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 2:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 3:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 4:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 5:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 6:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 7:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 8:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 9:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 1:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 2:  Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 3:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. Note 4:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 5:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 6:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 7:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 8:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Special Incentive Assistance to Socially.details: The scheme “Special Incentive Assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Class Trainees for Pre-Preparation of Competitive Examination” was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to encourage SEBC candidates to pursue coaching for government competitive exams by providing financial support. Under this scheme, eligible trainees receive up to ₹20,000 or the actual coaching fee paid (whichever is lower) for preparing for Class 1, 2, or 3 government job exams conducted by state or central bodies.
Special Incentive Assistance to Socially.benefits: **Financial Assistance:** - ₹20,000/- or actual fee paid (whichever is lower) for coaching related to any one exam. **Exams Include:** - State-Level: Gujarat Public Service Commission (GPSC), Gujarat Secondary Service Selection Board (GSSSB), (3) State Police Recruitment, Gujarat Panchayat Service Selection Board (GPSB), etc. - Central-Level: Banking, Railways, Army Recruitment, Central Police Force (CRPF, BSF, CISF etc), Staff Selection Commission (SSC). **Applicable for Exams:** - Class 1, 2, and 3 level government posts. **Mode of Disbursement:** - Amount is credited via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the trainee's bank account.
Special Incentive Assistance to Socially.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC). 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) or equivalent. 1. The applicant must be preparing for a recognized Class 1, 2, or 3 competitive exam of State or Central Government. 1. The applicant must have paid coaching fees and should have a valid receipt. 1. The annual family income of the applicant must not exceed ₹4,50,000/-.

application process.process: Step 01:  The eligible applicant may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal:  https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/ Step 02:  On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘ Please Register Here ’. Step 03:  Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. Step 04:  After successful registration, the applicants can login through their User ID and Password. Step 05:  Now, click on ‘User Profile’ to update your profile. Step 06:  Fill in all the mandatory information and then click on ‘Update’. Step 07:  After updating the profile successfully, select the scheme appearing on the home page; an application form will open. Step 08:  Fill in all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the relevant documents. Step 09:  Now agree with the terms & conditions and click on ‘Save Application’. Step 10:  Submit the application form and take out the print of the application for future reference. The applicant can note down the application number to track the application status by logging into the portal using their User ID and Password. User Manual

Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.details: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan Scholarship Scheme (Secondary Level – Classes 11 & 12)” is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to encourage academic excellence among students entering Classes 11 and 12 by providing financial assistance to meritorious students who have secured 80% or more marks in the Uttarakhand Board Examination of Class 10 .
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.benefits: ***Rate of Scholarship:*** - **For Class 11th Students:** ₹1,200/- per month for 1 year.- **For Class 12th Students:** ₹1,200/- per month for 1 year.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.eligibility: 1. The student must have secured at least 80% marks in the Uttarakhand Board Examination of Class 10 while studying in a state government school or a government-aided non-government school (excluding central and residential schools). 1. The student must maintain 75% attendance and 75% marks in Class 11. SC/ST students will be given a 5% relaxation in marks and attendance in the board examination. 1. There is no income criterion for the parent/guardian of the student under this scholarship. 1. The student cannot avail benefits under multiple state scholarship schemes simultaneously

application process.process: To avail this scholarship, students are not required to appear for any examination. The department selects the students based on their board examination results. To avail the benefits of this scheme, students must submit their Aadhaar card, Aadhaar-linked bank account, caste certificate, and the Uttarakhand Board passing certificate along with the application form. The scholarship amount is transferred to the student’s bank account once the school receives the allocated budget.

Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship.details: The "Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship" scheme is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students from the Garhwal and Kumaon divisions who secure top ranks in the examination conducted by SCERT Uttarakhand.
Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship.benefits: Out of the top 100 students in the qualifying examination conducted by SCERT Uttarakhand, 50 students from the Garhwal Division and 50 students from the Kumaon Division will receive ₹1,500/- per month for a period of 10 months.
Dr. Shivanand Nautiyal Scholarship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to either the Garhwal or Kumaon Division of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be an institutional student of Class 8 in any government, local body, or government-aided school (excluding central and residential schools) in Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must have passed the annual Class 7 examination with a minimum of 50% marks (40% for reserved categories). 1. There is no restriction on the annual income of parents or guardians. 1. The scholarship will be awarded for a period of 4 years, from Class 9 to Class 12.

application process.process: To appear in the scholarship examination, students can obtain the application form from the office of the Block Education Officer or download it from the School Education Department’s website ( https://schooleducation.uk.gov.in /) or SCERT Uttarakhand’s website ( https://scert.uk.gov.in /) during September–October every year. A photocopy of the application form is also valid. No application or examination fee is charged. While filling out the application form, students must attach a passport-size photograph, Aadhaar card, Class 7 mark sheet, caste certificate, and disability certificate (if applicable). All information must be filled in correctly, and the completed form should be submitted to the Principal of the school where the student is enrolled. The Principal will verify the form based on the attached documents and school records, attest the photograph, and forward the verified form to the Block Education Officer’s office by the tentative date of 12 November. After submission, the Block Education Officer issues the admit card. Students can collect the admit card either from their school or the Block Education Officer’s office. The examination is conducted every year in the month of January. After the successful completion of the process, the school Principal informs the student. The student must provide their Aadhaar card and Aadhaar-linked bank account details to the school, following which the scholarship amount is transferred directly to the student’s bank account.

Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Shodh Sammelan.details: The scheme “Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Shodh Sammelan” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a platform (Sanskrit Conference) for scholars, professors, lecturers, teachers, and students engaged in teaching, learning, and research to present their findings.
Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Shodh Sammelan.benefits: At the Sanskrit Shodh Sammelan, participants gain knowledge through new research in Sanskrit literature, exchange ideas, learn the methodology of writing research papers, and receive certificates.
Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Shodh Sammelan.eligibility: 1. Acharyas, co-acharyas, assistant acharyas, lecturers, assistant professors, teachers, and research scholars from all states of the country who are engaged in study, teaching, or research are eligible to participate.

application process.process: In accordance with the rules and regulations of the Academy, researchers must complete the application form and submit their research paper on the prescribed subject via email by the due date. Those whose papers are found eligible by the Research Paper Evaluation Committee will be invited to participate.

Swami Vivekananda Exam Oriented Resident.details: The scheme "Swami Vivekananda Exam Oriented Residential Training" was launched by the Directorate of Employment and Training, Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide comprehensive residential training to aspiring candidates for recruitment in Army, Air Force, Navy, Paramilitary Forces and Police Forces, addressing the need for specialized coaching and preparation to enhance success rates in defence and police recruitment examinations. The scheme provides exam-oriented residential training programs and coaching facilities specifically designed for defence services examinations and conducts comprehensive preparation sessions covering written examinations, physical fitness training, personality development, and interview preparation. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat state and must be aspiring for recruitment in Army, Air Force, Navy, Paramilitary Forces or Police Forces with appropriate age and educational qualifications as per the respective service requirements. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Employment and Training under the Labour and Employment Department, Government of Gujarat and applications for this scheme are accepted through designated employment exchanges and training centers across the state.
Swami Vivekananda Exam Oriented Resident.benefits:
> **Training and Coaching Support** - **Residential Training:** Comprehensive exam-oriented coaching in residential format.- **Defence Examination Preparation:** Specialized training for Army, Air Force, Navy recruitment examinations.- **Police Force Training:** Preparation for Police Force recruitment examinations.- **Paramilitary Force Coaching:** Training for Central Armed Police Forces and other paramilitary recruitment.
> **Training Components** - **Written Examination Preparation:** Subject-wise coaching and mock tests.- **Physical Fitness Training:** Physical preparation as per service requirements.- **Personality Development:** Communication skills and confidence building.- **Interview Preparation:** Mock interviews and counseling sessions.
> **Conditions** - Regular attendance in all training sessions and activities. - Compliance with residential training center rules and regulations. - Participation in mock tests and assessment programs. - Maintenance of discipline and conduct as per training center guidelines.
Swami Vivekananda Exam Oriented Resident.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must be aspiring for recruitment in Army, Air Force, Navy, Paramilitary Forces or Police Forces. - The applicant must meet the age criteria as prescribed for respective defence and police services. - The applicant must possess minimum educational qualifications as required for the specific service examination they are preparing for. - The applicant must have completed relevant educational requirements as per Central Government norms for defence services. - The applicant must meet basic physical fitness standards for defence and police services. - The applicant must be medically fit as per general health requirements. - The applicant must be willing to undergo rigorous physical training programs. - The applicant must belong to economically weaker sections or demonstrate financial need for training assistance. - The applicant must not be receiving similar training assistance from other government schemes simultaneously.

application process.process: Step 1:   Registration with Employment Exchange The applicant must first register with the nearest District Employment Exchange office in Gujarat and obtain a valid employment registration number for accessing training programs. Step 2:   Medical and Physical Fitness Assessment The applicant must undergo preliminary medical check-up and physical fitness assessment at the designated center to ensure they meet basic standards for defence training. Step 3:   Training Program Inquiry The candidate should visit the Directorate of Employment and Training office / the nearest District Employment Office / the Designated Training Center and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form for the scheme "Swami Vivekananda Exam Oriented Residential Training". Step 4:   Form Completion and Documentation The candidate should fill the application form completely with accurate personal details, educational background, preferred service category (Army/Navy/Air Force/Police/Paramilitary), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 5:   Application Submission and Interview The completed application with all documents must be submitted at one of the following - Directorate of Employment and Training, Block No. 1, 3rd Floor, Dr. Jivraj Mehta Bhavan, Gandhinagar - 382010. District Employment Exchanges across all districts in Gujarat. Designated Training Centers (as notified by the Directorate of Employment and Training). *The applicant is advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and acknowledgment receipt for future reference. Step 6:   Selection and Admission The candidate may be required to appear for a preliminary interview or counseling session. Based on the evaluation of application, documents verification, and interview performance, selected candidates will be notified about their admission to the residential training program. Step 7:   Training Commencement Selected candidates must report to the designated training center on the specified date with necessary personal items and documents for the commencement of the residential training program.

Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.details: The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Activities" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to create interest in Tiatr among students of educational institutions and tiatr lovers in villages and cities. The scheme provides for the creation of awareness about tiatr, its song, and music through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. These activities, which must have at least 20 participants, can be organized by the Tiatr Academy of Goa alone or in collaboration with other institutions or individuals, with the Academy covering various expenditures and providing necessary materials. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa on a 'First Come First Serve' basis, and applications for this scheme are accepted as per the availability of funds.
Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.benefits:
• **Awareness Creation:** Awareness about Tiatr, its song, and music will be created through academic activities such as talks, symposia, seminars, and workshops. • **Resource Person Honorarium:** Resource persons will be paid an honorarium, as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, for every session, with the amount dependent upon the distance from their residence to the venue. • **Expenditure Coverage:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will cover the expenditure incurred on Resource Persons, refreshments, and food (lunch or dinner) served to participants. Additionally, any other miscellaneous expenditure made in organizing the activity by an institution or individual by way of collaboration will be taken care of by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. • **Provision of Materials:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide essential materials, including a backdrop, certificates for the participants, and stationery. • **Documentation Coverage:** The Tiatr Academy of Goa will document the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop, and the expenditure incurred on this documentation will be borne by the Tiatr Academy of Goa.
> **Conditions** _*Prior approval will be required from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing the resource persons, if the activity is organized in collaboration with others._ _*The cost of refreshments or food to be served must be verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalization._ _*The scheme will be implemented strictly on a ‘First Come First Serve’ basis._ _*Applications will be considered, and benefits disbursed as per the availability of funds._
Promotion of Tiatr Through Academic Acti.eligibility: • The applicant must be an educational institution or an individual interested in collaborating with the Tiatr Academy of Goa to organize academic activities for promoting Tiatr. • The applicant must ensure the number of participants for conducting the Symposia, Seminar, or Workshop shall be at least 20. • The applicant must obtain prior approval from the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing resource persons, if the activity is organized by others in collaboration. • The applicant must get the cost of refreshments or food to be served verified and approved by the Tiatr Academy of Goa before finalizing them.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001 *Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment. *The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds.

Mobile Learning Centre (UKBOCWWB).details: The “Mobile Learning Centre” scheme is implemented by the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (UKBOCWWB) under the Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide education to the children of registered construction workers at construction sites through Mobile Learning Centre buses, ensuring their better and brighter future.
Mobile Learning Centre (UKBOCWWB).benefits: Under this scheme, mobile learning schools are operated to provide education to the children of construction workers.
Mobile Learning Centre (UKBOCWWB).eligibility: Children of workers registered with the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board are eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme.

application process.process: For securing a bright future for the children of construction site workers, education is provided at construction sites through Mobile Learning Centre buses.

Scheme for Economic Empowerment of De-no.details: The scheme "Scheme for Economic Empowerment of De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes (SEED)" was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment (DoSJE), Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (MoSJE), Government of India. The scheme aims to provide comprehensive empowerment to De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes communities who are the most neglected, marginalized and economically and socially deprived communities, addressing their educational, health, livelihood and housing needs through an umbrella approach with an approximate cost of ₹20,00,00,000/- to be spent over a period of 5 years. The "Educational Empowerment" component provides free coaching of good quality for De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes candidates to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and monthly stipend support ranging from ₹1,500/- to ₹3,000/- along with special allowances for students with disabilities. The applicant must belong to De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes communities and have total family income from all sources of ₹2,50,000/- or less per annum. The scheme is implemented by the Development and Welfare Board for De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Communities. The applications for this scheme are accepted Online.
Scheme for Economic Empowerment of De-no.benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** - ***Free Coaching Fees:*** Actual course fee of the institute or the prescribed course fee by the Ministry as per Annexure, whichever is less, subject to the limits for fees and duration laid down in the Annexure.- ***Monthly Stipend for Local Students:*** ₹1,500/- per month for students attending coaching within their locality.- ***Monthly Stipend for Outstation Students:*** ₹3,000/- per month for students attending coaching outside their locality.- ***Special Allowance for Students with Disabilities:*** ₹2,000/- per month towards reader allowance, escort allowance, helper allowance for students having valid disability certificate with 40% or more disability. ##### ***Coaching Coverage*** - Union Public Service Commission Group A and B examinations. - Staff Selection Commission examinations. - Railway Recruitment Boards examinations. - State Public Service Commission Group A and B examinations. - Officers Grade examinations conducted by Banks, Insurance Companies and Public Sector Undertakings. - Premier Entrance Examinations for Engineering (Indian Institute of Technology Joint Entrance Examination), Medical (National Eligibility cum Entrance Test), Management (Common Admission Test), Law (Common Law Admission Test). - Eligibility tests like Scholastic Assessment Test, Graduate Record Examination, Graduate Management Admission Test and Test of English as a Foreign Language. - Combined Pilot Licence courses, National Defense Academy and Combined Defense Services entrance examinations. ##### ***Disbursement*** - Direct Benefit Transfer mode into beneficiary's bank account linked with Aadhaar. - Course fee released in two installments (50% each), Monthly stipend and special allowances paid monthly. - Stipend paid till duration of course or for one year, whichever is less. - Benefits available to a student maximum twice in their lifetime. ##### ***Conditions*** - _The candidate must join the selected course within 6 months of receiving the first installment._ - _The candidate must deposit the first installment amount to the selected coaching institute._ - _The candidate must join an institute empanelled by the Ministry under Free Coaching Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Other Backward Classes students._ - _If first installment is not paid to selected institute within 6 months, amount must be returned to Government and second installment will not be provided._ - _The candidate must submit affidavit that they will take admission in coaching institute within six months of receiving first installment._ - _The candidate must provide admission confirmation from the coaching institute on the online portal._
Scheme for Economic Empowerment of De-no.eligibility:
- The applicant must belong to De-notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes communities. - The applicant must have total family income from all sources of ₹2,50,000/- or less per annum. - The applicant must not be availing any such benefits from similar Scheme of Centre Government or the State Government. - The applicant must have secured minimum marks in the qualifying examination of the competitive exam for which coaching is sought, as prescribed in guidelines of the said competitive exam. - The applicant must have passed Class 12th or be studying in Class 12th for competitive exams requiring Class 12th qualification. - The applicant must have completed bachelor level course or be studying in final year of bachelor degree course for competitive exams requiring graduation qualification. ##### ***Priority*** - The applicant will receive priority in selection if they have qualified preliminary examination at least once for examinations conducted in two parts (Preliminary and Mains). - The applicant will be selected based on decreasing order of marks obtained in qualifying exams when eligible applications exceed available slots. ##### ***Special Provisions*** - The applicant with disabilities having valid disability certificate (equal to or more than 40% disability) is eligible for Special Allowance. - The applicant is entitled for free coaching up to two times each for Preliminary and Main examinations for competitive examinations conducted in two stages. - The applicant has no restriction in number of chances for coaching for Interview if selected for interview.
_*The applicant can avail benefits under the scheme maximum twice in their lifetime, irrespective of number of chances entitled for a particular competitive examination._

application process.process: (The applicants are advised to monitor the portal during the two annual application windows - July and January, as the portal remains open for one month twice a year specifically during these months for receiving applications) Step 1:   Portal Access and Registration Access the  official portal . On the homepage, click on "Registration". You will be taken to the registration page. Fill in all the mandatory fields and register. If required, verify your Email ID and Mobile Number via OTP. Step 3:  Online Application Submission Use the credentials you created during registration to log in. Navigate to the online form of the scheme. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Step 5:   Review & Submit Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections. Click the "Submit" button to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. Screening Processes Step 1:   Application Review and Merit List Wait for the closure of application portal after which separate merit lists will be drawn up by the Information Technology system for both levels of competitive exams based on marks obtained in qualifying examinations in decreasing order. Step 2:   Screening Committee Evaluation Applications will be scrutinized by the Screening Committee set up by Development and Welfare Board for De-Notified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Communities in order of merit for ascertaining eligibility and credentials verification. Step 3:   Selection Notification Check the merit list uploaded on the Ministry website to confirm your selection, with 625 candidates provided assistance in each of the two phases annually. Step 4:   Open Assurance Letter Receipt Receive the Open Assurance Letter stating your name, rank number, and fee amount eligible under the scheme after selection and credential verification process completion. Next Steps Step 1:   Coaching Institute Selection and Admission Contact and secure admission in your preferred coaching institute using the Open Assurance Letter, ensuring the institute is empanelled under the Free Coaching Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Other Backward Classes students. Step 2:   Admission Confirmation Upload Upload the admission confirmation or assurance letter received from your selected coaching institute on the online portal for processing of first installment release. Step 3:   First Installment Receipt Receive 50% of eligible coaching fee amount through Direct Benefit Transfer mode directly into your Aadhaar-linked bank account immediately after uploading admission confirmation. Step 4:   Course Joining and Fee Deposit Join the selected coaching course within 6 months of receiving first installment and deposit the received amount to the coaching institute, obtaining proper receipt for the same. Step 5:   Final Installment Processing Submit proof of joining the coaching institute and deposit receipt of first installment to receive the remaining 50% course fee along with monthly stipend payments through Direct Benefit Transfer.

Maths Wizard & Spelling Genius - Uttarak.details: The scheme “Maths Wizard & Spelling Genius” is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance the interest of Class 5 students in Mathematics and English by organizing competitions at the school, block, district, and state levels, and by encouraging students through rewards.
Maths Wizard & Spelling Genius - Uttarak.benefits: Under this scheme, to enhance the interest of Class 5 students in Mathematics and English, the Government of India organized the “Maths Wizard” and “Spelling Genius” competitions at the school, block, district, and state levels under AWP-B for the year 2023-24, wherein participating students were encouraged through rewards.
Maths Wizard & Spelling Genius - Uttarak.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a Class 5 student of a government school in Uttarakhand.

application process.process: The selection of beneficiaries for first, second, and third positions is done through school, block, district, and state-level competitions.

Higher Education Scholarship Scheme.details: The “Higher Education Scholarship Scheme” was launched by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme objective is that students studying in various courses at Government and Grant-In-Aid Schools and Colleges are eligible for this scheme. It begins with students studying in class 11th and extends across different Graduate-level study sequences.
Higher Education Scholarship Scheme.benefits: - ₹1,000/- for school students. - ₹1,000/- for college students. - ₹1,000/- each for Arts and Commerce streams students. - ₹2,000/- for the Science stream students.
Higher Education Scholarship Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student of standard 11 or 12, or a college student enrolled in government or grant-in-aid institutions. 1. The applicant must have passed standard 10 (for school-level scholarship) or standard 12 (for college-level scholarship). 1. The applicant family's annual income must not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. 1. The applicant must be studying in the Arts, Commerce, or Science stream at the college level. 1. The applicant must have secured admission on merit in proportion to available seats.

PM Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan (P.details: The scheme “PM- Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan (PM JANMAN)” was launched by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India, aims to improve the socio-economic status of Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs) by bridging gaps in health, education, and livelihoods, and by saturating PVTG communities and families with basic facilities and services. The scheme provides 11 critical interventions through nine line Ministries/Departments, focusing on ensuring access to pucca houses, safe drinking water, road and mobile connectivity, electricity, and vocational education for individual households and habitations. A unique aspect is the inter-ministerial convergence, with the Ministry of Tribal Affairs serving as the nodal ministry while each participating ministry implements its respective Central Sector and Centrally Sponsored schemes.
PM Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan (P.benefits: ##### ***Housing*** - Provision of pucca houses to all eligible Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group households having kaccha houses (Target: 4,90,000 households). - The basic unit cost of the house is enhanced to ₹2,00,000/-, with additional facilities raising it to ₹2,39,000/-. ##### ***Road Connectivity*** - Construction of connecting roads (Target: 8,000 KM) linking approximately 6,500 Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group villages. - The construction cost per Kilometer would be ₹1,00,00,000/-. ##### ***Drinking Water*** - Provision of piped water supply/Functional Household Tap Connection (FHTC) to all Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group households. - Community water supply will be provided to villages/habitations with a population of less than 20 households. ##### ***Health*** - Deployment of Mobile Medical Units (MMUs) (Target: 1,000 MMUs) in Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group habitations/villages. - The cost is ₹33,88,000/- per MMU per annum, with Operational Expenditure (Op Ex) as per norms. ##### ***Education Hostels*** - Construction of residential hostels (Target: 500 hostels) in existing schools in Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group areas. - The cost is ₹2,75,00,000/- per hostel construction, subject to the actual estimate as per existing cost sharing ratio. ##### ***Anganwadi Centers (AWCs)*** - Construction of Anganwadi Centers (Target: 2,500 AWCs) in Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group habitations/villages. - The unit cost is ₹12,00,000/- per Anganwadi Center. ##### ***Livelihood (VDVKs)*** - Setting up of Van Dhan Vikas Kendras (VDVKs) (Target: 500 VDVKs). - An amount of ₹15,00,000/- meant for 300 members will be released on a pro rata basis. ##### ***Multipurpose Centers (MPCs)*** - Construction of Multipurpose Centers (Target: 1,000 MPCs). - The unit cost is ₹60,00,000/- per unit. ##### ***Solar Power/Electricity*** - Provision of solar power solutions to 1,00,000 Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group households. - Funding is ₹50,000/- per household or actual cost for 300 Watt supply. ##### ***Telecom Connectivity*** Installation of mobile towers (Target: 3,000 mobile towers) in all uncovered villages/habitations.
PM Janjati Adivasi Nyaya Maha Abhiyan (P.eligibility: - The applicant must belong to a Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group (PVTG) community. - The applicant must reside in one of the 18 States and Union Territories having a notified Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group population. - The applicant household must be identified as eligible through the physical survey conducted by state governments using the mobile application on the PM Gati-shakti Portal. ***Eligibility Specific to Interventions*** - The applicant household seeking a pucca house must currently reside in a kaccha house. - The applicant household seeking solar power solutions must be an unelectrified household not covered under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS). - The applicant household seeking an on-grid electricity connection shall be an identified beneficiary household under PM-JANMAN, irrespective of standard eligibility criteria under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) for the State and Electricity distribution company (DISCOM).

application process.process: Step 1:   Initiation of Identification and Physical Survey The State Governments initiates a detailed physical survey of each Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group habitation to ascertain the gaps regarding the 11 critical interventions covered under the mission. The data gathered during this exhaustive survey is simultaneously updated and cross-verified on a mobile application developed on the PM Gati-shakti Portal. Step 2:   Facilitation of Application Filing for Eligible Beneficiaries The Block Level Implementation Team, consisting of officers designated by the District Collector, will be responsible for identifying each beneficiary family who has not yet been saturated with entitlements and will facilitate the necessary application filing for the respective schemes. The District Level Committee is also responsible for the registration and filling of applications of eligible beneficiaries for each scheme covered under the mission. Step 3:   Verification and Project Approval Following the application filing and preliminary eligibility checks, certain proposals for infrastructure, such as the sanctioning of Multi-Purpose Centers, must be forwarded by the Secretary/Principal Secretary, State Tribal Welfare Department to the Ministry of Tribal Affairs. These proposals are subsequently examined by the relevant division, approved by the Mission Director of PM-JANMAN, and granted financial concurrence by the Internal Finance Division.

Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Upgradatio.details: The scheme "Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Upgradation of Merit of Scheduled Caste Students" was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India. The scheme aims to upgrade the merit of Scheduled Caste students by providing them with facilities for all round development through education in residential or non-residential schools, addressing their educational deficiencies that prevent them from taking advantage of reservation quotas in technical and professional courses. The scheme provides remedial coaching to remove deficiencies in school subjects and special coaching to prepare students for competitive examinations for entry into professional courses like Engineering and Medical.
Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Upgradatio.benefits: ##### ***Package Grant*** ***₹25,000/- per student per year with the following breakdown:*** _₹15,000/- per student per year comprising -_ - Boarding and Lodging Charges: ₹900/- per month for 10 months = ₹9,000/- (for residential school students only) - Pocket Money: ₹300/- per month for 10 months = ₹3,000/- - Books and Stationery: ₹3,000/- _₹10,000/- per year per student -_ - For honorarium to Principal, Experts and other incidental charges. ##### ***Additional Benefits for Students with Disabilities*** - _Reader Allowance:_ ₹200/- per month for blind students in classes IX to XII.- _Transport Allowance:_ ₹100/- per month for disabled students not residing in hostel within educational institution premises.- _Special Pay:_ ₹200/- per month for hostel employees assisting severely orthopaedically handicapped students.- _Escort Allowance:_ ₹100/- per month for severely handicapped day scholar students with lower extremity disability.- _Allowance:_ ₹200/- per month towards extra coaching for mentally retarded and mentally ill students in classes IX to XII. ##### ***Conditions*** *Students must maintain regular attendance and academic performance as monitored by school authorities. *Students must complete the full coaching program from Class IX to XII to derive maximum benefit. *Compliance with the transparent selection and monitoring process established by State Governments.
Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Upgradatio.eligibility: - The applicant must be a Scheduled Caste student. - The applicant must be studying in classes IX to XII. - The applicant must be enrolled in schools selected by the State Government under the scheme. - The applicant may be enrolled in class X or XI if he/she has shown excellent performance in the previous examination and missed entry at class IX level for any reason. - The applicant must be from districts selected based on highest Scheduled Caste population and identified as Educationally Backward Districts (for new selections from 2014-15 onwards). ***Preference*** - Girls students are given equal preference with awards allocated in 50:50 ratio between boys and girls. - Unutilized awards by girls may be used by boys and vice-versa. - At least 3% representation for disabled Scheduled Caste students wherever possible.

application process.process: Step 1:   Identification of Eligible Districts and Schools State Governments select 2-3 districts having highest Scheduled Caste population and identified as Educationally Backward Districts, with priority given to districts with lower literacy rates. Step 2:   School Selection Process States select schools with necessary facilities for all-round development, adequate hostel facilities, and consistent good academic results, particularly in rural areas including Kendriya Vidyalayas with hostel facilities. Step 3:   Student Selection Process State Governments conduct transparent and fair selection of Scheduled Caste students studying in classes IX to XII, with provision for enrollment in classes X or XI for students with excellent previous performance. Step 4:   Application Processing Selected students are enrolled through the State Government's established process ensuring equal opportunity for boys and girls (50:50 ratio) and at least 3% representation for disabled students. Step 5:   Monitoring and Database Creation State Governments prepare database of beneficiaries integrated with Unique Identification Authority of India by embedding Aadhaar numbers and using Unique Identification Authority of India enabled bank accounts for scholarship crediting. *The admission and selection process is left to the discretion of concerned State Governments who ensure total transparency and fairness in identification of coaching institutions and beneficiary students. Grievance Redressal / Help & Support State and District level Grievance Redressal Officers are designated to address scholarship-related grievances of students.

Scholarship Scheme of Sainik School Chhi.details: The scheme "Scholarship Scheme of Sainik School Chhingchhip, Mizoram" was launched by the School Education Department, Government of Mizoram. The scheme aims to award scholarships to all eligible boys of Mizoram domicile who qualify and are admitted to Sainik School Chhingchhip. The objective of establishing the school is to facilitate the all-round development of a child’s personality and remove regional imbalance in entry into the officer’s cadre of the Armed Forces via the National Defence Academy. The scheme provides financial assistance covering School Fee, Dietary Charge, and Clothing Money, with the quantum of benefits depending entirely upon the income level of the parent or guardian.
Scholarship Scheme of Sainik School Chhi.benefits:
***Benefit Component:*** School Fee, Dietary Charge, Clothing Money (New/Subsequent Year) ***Parent Income Category (per month):*** Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe: Up to ₹50,000/- OR General Category: Up to ₹25,000/- ***Benefit Rate:*** Rate I (Full) ***State Government's Share:*** 100% of Fee/Charge + ₹2,000/- (For Fee only) ***Central Share:*** NIL
***Benefit Component:*** School Fee, Dietary Charge, Clothing Money (New/Subsequent Year) ***Parent Income Category (per month):*** Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe: ₹50,000/- to ₹1,00,000/- OR General Category: ₹25,000/- to ₹50,000/- ***Benefit Rate:*** Rate II (50%) ***State Government's Share:*** 50% of Fee/Charge + ₹1,000/- (For Fee only) ***Central Share:*** 50%
***Benefit Component:*** School Fee, Dietary Charge, Clothing Money (New/Subsequent Year) Parent Income Category (per month): Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe: Above ₹1,00,000/- OR ***General Category:*** Above ₹50,000/- ***Benefit Rate:*** Rate III (None) ***State Government's Share:*** NIL ***Central Share:*** 100%
- The scholarships cover approved compulsory fees payable to the Institution, with the State’s share disbursed to the Institution by the awarding authority, the Mizoram Scholarship Board. - The State’s share of the scholarship is disbursed to the Institution (Sainik School Chhingchhip). - The scholarship is available for only one year for studying in any class but is renewable as per Rules/Condition. For renewal, the scholarship is paid following the month up to which the same was paid in the previous year. - Cadets are expected to use the sanctioned scholarship amounts to purchase necessary textbooks, stationery, and related items.
***Conditions*** - The award is tenable from the stage it is given until the completion of the course. - Continuation is subject to the student demonstrating satisfactory progress, maintaining good conduct, and ensuring regularity in attendance. - The award will be discontinued if the student fails to secure annual promotion, unless unavoidable reasons are certified by the competent authority of the scheme. - If a student repeats a class, they will not receive a scholarship for that specific class for the second or subsequent year. - If a cadet is declared medically unfit by the appropriate medical authority for entry into the National Defence Academy, the scholarship awarded shall be discontinued from the date the cadet is declared unfit. - The value of the scholarship may be reduced at the sanctioning authority's discretion if the Principal reports that any scholar is without textbooks or stationery. - The scholarship may be cancelled, stopped, or further payments withheld if the student makes unsatisfactory progress or is guilty of misconduct, such as resorting to or participating in strikes or irregular attendance.
Scholarship Scheme of Sainik School Chhi.eligibility: - The applicant should belong to Mizoram State only. - The applicant must qualify in the Annual Entrance examination conducted by the All India Sainik School Society. - The applicant must be admitted to Sainik School Chhingchhip, Mizoram. - The applicant must not be covered under any other Scholarship scheme. - The applicant must submit Income certificates/salary certificates at the time of admission for the grant of scholarship. - For Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST): The income of the parent/guardian should not exceed ₹1,00,000/- (One lakh) per month. - For General Category: The income of the parent/guardian should not exceed ₹50,000/- (Fifty Thousand) per month. - The applicant must not be more than one child of the same parents’/guardians eligible for the said scheme. _*The scholarship will be discontinued if the cadet is found medically unfit for entry into the National Defence Academy._ _*The scholarship will be cancelled and the amount recovered if the student is found to have obtained the scholarship by false statements, and the student will be blacklisted forever._ _*The student is liable to refund the scholarship amount if they discontinue the studies for which the scholarship was awarded during the course of the year._

application process.process: Step 1:   Qualifying the Entrance Examination and Securing Admission The applicant must first appear for and successfully qualify in the Annual Entrance examination conducted by the All India Sainik School Society to become eligible for consideration. Following qualification, the applicant must secure admission to Sainik School Chhingchhip, Mizoram, as the scholarship is specifically available only for studies in this institution. Step 2:   Submission of Financial Documentation at Admission At the time of formal admission to the Sainik School, the parent or guardian of the eligible student must submit the necessary financial documentation to the concerned Institution for the grant of scholarship. This mandatory submission includes providing valid Income certificates and/or Salary certificates to determine the applicable scholarship rate (Rate I, II, or III) based on the financial criteria for the Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, or General Category. Step 3:   Institutional Submission to the Awarding Authority After the Institution finalizes the selected and admitted lists, it shall compile and forward the list of eligible cadets to the Nodal Department. The scheme's administrative authority is the Mizoram Scholarship Board, which serves as the Nodal Department responsible for administration and implementation. Scholarship Disbursal and Reimbursement The Mizoram Scholarship Board, acting as the awarding authority, will disburse the State’s share of the approved scholarship amount directly to the Institution. This payment method ensures that the Institution is reimbursed for all the approved compulsory fees that the cadet is liable to pay. Renewal and Continuation Check The scholarship is provided for one year and is renewable according to the scheme's Rules and Conditions. For subsequent years, the scholarship payment will follow the month up to which it was paid in the preceding year, contingent upon the student maintaining satisfactory academic progress and conduct.

Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000/- (UG Stude.details: The "Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000/- (UG Students Only)" scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide tuition fee concessions to students enrolled in 3-year undergraduate programs and 4-year veterinary programs.
Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000/- (UG Stude.benefits: Under this scheme, tuition fee concessions (Freeship Tuition Fees) are provided to eligible students.
Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000/- (UG Stude.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in a 3-year undergraduate program or a 4-year veterinary program at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar.

application process.process: First, applications are invited from students using the prescribed form. Based on the applications received, the Dean of Student Welfare prepares a list of students following the prescribed procedure. This list is then approved by the Registrar and the Vice-Chancellor. Research Study/Seminar (Grant-in-Aid Sch.details: “Research Study/Seminar (Grant-in-Aid Scheme)” was launched by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MOSPI), Government of India. The scheme aims to promote Research Studies and Seminars in official statistics by way of providing financial assistance and data support under the Grant-in-Aid component of the Scheme Capacity Development. The scheme is implemented by the Central Statistics Office (CSO), Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation, Government of India. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submission to the Additional Director General, Training Division, Central Statistical Organisation.
Research Study/Seminar (Grant-in-Aid Sch.benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** - Financial assistance for Research Studies/Surveys would be up to a maximum of ₹50,00,000/-. - In exceptional cases, the limit for Research Studies/Surveys could be enhanced up to ₹1,00,00,000/- with the approval of the Secretary, Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI). - The quantum of financial assistance for National Seminars/Workshops/Conferences will be maximum ₹10,00,000/-. - The quantum of financial assistance for International Seminars/Workshops/Conferences will be maximum ₹20,00,000/-. - Financial assistance is provided towards the travel cost and related expenditures for presentation of accepted research papers in Theoretical/Applied Statistics in International Conferences/Seminars/Workshops, etc., held outside India. Such assistance includes airfare, registration fee, airport tax, visa fee, and per diem, as per the Government rules in force. ##### ***Conditions*** - Research Studies/Surveys: The assistance will be released in three installments in the proportion of 40:40:20. - Seminars/Workshops/Conferences: The amount will be released in two installments: the First installment of 50% before/during the Seminars/Workshops/Conferences after approval, and the remaining 50% based on actual expenditure as reimbursement. - Travel Grants Assistance: The return air ticket (to and from) of a national carrier, i.e., Air India, will be provided by the shortest air route for the economy class. Financial assistance towards travel cost will cover all expenditures on travel between the place of work or place of residence and the airport in India, and between the airport abroad and the venue of the conference. _*Release of assistance is linked to specific milestones to be achieved as per the time schedule indicated in the proposal and is aligned to the duration of the project._
Research Study/Seminar (Grant-in-Aid Sch.eligibility: ##### ***For Professional/Research Institutions/Organizations (Grant-in-Aid for Research Studies/Seminars)*** - The applicant must be a professional/research institution/organization. - The applicant must be engaged in the field of official statistics for a minimum period of three (3) years. - The applicant must possess qualified statisticians, economists, and social scientists. - The applicant must fall into one of the following categories: a) Government institutions including Directorates of Economics and Statistics of States/Union Territories. b) Institutions/organizations receiving annual recurring grants from the Central or State Government Agencies including Indian Statistical Institute, Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), University Grants Commission (UGC), etc.. c) Institutions/organizations registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act. d) Institutions/organizations registered as 'Trusts' under Trusteeship Act. e) Institutions/organizations incorporated under the Companies Act. - The applicant institution/organization shall be "not-for-profit" to be eligible for assistance under the Scheme for National and International Seminars/Conferences/Workshops etc. on official statistics. ##### ***For Officials (Travel Grants Assistance - TGA)*** - The applicant must be an official of the Central Government/Central autonomous institutions/university. - The applicant's visit must relate to the area of work of the officer. - The applicant's technical paper should have been submitted through proper official channel in such event and not out of the officer's own volition. - The applicant must have an official invitation from the host organization to the administrative Ministry/Department/Organization. - The applicant must have appropriate documentary evidence of acceptance of the paper for presentation by the agencies organizing the international statistical conferences/seminar/workshop, etc.. - The applicant must have obtained all necessary clearances, including political clearance from the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), and Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) clearance from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) (wherever required). - The applicant must not have had more than one proposal recommended for travel grants during the financial year for presenting their paper abroad.
Research Study/Seminar (Grant-in-Aid Sch.exclusions: - The applicant will not receive financial assistance for proposals relating to pure theoretical research in statistics. - The applicant will not receive financial assistance for proposals for holding annual meetings of statistical associations/societies. - The applicant must know that financial assistance is not available for incurring any capital expenditure. - The applicant must know that the salary of the Project Director/Experts, if he or she is working as a regular employee of the institute, would not be charged from the project cost during the project period.

application process.process: Step 1: Application Preparation and Proposal Formatting The applicant institution/organization seeking financial assistance should take print of the  prescribed format. For research studies, the proposal must contain four distinct parts: a forwarding letter, a profile of the institution (not exceeding two pages), technical details, and financial details. *The technical details must be furnished concisely, completely, and logically, detailing the objectives, methodology, specific outputs envisaged, and likely potential and value addition to official statistics. Step 2: Submission of Application and Supporting Documents The proposal should be submitted to the Additional Director General, Training Division, Central Statistical Organisation (CSO), Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI). The applications can be sent via email to  training-mospi@nic.in  (for studies) or  training-mospi@gov.in  (for Travel Grants Assistance). Application Deadlines For Seminars/Conferences, the proposal must be submitted at least six months in advance from the date of the event. For Travel Grants Assistance, the application should reach the Ministry at least six months before the proposed event for consideration.

Award of Merit Scholarship for Agricultu.details: The “Award of Merit Scholarship for Agricultural Engineering Students (B.Tech 3rd/4th Year)” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support meritorious students pursuing B.Tech in Agricultural Engineering in their 3rd and 4th years by providing a one-year scholarship.
Award of Merit Scholarship for Agricultu.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in the 3rd or 4th year of the B.Tech (Agricultural Engineering) course at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar. 1. The scholarship is awarded for a duration of one year only.

application process.process: Students are first invited to submit their applications on the prescribed form. A committee, constituted by the Vice Chancellor, then reviews and evaluates these applications following a defined procedure. Based on the committee’s recommendations, the Vice Chancellor grants approval, after which the students receive their payments.

SC Girl Child Literacy Incentive Amount.details: Under this scheme, Scheduled Caste girl students studying in Class 11 receive financial support from the Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to ensure that girls from SC communities continue their education without financial barriers. Applications are accepted online through the Shiksha Portal, and the eligible amount is directly transferred to the student’s account after verification.
SC Girl Child Literacy Incentive Amount.benefits: Eligible SC girl students of Class 11 receive an annual financial incentive of ₹3,000/-, credited directly to their bank account
SC Girl Child Literacy Incentive Amount.eligibility: 1. Applicant must be a scheduled Caste girl students. 1. Applicant should have a attested photocopy of the permanent caste certificate from the Sub-Divisional Officer (Revenue). 1. Applicant's father or guardian must not be an income tax payer and self-declaration. 1. The student must be in continuous study.

application process.process: To avail of the benefits under this scheme, eligible students can contact the Principal of their respective government schools/institutions. Note:  The student's profile is entered on the education portal  https://shikshaportal.mp.gov.in/  by the teacher of the educational institution as per the record/certificate provided by the student.

NIPUN Bharat Mission - Uttarakhand.details: The “NIPUN Bharat Mission” is a scheme under the Samagra Shiksha Programme, implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to ensure that all children aged 3 to 9 achieve foundational literacy and numeracy by creating an enabling learning environment across all schools in Uttarakhand.
NIPUN Bharat Mission - Uttarakhand.benefits: Under this mission, all children can get admission in Class 1 as per the admission norms of all schools in the state.
NIPUN Bharat Mission - Uttarakhand.eligibility: 1. The beneficiary must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. All children aged 3 to 9 years are eligible to benefit from the scheme to achieve foundational literacy and numeracy.

application process.process: The main objective of the Nipun Bharat Mission is to create an enabling environment to ensure universal attainment of basic literacy and numeracy. Admissions can be obtained in Class 1 as per admission norms in all schools of the state.

Financial Assistance to Students who Cle.details: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Students who Cleared Civil Services Prelims Conducted by UPSC/APSC” was launched by the Tea Tribes and Adivasi Welfare Department, Government of Assam. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi Community who have cleared the Civil Services Preliminary Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission or Assam Public Service Commission during the current year, so that they are supported in their preparation for the Mains Examination and succeed. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
Financial Assistance to Students who Cle.benefits: - Financial assistance to students belonging to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi Community who have cleared the Civil Services Preliminary Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission/Assam Public Service Commission during the current year. - The assistance is intended to support them in their preparation for the Mains Examination and succeed.
Financial Assistance to Students who Cle.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Assam and must belong to the Tea Tribes and Adivasi community. - The applicant must produce a valid Caste certificate which is duly certified/issued by the District Commissioner of the concerned district or his/her designated officer. - The applicant should have cleared the Civil Services Preliminary Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission/Assam Public Service Commission during the current year. - The applicant must produce his/her copy of the admit card and result of the Civil Services Preliminary Examination conducted by the Union Public Service Commission/Assam Public Service Commission. - The applicant should not be a Government service holder.
Financial Assistance to Students who Cle.exclusions: - The applicants who have cleared both the Civil Services Preliminary Examinations Conducted by the Union Public Service Commission and Assam Public Service Commission in the same year shall be considered for scholarship only for the Union Public Service Commission Prelims. - The applicant should not be a Government service holder.

application process.process: Step 1:  Portal Access and Scheme Selection A. Navigating to the Portal:  The applicant must first open the official Tea Tribes Welfare Department URL, www.ttwd.assam.gov.in, and then click the "Online Application" link to be redirected to the  SIRISH application portal . B. Initial Login or Registration:  New users must register themselves on the online portal, while existing users will log in using the username and password created during prior registration. C. Selecting the Scheme:  Once the applicant is logged into the Dashboard, they must select the appropriate scholarship scheme from the dropdown menu available. Step 2:   Entering Personal Details A. Inputting Mandatory Data:  The applicant proceeds to enter Personal Details where all required information in the application form must be accurately provided. B. Specifying Location Details:  Location data, including District, Assembly Constituency, and Sub-Division, must be selected, along with other essential address details like Village/Town. C. Saving Personal Information:  After filling in all necessary fields in this step, the applicant must click on the "Save Form Details" button to proceed further with the application. Step 3:   Document Upload A. Uploading Required Files:  Under the Upload Documents tab, the applicant must upload all required supporting documents in the specified image formats (e.g., JPG/JPEG). B. Document Formatting Check:  All uploaded documents must adhere to specified maximum file sizes (e.g., photo maximum 50 KB, other documents generally 100 KB) before they can be saved. Step 4:   Updating Bank Details A. Providing Account Information:  The applicant must enter the Bank Account Number and the name of the bank under the "Update Bank Details" tab. B. Entering Branch Identification:  Details essential for electronic transfer, specifically the Bank Branch Name and the corresponding IFSC Code, must be accurately provided. C. Securing Financial Data:  Once all bank details have been correctly entered, the applicant must click on the "Save Bank Details" button to confirm the information. Step 5:   Preview and Final Submission A. Application Review:  "Preview Application and Final Submission", displays all details entered in the form for a thorough and final check. B. Final Confirmation:  After cross-checking all information and uploaded documents for accuracy, the applicant must confirm the application by clicking the "Proceed with Submit Application" button. C. Tracking Status:  Upon successful submission, an application number will be visible on the screen, allowing the applicant to view the status under the "APPLICATION STATUS" tab.

Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.details: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan Scholarship Scheme (Junior Level)” is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote academic excellence among students entering Classes 6, 7, and 8 by providing financial assistance to meritorious students, based on their performance in a competitive examination conducted by the State Council of Educational Research and Training (SCERT), Uttarakhand.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.benefits: **Rate of Scholarship:** - **For Class 6th Students:** ₹600/- per month for 1 year.- **For Class 7th Students:** ₹700/- per month for 1 year.- **For Class 8th Students:** ₹800/- per month for 1 year.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.eligibility: 1. The student must have passed Class 5 (institutional) from a Government School or Government-aided private school of the state (excluding Central and Residential schools) and must be studying in Class 6. 1. The applicant must qualify in the competitive examination conducted by SCERT, Uttarakhand. 1. Based on the examination results, a student securing a position in the top 10% of the total participants will be eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme. 1. The selected student must maintain a minimum of 75% attendance and secure at least 60% marks in Classes 6 and 7. For SC/ST students, a relaxation of 5% is provided in both marks and attendance requirements. 1. There is no income criterion for the parents/guardians of the student under this scholarship. 1. A student cannot avail double benefits under multiple state scholarship schemes.

application process.process: To appear in the scholarship examination, a student can collect the application form from the Block Education Officer’s office or download it from the School Education Department’s website ( https://schooleducation.uk.gov.in ) or the SCERT Uttarakhand website ( https://scert.uk.gov.in/ ) during the months of June-July every year. At present, the application process is offline, and no application or examination fee is required. While filling the application form, the student must attach a passport-size photograph, Aadhaar card, Class 5 passing certificate, admission card for Class 6, caste certificate if applicable, disability certificate if applicable, and Aadhaar-linked bank account details. The student must ensure that all information provided in the form is correct and then submit it to the Principal of the school where he or she is studying. The Principal verifies the form on the basis of documents and school records, attests the photograph, and forwards the form to the Block Education Officer’s office by the stipulated date, which is usually around 21st August. After verification, the Block Education Officer issues the admit card. Students can collect the admit card from their school or from the Block Education Officer’s office. The examination is conducted every year in September in an objective-type multiple-choice format. Students who are placed in the merit list are informed by the Principal, after which the scholarship amount is directly credited to the student’s bank account.

Smt. Bimla Rani Memorial Award (B.Sc. Ag.details: The “Smt. Bimla Rani Memorial Award (B.Sc. Ag., B.V.Sc. & A.H., B.H.Sc. & B.F.Sc.)” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and encourage meritorious students pursuing Bachelor of Science in Agriculture (B.Sc. Ag.), Bachelor of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry (B.V.Sc. & A.H.), Bachelor of Home Science (B.H.Sc.), and Bachelor of Fisheries Science (B.F.Sc.) courses.
Smt. Bimla Rani Memorial Award (B.Sc. Ag.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in the Bachelor of Science in Agriculture (B.Sc. Ag.), Bachelor of Veterinary Science and Animal Husbandry (B.V.Sc. & A.H.), Bachelor of Home Science (B.H.Sc.), or Bachelor of Fisheries Science (B.F.Sc.) course at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar. 1. The award amount is granted for a duration of one year only.

A committee, constituted by the Vice Chancellor, then reviews and evaluates these applications following a defined procedure. Based on the committee’s recommendations, the Vice Chancellor grants approval, after which the selected students receive the payments.

Smt. Uma Gupta Fellowship for M.Sc. Agri.details: The “Smt. Uma Gupta Fellowship for M.Sc. Agriculture (Genetics & Plant Breeding) Students” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance and encourage meritorious students pursuing the M.Sc. H.P. Swaran Jayanti Middle Merit Scholar.details:
The scheme “**H.P. Swaran Jayanti Middle Merit Scholarship Scheme**&quot; for Govt. Schools was launched by the Department of Elementary Education, Government of Himachal Pradesh for students studying in Class V is meant to identify the talent and nurture it at an early stage. The meritorious students for the award of benefits under the scheme will be selected through a state-level examination. The examination will be conducted every year at the state level by the SCERT, Solan (H.P.). A total of 100 scholarships can be distributed among twelve districts of the State, determining the district quota based on an average of the last three years&#39; enrollment in class five (as per UDISE data of the latest three years) of the Government Schools in the State. The main objective of this scheme is to select Top 100 Students for scholarship after passing class Vth.

  - **Important Dates:** 
Tentative dates for submission of the application form and conduct of examination etc. are given below:
**Sl. No.****Important Dates****Date**1Date of advertisement	for the examinationWill be fixed by SCERT2Date of applying for creation of login ID of Primary Schools for the examinationWill be fixed by SCERT3Last Date of SubmissionWill be fixed by SCERT4Date of Issuing of Roll NumberWill be fixed by SCERT5Date of ExaminationFirst Sunday of the month of November 6Declaration of ResultIn the month of December
  - **The pattern of Examination:** 
The state-level examination will comprise one test of 100 marks consisting of 100 multiple-choice questions of one mark each. The question paper will cover mental ability tests, scholastic aptitude tests, and language tests with the following distribution of marks:
**Sl. No.****Question Paper****Number of Questions**1Mental Ability test40 questions2Environment Science Scholastic Aptitude Test20 questions3Mathematics20 questions4Language TestHindi10 questionsEnglish10 questions
  - **Mental Ability Test:** 
It will be for testing verbal and non-verbal Metacognitive abilities like reasoning and critical thinking. The question in the test may be on analogy, classification, numerical series, pattern perception, hidden figures, etc.

  - **Scholastic Aptitude Test:** 
It will cover subjects mainly Mathematics &amp; Environment Science as taught up to 5th Class in the Govt. Schools of the State.

  - **Language Test:** 
It will test the general understanding of Hindi and English language according to the curriculum of Class 1 to Class 5 of the Govt. Primary Schools in Himachal Pradesh.

  - **Duration of Examination:** 

The test will be of two &amp; half hours (150 minutes) in duration. Children with a disability may be given half an hour of extra time.

  - **Process of examination:** 
The centers of examination, important dates, and other details regarding the examination for the scholarship scheme will be notified through advertisements in daily newspapers. The information will also be available on the official website of SCERT, Solan (H.P.). SCERT will prepare and print the question paper and OMR sheets for the examination.
**Note:** There will be no negative marking in the examination.

Scholarship Amount ₹4000/- per month (for 12 months, in 6th class)Scholarship Amount ₹5000/- per month (for 12 months, in 7th class)Scholarship Amount ₹6000/- per month (for 12 months, in 8th class)**Note:** The period of the scholarship shall be for three years (Class 6th to Class 8th).
