( Renewal Form ) To qualify, they must have secured at least 50% marks and passed in second division in their last examination.

Scheme of Internship of Students to DRDO.details: The scheme &quot;Scheme of Internship of Students to DRDO Labs/Estts for Project Training&quot; has been launched by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), Ministry of Defence. It aims to provide an opportunity and exposure to prospective graduates and postgraduates in Engineering and General Sciences to the research and development activities carried out by DRDO in state-of-the-art technology fields relevant to the defense sector.
Scheme of Internship of Students to DRDO.benefits:
1. Internship Training is provided in the areas relevant to DRDO.
   1. Provide opportunity to interns to be associated with projects.

**Note:** DRDO shall not be liable for any compensation in case of personal injury resulting from an accident occurring during the students&#39; attachment to DRDO Labs/Establishments.
***Duration of Training:***

  - The period of training generally is 4 weeks to 6 Months.

**Note:** The duration of training will depend on the type of course and is subject to the discretion of the Lab Director.
Scheme of Internship of Students to DRDO.eligibility:
1. Students pursuing undergraduate or postgraduate degrees in Engineering or General Sciences are eligible.
   1. Interns will be permitted access only to UNCLASSIFIED areas of DRDO Labs/Establishments.

**Note 1:** The provisions of the Apprentices Act, 1961, do not apply to this scheme.
**Note 2:** DRDO is under no obligation to offer employment to students upon completion of their training.

application process.process: Students who are interested can apply through their respective institutes or colleges by corresponding with concerned laboratories or establishments that align with their academic disciplines. Internship training will be permitted subject to available vacancies in labs and approval by the Lab Director. Note:  Students are requested to identify the lab as per subject discipline and may apply directly to the concerned lab and not to DRDO HQ, in this regard.

Distance Education Scheme for Girls.details:
The &quot;Distance Education Scheme for Girls&quot; scheme was launched by the Higher Education Department, Government of Rajasthan in 2022. It aims to provide distance education opportunities to girls and women who are unable to attend college or university regularly due to family or other reasons. Under this scheme, the fees for undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma, and certificate courses are reimbursed for girls from Rajasthan pursuing distance education.
***Objectives:***

  - To support education of girl child in UG, PG, Diploma, Certificate courses under ODL (open and distance learning) by reimbursing fee.
  - To improve Gross Enrollment Ratio (GER) as well as the ratio of female and male proportional representation in higher education that is, Gender Parity Index (GPI).

***Target Group:***

  - Girl students of Rajasthan who are admitted in courses under distance education mode in the state funded Universities/ State Government Institutes including IGNOU.
  - State funded Universities of Rajasthan included under section 2(f) &amp; and 12(B) of UGC Act and IGNOU are only allowed in the scheme.
Distance Education Scheme for Girls.benefits:
***Reimbursement of full course fees for distance Education in:***

- Undergraduate (UG) courses
- Postgraduate (PG) courses
- Diploma courses
- Certificate and PG Diploma courses

**Note:** No other additional grant will be payable.
***Duration of Fee Disbursement:***

- After selection, the candidate's fee will be reimbursed on Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode on annual basis on satisfactory academic performance of the student.
- The fee reimbursement would be awarded from the date of joining the course as certified by the University/Institution.
Distance Education Scheme for Girls.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a girl student.
   1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should be enrolled in UG, PG, Diploma, Certificate or PG Diploma courses under distance education mode.
   1. The applicant should be studying in a state-funded university or government institution in Rajasthan, including IGNOU (Indira Gandhi National Open University).
   1. The applicant who is availing of other fee reimbursement in State Government Schemes during the same tenure is not eligible in this scheme. But these students will get reimbursement of difference amount of &quot;Existing Scholarship&quot; and &quot;Distance Education Scheme for Girls&quot;.
   1. Students holding prize/incentive scholarships are not excluded from applying for this scheme.

**Note:** The student who is eligible for distance education course in Post Matric/Other Scheme of Social Justice Department, Govt. of Rajasthan will get fee reimbursement from the existing process of fee reimbursement under Social Justice Department/ Other Department. The student will not get fee reimbursement from SJE portal under the category &quot;DE-HE&quot;.

Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel.details: The scheme "Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel Scheme" is a Welfare Scheme by the BC & EBC Welfare Department, Government of Bihar. Under this scheme, the Backward Classes and Extremely Backward Classes Welfare Department, Bihar, Patna provides residential facilities to students studying in educational institutions near the Saharsa District Headquarters Hostel. To support hostel residents, students receive 9 kg of rice and 6 kg of wheat per month under the Chief Minister's Hostel Foodgrain Scheme and ₹1000/- per month under the Chief Minister's Hostel Grant Scheme.
Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel.benefits:
- 9 kg rice and 6 kg wheat per student per month.
- ₹1000/- monthly grant under the Chief Minister’s Hostel Grant Scheme.
Jan-Nayak Karpoori Thakur Kalyan Hostel.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Bihar.
1. The applicant should be studying in the current session in an educational institution nearest to the hostel.
1. The applicant should belong to the Extremely Backward Class (EBC).
1. The applicant should be studying in Class 10+2 or higher.

application process.process: Step 1:  Collect the prescribed application form for hostel admission for the academic session 2024-25. Step 2:  Submit the completed form to the District Backward & Extremely Backward Class Welfare Office, Saharsa, on any working day before the deadline. Note:  For more details, visit the district website Saharsa.bih.nic.in.

Free Computer Training.details: The scheme "Free Computer Training" is implemented by the State Sainik Board under the Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a one-year free training course (Computer / Accounting / Web Designing / Digital Marketing) to ex-servicemen, serving soldiers, their widows, and dependents who have passed the 12th standard.
Free Computer Training.benefits: Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries are provided with a one-year free training course in Computer, Accounting, Web Designing, or Digital Marketing.
Free Computer Training.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be an ex-serviceman, serving soldier, widow of a serviceman, or their dependent, and must have passed the 12th standard.

application process.process: Under the scheme, training is provided in all districts in the following subjects: Diploma in Computer Applications and Programming (Duration – 1 year) Diploma in Professional Accounting (Duration – 1 year) Web Designing and Development (Duration – 1 year) Digital Marketing (Duration – 1 year) The Director, Sainik Welfare Office, invites applications for these courses from ex-servicemen and their dependents through publicity campaigns. The following documents are required for application: General application form Aadhaar Card Ex-serviceman Identity Card Discharge Book Educational certificate (12th pass) After verification, the concerned District Sainik Welfare Office forwards the list of eligible applicants to the training institute. The institute then informs the selected candidates and commences the training program.

Free Scooty Distribution for Girls (GEN-.details: The "Free Scooty Distribution for Girls" scheme was launched by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Rajasthan in the year 2017-18, aims to encourage meritorious girl students belonging to the economically weaker section of the general category in the state. Under this scheme, meritorious girl students from government and private schools who have scored 85% or above in the Class 10th and 12th (Arts, Commerce, Science streams) examinations are provided with a free scooty, along with a helmet and petrol.
Free Scooty Distribution for Girls (GEN-.benefits: Under this scheme, Eligible girl students will receive a scooty, a helmet, and 2 liters of petrol.
Free Scooty Distribution for Girls (GEN-.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be a girl student. 
1. The applicant should belong to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) of General Category. 
1. The applicant's family annual income should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-.
1. The applicant should have studied in a government or private school in Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should have secured at least 85% marks in class 10th or 12th.
Free Scooty Distribution for Girls (GEN-.exclusions: - The applicant should not have received a scooty through any other scheme.

Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the respective school where the education is completed.

Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competitio.details:
The &quot;Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competition Scheme for Class 10th–12th and College/University/Institution Students in 22 Indian Languages and English&quot; is implemented by the Dr. Ambedkar Foundation under the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India. Under this scheme, cash prizes and recognition are awarded to school and college/university students who write insightful essays on Babasaheb Ambedkar’s thoughts on social justice, empowerment, and national integration.
***Objective:***
The primary objective of this Essay Competition is to encourage school, college and university students of 10th and 12th standards to write on the contribution of Babasaheb, particularly on his thoughts on social justice, empowerment of the depressed section, removal of caste-based discriminations like untouchability and atrocities on Dalits, national integration, communal harmony and the like.
***Topics:***
The topics of the essay shall be selected every year by the respective Chairs from the themes based on Dr. Ambedkar’s thoughts on social justice, removal of inequality and discrimination, ameliorating the conditions of weaker sections of the society, removal of untouchability, caste-based prejudices, disparities, equality of opportunity, social democracy etc.
***Medium:***
The essays may be written in Indian Languages and English.
***Indian languages:***
(1) Assamese, (2) Bengali, (3) Gujarati, (4) Hindi, (5) Kannada, (6) Kashmiri, (7) Konkani, (8) Malayalam, (9) Manipuri, (10) Marathi, (11) Nepali, (12) Odiya, (13) Punjabi, (14) Sanskrit, (15) Sindhi, (16) Tamil, (17) Telugu, (18) Urdu (19) Bodo, (20) Santhali, (21) Maithili and (22) Dogri.
Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competitio.benefits:
***The winning students of the recognized colleges/universities/institutions will be given the following prizes:***
**Language** **1st prize (₹)** **2nd prize (₹)****3rd prize (₹)**Hindi1,00,000/-50,000/-25,000/-English1,00,000/-50,000/-25,000/-Indian Languages1,00,000/-50,000/-25,000/-***The winning students of the recognized school will be given the following prizes:***
**Language** **1st prize (₹)** **2nd prize (₹)****3rd prize (₹)**Hindi25,000/- 15,000/-10,000/-English25,000/- 15,000/-10,000/-Indian Languages25,000/- 15,000/-10,000/-***Other Benefits:***

- Winning students will be felicitated at the Dr. Ambedkar International Centre, New Delhi.
- Travel and accommodation expenses (₹4,000/day per person for 2 days) will be covered for each winner and their escort.
- Awardees will have sightseeing within Delhi at the cost of DAF.
- Awardees will receive a citation and a set of books on Babasaheb Ambedkar.

***Announcement of Prizes:***

- A full list of winners would be placed on the websites of the organizing Chair and/or on the Notice Board of that Chair.
- A full list of winners would be placed on the websites of the Foundation ([www.drambedkarfoundation.nic.in](https://ambedkarfoundation.nic.in)).- Winners may be invited to Delhi for felicitation in a befitting manner
Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competitio.eligibility:
1. Bonafide students from Secondary and Higher Secondary schools (10th and 12th Standard) registered under a state board or any of the central boards are eligible to participate.
   1. Bonafide students from colleges and universities recognized by the University Grants Commission (UGC) in India are also eligible to participate.

***Terms &amp; Conditions of the Competition:***

   1. There is no entry fee.
   1. The word limit of the essay will be 3500 words in English and 2500 words in Indian Languages.
   1. Each participant should submit only one essay entry on the suggested topic.
   1. The participants shall submit a certificate that the essay is their original work.
   1. Participants should submit one clean typed copy of the essay with name, address, school/college/university details, topic, language, e-mail, phone no., bank account details etc. with the participant&#39;s signature as well as the signature of the Head of the Institution.
   1. Submission of the essay entry to the competition implies the acceptance of the rules and regulations of the competition.
   1. No correspondence will be entertained in this regard.
   1. Plagiarism above 20 per cent will result in immediate disqualification.
   1. The student participant&#39;s name, e-mail address, postal address, institution, course and year of study, etc., should be indicated in the covering letter and strictly not in the essay.
   1. The organisers reserve the right to reject entries that do not conform to these guidelines.
   1. All entries received for competition will become the property of the respective Chairs and Dr. Ambedkar Foundation. The winning entries may be considered for publication in book form by the Chair and/or Foundation subject to the approval of the Editor, DAF.
   1. In all matters of dispute, the decision of the respective Chairs will be final and binding.
   1. The respective Chairs can further add additional terms and conditions in consultation with the Editor, DAF.
   1. In case of violation of any of the terms and conditions of the Competition, the participants may be barred from the Competition.

***Judging Criteria******:*** The essays will be judged by an evaluation committee (to be set up by the respective Chairs) for the selection of the prize-winning entries. The essays will be evaluated on the basis of contents, analysis/interpretation, presentation and writing skills as per the following provisions:	

  - Contents - 50 Marks
  - Analysis/ interpretation - 20 Marks
  - Presentation - 15 Marks
  - Writing Skills - 15 Marks

application process.process: Interested students may contact their respective school, college, or institution to apply under this scheme. Notes: The Dr. Ambedkar Foundation Essay Competition for students of recognized schools, colleges, universities, and institutions shall be held every year. An advertisement in this regard will be published in major national and regional newspapers. The advertisement will also be made available on the websites of the  Dr. Ambedkar Foundation  and the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment ( https://socialjustice.gov.in/ ). Advertisements will additionally be published on the websites of all the Ambedkar Chairs. Submit the complete entry (essay + documents) as per instructions provided by the implementing chair or Dr. Ambedkar Foundation. The list of winners will be published on the DAF website and notice boards of the implementing chair.

Merit cum Means Scholarship: Engineering.details: "Merit cum Means Scholarship: Engineering University" is a scholarship scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹1,000/- per month to eligible students for pursuing education from recognized engineering universities in Chhattisgarh. To be eligible, the student must have passed the 10+2 (or equivalent 12th grade) examination from any recognised institution located in Chhattisgarh, with a minimum of 45% marks. The total annual income of the student's father/guardian should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/-.
Merit cum Means Scholarship: Engineering.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native resident of Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be a Student. - The applicant must be currently studying in a recognised engineering university in Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must have passed the 10+2 (or equivalent 12th grade) examination from any recognised institution located in Chhattisgarh, with a minimum of 45% marks. - The total annual income of the student's father/guardian should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/-.
**OTHER CONDITIONS** - In addition to students studying in a recognised government educational institution located in Chhattisgarh, scholarships can be given in a limited number, based on merit, for regular study in BE/BTech courses in institutions outside the state approved by AICTE. Students regularly studying in institutions operated by a recognised university within the same campus will also be eligible for scholarships, even if they do not require AICTE approval. - As per the provision made in rule 1, these scholarships will be given to eligible students for degree courses in engineering in national importance institutions of the country such as All India Institutes of Technology (IITs) and other higher technical institutions operated by the government (Central or State government) such as (NITs) and science education institutions such as (IISc), even if they do not require AICTE approval. - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student who is regularly studying in a recognised institution and is receiving any scholarship can be allowed to do part-time work. - In special cases not covered under the provisions of these rules, the government will provide special scholarships to eligible students at the rate prescribed for each course of study, based on poverty and merit. The total annual expenditure incurred in this regard will not exceed the budget limit.

Scholarship for Chhattisgarh Students St.details: Launched in 2013, the scheme "Chhattisgarh Ke Mool Niwasi Chhatra/Chhatraon Ke Liye Chhatravritti" by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh, aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students who are native residents of Chhattisgarh and are pursuing engineering degrees. A significant benefit of this scheme is the provision of a monthly scholarship of ₹2,000/- to eligible students studying in recognized engineering colleges outside Chhattisgarh. Another key aspect is that there is no income limit specified for availing this scholarship. The primary eligibility criteria include being a native student of Chhattisgarh and currently enrolled in a recognized engineering degree program outside the state, having secured a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination. The scheme is implemented by the Director. The applications for this scheme are accepted as per the prevailing guidelines of the department.
Scholarship for Chhattisgarh Students St.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native resident student of Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be currently studying in a recognized engineering college outside Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be pursuing an engineering degree course. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination. - There is no income limit specified for the applicant.
**Other Conditions -** - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student, who is regularly studying in a recognized institution and is receiving any scholarship, can be allowed to do part-time work. - In special cases not covered under the provisions of these rules, the government will provide special scholarships to eligible students at the rate prescribed for each course of study, based on poverty and merit. The total annual expenditure incurred in this regard will not exceed the budget limit.

State Art Exhibition (Student Category).details: The "State Art Exhibition (Student Category)" is an annual event organized by the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa, to promote and encourage creativity in the visual arts field among local students. Kala Academy Goa annually organises the State Art Exhibition. The Exhibition is held under the promotion activity in the field of Visual Art with the view to encourage the local students and extend an opportunity to show their creative talents, as well as, to provide a facility for the general public to see, appreciate and enjoy the various modes of expressions. The Kala Academy endeavours to develop an atmosphere wherein student can express his/her feelings and ideas through the different media The State Art Exhibition will provide a glimpse into the latest works of the students. Goan Fine Art student are invited to contribute their works to different categories of the visual art namely > **Section -1 : Painting & Graphic Print** Consists of drawing and paintings, executed oil, water colours, inks, crayons or mix media collage and graphic prints. > **Section -2 : Applied Art & Graphic Design** Consists of Graphic design of visual communication, original or printed work in Applied Art & Creative Photography. > **Section -3 : Sculpture** Consists of work in stone, terra-cotta, metal, wood, marble, plastic and fibre glass etc. (works of clay, glass & other easily breakable material are not accepted)
State Art Exhibition (Student Category).benefits:
**Three main prizes will be awarded in each section/category:** - 1st Prize: ₹10,000/- - 2nd Prize: ₹7,000/- - 3rd Prize: ₹5,000/-
**Special Prizes:** - Ravji V. Gaunekar Memorial Prize by The Goa Hindu Association: ₹1,000/- - Artist to Artist Award by Smt. Prafulla Dahanukar: ₹15,000/- - Late Hanuman B. Neogi Memorial Prize: ₹1,000/-
State Art Exhibition (Student Category).eligibility: 1. A participant must be a bona fide student of any recognised art college or institution, studying one or more of the subjects in the exhibition sections. 1. If an art student submits their entry in the Student Category, they are not eligible to participate in the Artist Category. 1. Submission must include an official bonafide certificate from the student's institution; entries without it will not be accepted. 1. Declarations for Originality and Prior Exhibits - Each exhibit must be the student’s original work, neither a copy nor an imitation. A declaration to this effect must appear on the back of each entry. - If the work has previously won an award or been displayed in prior exhibitions by Kala Academy or any other institution, it will not be accepted, and a declaration to that effect must also be submitted. 1. Award Winners' Restriction for Next Year 1. A participant who receives an award in a given year is not eligible to receive an award in the same section in the following year

application process.process: Entry Form & Bonafide Certificate The form provided-with the prospectus must be filled in all respects and duly signed by the Art student. Include a bonafide certificate from your art institution—entries lacking this will not be accepted. Entry Fee A non-refundable cash fee of ₹50/- per section. If applying in multiple sections, pay separately for each. The receipt number must be recorded on the entry form. Declaration of Originality On the back of each artwork, declare that it is your original work (not copied or imitated). Confirm it has not won any prior awards or been displayed earlier; again, this must be stated on the entry form. Entries lacking proper declaration may be rejected. Submission Details Submit your artwork and form in person at the Art Gallery, Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji – Goa. Entry dates for the 49th State Art Exhibition (2024–2025) were 10th & 11th March 2025, between 10:00 a.m.–1:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m.–4:00 p.m. Artwork Specifications & Handling Painting & Graphic Prints: Max size 4 ft (vertical or horizontal) Applied Art & Graphic Design: Max size 30 inches (vertical or horizontal) Sculpture: Medium-sized and durable enough to handle and transport safelykalaacademygoa.co.in Pieces must be mounted or framed, with ring hooks or a hanging mechanism on the back—unframed/mounted works may be disqualified. Judging & Exhibition Rules A three-member jury will evaluate the entries; awards may be withheld if standards aren’t met Judges’ decisions are final and binding Exhibits must remain in place during the exhibition period, and may only be removed with written permission from the Member Secretary. Post-Exhibition Collection Collect your work within two days after the exhibition ends. Unclaimed works become the property of Kala Academy and may be disposed of—with no claims entertained Other Important Notes Students who previously won awards in a section cannot win in the same section the following year.

Mukhyamantri Uchcha Shiksha Shodh Protsa.details: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Uchcha Shiksha Shodh Protsahan Yojana" was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote high-quality, interdisciplinary research in higher education institutions across the state. The broad subject areas for research include Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, and Commerce & Management, while proposals in interdisciplinary subject areas are also encouraged.
Mukhyamantri Uchcha Shiksha Shodh Protsa.benefits: The maximum research grant provided by the state government is ₹15 lakh, which may be increased up to ₹18 lakh in special circumstances.
Mukhyamantri Uchcha Shiksha Shodh Protsa.eligibility: 1. The regular professors working in state government colleges and state university campuses of Uttarakhand, as well as students and research scholars enrolled in regular programs at recognized institutions within the state, are eligible to apply. 1. A research proposal may also include a co-investigator alongside the principal investigator. 1. The broad subject areas for research include Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, and Commerce & Management, while interdisciplinary subjects will also be accepted. 1. Research related to the state that proves to be productive and useful in social, economic, contemporary, or other areas of special importance will be encouraged. 1. Priority will be given to problem-oriented, solution-driven, and action-based research topics (Problem and Action-Based Research Programme). 1. Research proposals may also be invited based on requests for specific issues raised by any department of the state government. 1. A maximum period of two years will be allowed for completing the research work, which may be extended by one additional year under special circumstances. 1. Only one research project will be permitted for any teacher or research scholar at a time.

application process.process: Researchers must submit their research proposals online through the Samarth portal ( https://uttarakhand.samarth.ac.in/index/site/login ). During the application process, the proposal must be uploaded and forwarded by the institution’s Principal or Registrar within fifteen days of submission; otherwise, it will automatically move to the next level. The proposal will then be evaluated by the Evaluation Committee, and the research grant will be released in three installments via DBT to the institution’s Research and Development Cell account. Upon the written request of the Principal Investigator, the Principal or Registrar must make the grant available to the Principal Investigator or Researcher within three days. If this is not done, the State Research and Development Cell Committee must be informed through the Director of Education with clear written reasons, and the final decision will rest with the Secretary, Higher Education/Committee. The first installment, amounting to 50% of the grant, will be released upon approval of the research proposal. The second installment, amounting to 30%, will be released only after submission of the utilization certificate. The third and final installment, amounting to 20%, will be released upon completion of the research work. The research must be original and in accordance with UGC standards. A Research Assistant will receive a stipend of ₹5,000 per month from the release of the first installment until the completion of the research work.

Operation of Ashram Hostels.details: The scheme &quot;Operation of Ashram Hostels&quot; was launched by the Department of Tribal Area Development, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to ensure continued education for tribal students who lack access to nearby higher-level schools due to the poor economic condition of their families. Under this scheme, free accommodation, nutritious meals, educational materials, uniforms, personal hygiene items, and other facilities are provided to Scheduled Tribe (ST) students residing in ashram hostels operated by the Tribal Area Development Department.
Operation of Ashram Hostels.benefits:
> **Students are provided with the following annually and monthly benefits:**

**Annually (per student):**

Through this scheme, a full tuition fee waiver is granted to selected students whose annual family income is less than ₹1,00,000. The benefit is especially extended to girls for an additional academic year. The scheme is implemented by the Office of the Dean Student Welfare in accordance with university regulations. Applications are scrutinized and the final list is approved by university authorities.
Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG student.benefits: - Eligible students get a 100% tuition fee waiver. - Aims to reduce the financial burden on low-income families and encourage academic excellence. - The fee waiver is directly applied during fee processing. - Granted once every academic year, at the beginning of the session. - Disbursed after the final selection list is approved by the Registrar and Vice Chancellor. - Validity: Boys: Up to 3 academic years Girls: Up to 4 academic years
Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG student.eligibility:
- The applicant should be enrolled as an undergraduate student at Govind Ballabh Pant University.
- The applicant’s annual family income should be less than ₹1,00,000.
- The applicant must be among the best-performing students as per the university’s merit guidelines.
- The applicant must submit the application in the prescribed format within the deadline

Step 4: Once approved, the final list of selected students is issued by an office order. Step 5: Approved students receive the tuition fee exemption accordingly.

Stipends to Students of Socially and Edu.details: The scheme “Stipends to Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC” by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote inclusive education by financially supporting students from Socially and Educationally Backward Classes pursuing technical and vocational education after SSC. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department. It specifically benefits those enrolled in professional or Government ITI courses and belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/-.
Stipends to Students of Socially and Edu.benefits: - **Stipend:** A monthly stipend of ₹400/- is given to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes students for one year of recognized professional and Government ITI courses.
Stipends to Students of Socially and Edu.eligibility:

- The applicant should belong to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes.
- The applicant should be a student who has passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination.
- The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized professional or Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI) course.
- The applicant’s individual and family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/- per annum.

New Akanksha Scheme (Higher Education Lo.benefits: **Educational Loan Details:** **1. Loan Amount:** - Up to ₹15,00,000/- **2. Interest Rate:** - 3.5% for female students - 4% for male students **3. Contribution:** - 95% contribution from the Corporation/State Government, - 5% from the beneficiary

application process.process: Step 1: Register on the Official Portal Go to the  Official Website Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam. Scroll down on the homepage, find the "New Aspiration Higher Education Scheme" and click on "Apply Now". You will be directed to the  application form . Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form Complete all sections under "Applicant information," including personal identifiers (Aadhaar No., Ration No., Voter ID), full name, father/husband's name, gender, complete address details, contact numbers, and income details (Applicant's income statement number, Date of receipt of income, Name of the officer issuing the income tax return, Total annual family income). Also provide Date of Birth, Age, Caste, and Subspecies. Also, if you are disabled and provide a percentage. For each applicable qualification (SSC, HSC, Diploma, Degree, Graduation), tick the checkbox and fill in the Degree, Board/University Name, Academic year, and Percentage obtained. Fill in details about the college/institution admitted to, university affiliation, course name, enrollment number, organisation address, website, course duration (in years and semester), and date of admission. Specify who accredited the course/institution, their name, and address. Proof of accreditation must be submitted. Select "Yes" or "No" for "Have you obtained admission through government-mandated admission?". If staying in a hostel, provide the Hostel name, Hostel address, and Hostel contact number. Fill in the requested loan amounts for Admission Fee, Tuition Fee, Examination Fee, Hostel Fee, Estimated cost of books/stationery, and Other fees. List details of any physical assets owned (land, house, government property, NCC, LIC, KVP, etc.). Indicate if anyone in the family works in a government/private sector job. If "Yes," provide Name, Designation, Place, and Salary details. Fill in the Bank Account Number, select the Bank Name from the dropdown, provide the Branch Name, Name as per Account, select Bank Account Type (Saving/Current), and enter the MICR Code and IFSC Code. Step 3: Review and Final Submission Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Fill out the provided "CAPTCHA" and Click on “Submit”. Go to the  Official Website   Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam. Scroll down and locate the Know App Status. Click on "Know App Status". Select the Scheme name, Enter App No., and Birth Date. Prof. Joseph Mundassery Scholarship Awar.details: The scheme "Prof. Joseph Mundassery Scholarship Award" was introduced by the Department of Minority Welfare, Government of Kerala. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to financially backward students from minority communities. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of scholarship amounts is provided to eligible students from Christian, Buddhist, Jain, Sikh, Muslim, and Parsi communities to pursue higher education. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Minority Welfare, Government of Kerala.
Prof. Joseph Mundassery Scholarship Awar.benefits: - The students who score an A+ in Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC)/Plus Two (12) or Technical High School Leaving Certificate(THSL) will get ₹10,000/-. - The undergraduate students with 80% marks will get ₹15,000/-. - The postgraduate student with 75% marks will get ₹15,000/-.
Prof. Joseph Mundassery Scholarship Awar.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent citizen of Kerala. - The applicant must belong to a minority community (Christian, Buddhist, Jain, Sikh, Muslim, or Parsi). - The applicant shall be from a below-poverty-line family. - The applicant shall be studying in any government school. - The annual income of the candidate’s family must be below ₹8,00,000/- per year. - The applicant pursuing SSLC, Plus Two, or Vocational Higher Secondary Education (VHSE) level must have a Full A+ grade to avail the scholarship. - The applicant pursuing undergraduate studies must have 80% marks to avail the scholarship. - The applicant pursuing postgraduate studies must have 75% marks to avail the scholarship.

APJ Abdul Kalam Scholarship.details:
The A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Scholarship (APJAK) is administered by the Minority Welfare Department of Kerala for the academic year. This scholarship program aims to support students from various religious minority groups (Muslim, Christian (all denominations), Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi) in Kerala. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Minority Welfare.
> **Note:** The last date to apply for fresh applications is February 3, 2025.
APJ Abdul Kalam Scholarship.benefits:
1. Financial support of ₹6,000/- per annum for selected scholars. 1. The scholarship is intended for students pursuing three-year diploma courses in government, aided, or government-approved self-financing polytechnic institutions.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** > The scholarship is a one-time benefit.
APJ Abdul Kalam Scholarship.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Kerala. 1. The applicant must be a regular/scheduled student. 1. The applicant should belong to a religious minority community (Muslim, Christian (all denominations), Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi). 1. The applicant must be studying a three-year diploma course in a government, aided, or government-approved self-financing polytechnic institution. 1. The applicant must have secured admission in a merit seat in a government-approved self-financing polytechnic institution. 1. The applicant's family annual income should not exceed ₹8,00,000/- if from the APL (Above Poverty Line) category. 1. The applicant can be a second-year or third-year student. 1. The applicant must have an account in their own name in any nationalised bank or scheduled bank.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** - BPL (Below Poverty Line) category applicants will be given preference. - 30% of the scholarships are reserved for girls. If the specified percentage of girls is not met, eligible boys will also be considered for the scholarship. - The selection of minority students is based on family annual income and marks, proportionate to the population.
APJ Abdul Kalam Scholarship.exclusions: - The scholarship is provided only once to an eligible student. Students who received the scholarship in the previous year should not apply again.

Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.details: The “Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Minority Castes” was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. Food Bill Assistant for Medical & Engine.details: The "Food Bill Assistant for Medical & Engineering Students of SEBC" scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial relief for food expenses to SEBC category students pursuing higher education in the medical and engineering fields. Under this scheme, financial assistance per month for a maximum of 10 months is provided to eligible students.
Food Bill Assistant for Medical & Engine.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** - ₹300/- per month (₹3,000/- annually) towards mess charges for most eligible SEBC students. - ₹700/- per month (₹7,000/- annually) towards mess charges for selected students (limited number of beneficiaries). - ₹1,500/- per month (₹15,000/- annually) for SEBC students studying in self-financed medical/engineering colleges and residing in hostels (with a fixed ceiling on the number of beneficiaries). - **Duration:** Maximum of 10 months in an academic year.
Food Bill Assistant for Medical & Engine.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC). 1. The applicant should be pursuing a Medical or Engineering degree in a recognized institution. 1. The applicant must have passed HSC (Class 12th).1. The applicant's annual family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-. 1. The applicant who is already availing similar mess assistance under any other government scheme is not eligible.

A Scheme to Provide Free Tablets to Std..details: The “A Scheme to Provide Free Tablets to Std.12th Pass Students” scheme was implemented by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. Under this scheme, provide free tablets to ST students who have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination and are admitted to the first year of a graduate-level course in a recognized university are reimbursed for the token amount of ₹1,000 deposited for receiving tablets from the Education Department.
A Scheme to Provide Free Tablets to Std..benefits: - Under the scheme, students in the 12th standard belonging to the Scheduled Caste category will receive a tablet by paying a token fee of ₹1,000/-.
A Scheme to Provide Free Tablets to Std..eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. 1. The applicant should have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC/Std. 12) examination. 1. The applicant should be admitted to the first year of a graduate-level course in a recognized university.

Fellowship Scholarship Scheme.details: The "Fellowship Scholarship Scheme" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students who secure 70% or more marks in Class 10th and are pursuing higher secondary or higher education. The primary objective is to encourage education among the Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST), Physically Backward Classes, and other eligible categories by providing monetary support based on their merit in Class 11th and subsequent studies.
Fellowship Scholarship Scheme.benefits: - **Annual Scholarship:** Financial assistance is provided every year to eligible students.
Fellowship Scholarship Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must have secured at least 70% marks in Class 10th. - The applicant must be pursuing higher secondary school (Class 11th onwards), college, or higher education. - The applicant’s personal/ family annual income must not exceed ₹2,50,000/-.

Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.details: The scheme "Tiatr Research Scholarship Program" was launched by the Tiatr Academy (TAG) under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage young students to undertake research in different aspects of Tiatr, its song, and music. The scheme provides scholarships to college and university students for research related to Tiatr, which must be conducted in English and Konkani (Roman script only). It also includes the publication of the approved research work in book form by TAG, with 100 copies provided to the student concerned in addition to the scholarship amount. The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out duly signed by either the guide or the head of the institution.
Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.benefits: > ***Scholarship Amount*** The amount of each scholarship will be decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) from time to time. > ***Publication of Research Work*** The research work of the students will be printed by Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) in book form after approval by the Recommendation Board. > ***Copies of Published Work*** Each student concerned will receive 100 copies of their printed research work in addition to the scholarship amount. > ***Number of Scholarships*** TAG will offer scholarships in three categories every year: ◦ PhD: 1 scholarship ◦ Post-Graduation: 3 scholarships ◦ Graduation: 6 scholarships _*Scholarships will be for every academic year._ _*A scholarship will be given only once in a particular category; however, the same applicant is free to apply for other categories in subsequent academic years._
Tiatr Research Scholarship Program.eligibility: - The applicant must be a bonafide student who does research work or a project related to Tiatr. - The applicant must conduct research work in English and Konkani (Roman script only). - The applicant should have secured at least 50% marks in the last examination. - The applicant must submit a report of the research carried out, duly signed either by the guide or the head of the institution.

Post Graduate Scholarship for Ph.D./LLM.details: The scheme "Post Graduate Scholarship for Ph.D./LLM Students" by the Higher Education Department, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial assistance to students of Assam pursuing Doctor of Philosophy and Master of Laws degree courses in any recognized colleges or universities in the state and other states of the country, focusing on those with uniformly good academic records. The scheme provides access to poor students of the state and helps them achieve the benefits of higher education through scholarship support for advanced academic pursuits. The applicant must have registered their names as Doctor of Philosophy/Post Doctorate Research Scholar in any recognized universities and must be domiciled in Assam. The scheme is implemented by Higher Education Department. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
Post Graduate Scholarship for Ph.D./LLM.benefits: **Financial Assistance:** Scholarship is provided to the poor students to help them achieve the benefits of Higher Education. **Mode of Disbursement:** Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) _*The applicant must maintain registration as Doctor of Philosophy/Post Doctorate Research Scholar in recognized universities._ _*Academic performance standards must be maintained as per university requirements._
Post Graduate Scholarship for Ph.D./LLM.eligibility: - The applicant must have registered their names as Doctor of Philosophy/Post Doctorate Research Scholar in any recognized universities. - The applicant must be domiciled in Assam. - The applicant must have obtained at least 55% or above marks in the last qualifying examination. - The applicant must have uniformly good academic records.

Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.details: The scheme “Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan Scholarship Scheme (Secondary Level)” is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote academic excellence among students entering Classes 9 and 10 by providing financial assistance to meritorious students, based on their performance in a competitive examination conducted by the State Council of Educational Research and Training (SCERT), Uttarakhand.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.benefits: Rate of Scholarship: - **For Class 9th Students:** ₹900/- per month for 1 year.- **For Class 10th Students:** ₹900/- per month for 1 year.
Mukhyamantri Medhavi Chhatra Protsahan S.eligibility: 1. The student must have passed Class 8 (institutional) from a Government School or Government-aided private school of the state (excluding Central and Residential schools) and must be studying in Class 9. 1. The applicant must qualify in the competitive examination conducted by SCERT, Uttarakhand. 1. The selected student must maintain a minimum of 75% attendance and secure at least 60% marks in Class 9. For SC/ST students, a relaxation of 5% is provided in both marks and attendance requirements. 1. Based on the examination results, a student securing a position in the top 10% of the total participants will be eligible to avail the benefits of this scheme. 1. There is no income criterion for the parents/guardians of the student under this scholarship. 1. A student cannot avail double benefits under multiple state scholarship schemes.

application process.process: To appear in the scholarship examination, a student can collect the application form from the Block Education Officer’s office or download it from the School Education Department’s website ( https://schooleducation.uk.gov.in ) or the SCERT Uttarakhand website ( https://scert.uk.gov.in/ ) during the months of June-July every year. At present, the application process is offline, and no application or examination fee is required. While filling the application form, the student must attach a passport-size photograph, Aadhaar card, Class 8 passing certificate, admission card for Class 9, caste certificate (if applicable), disability certificate (if applicable), and Aadhaar-linked bank account details. The student must ensure that all information provided in the form is correct and then submit it to the Principal of the school where he or she is studying. The Principal verifies the form on the basis of documents and school records, attests the photograph, and forwards the form to the Block Education Officer’s office by the stipulated date, which is usually around 21st August. After verification, the Block Education Officer issues the admit card. Students can collect the admit card from their school or from the Block Education Officer’s office. The examination is conducted every year in September in an objective-type multiple-choice format. Students who are placed in the merit list are informed by the Principal, after which the scholarship amount is directly credited to the student’s bank account.

Mamasaheb Phadke Management of Govt Adar.details: The “Mamasaheb Phadke Management of Government Adarsh Residential Schools (SC)” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to expand access to quality residential education for scheduled caste (SC) students in standards 9th to 12th. Under this scheme, eligible SC students receive free boarding, lodging, textbooks, uniforms, meals, and additional support services to enhance academic participation.
Mamasaheb Phadke Management of Govt Adar.benefits: **Free Services Provided:** - Board and lodging, meals, textbooks, uniforms, and water - Study materials, mid‑day meals, and other academic support - Ration card, PH identity card, and other entitlements, as applicable
Mamasaheb Phadke Management of Govt Adar.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be currently studying in standard 9th to 12th in a recognized institution.1. The applicant must have passed the previous annual exam with at least 50% marks (or a government-sanctioned exemption). > **NOTE:** Returning students must have passed with at least a second class with  50% to be considered for re-admission.

Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.details: The scheme "Scheme For Residential Education For Students in High Schools in Targeted Areas (SHRESHTA)" was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India from 2023-24 to 2025-26. The scheme aims to provide access to high quality education to students from Scheduled Caste communities in the best private residential schools in the country, thereby securing their future opportunities and filling the gap in service deficient Scheduled Caste dominant areas in the education sector. Under the "SHRESHTA Schools (Best CBSE Private Residential Schools)" mode, the scheme provides scholarships covering school fees including tuition fees and hostel fees including mess charges, along with bridge courses to help students adapt to the new environment. The applicant must be a Scheduled Caste student with parental income not exceeding ₹2,50,000/- per year and must qualify through the National Entrance Test for SHRESHTA conducted by National Testing Agency.
Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.benefits: ##### ***Scholarship Coverage*** School fee including tuition fee and hostel fee including mess charges as per following limits: - Class 9th: ₹1,00,000/- per student per annum. - Class 10th: ₹1,10,000/- per student per annum. - Class 11th: ₹1,25,000/- per student per annum. - Class 12th: ₹1,35,000/- per student per annum. ##### ***Bridge Course Support*** - Up to 10% of annual fee provided separately for bridge course extending up to 3 months. ##### ***Mode of Disbursement*** - Direct transfer to school accounts through e-Anudaan portal. - Within 30 days from date of confirmation of admission on Information Technology portal. ##### ***Additional Benefits*** - _Automatic Progression__:_ Students admitted in Class 9 or 11 shall automatically be funded for next classes till they complete 12th class.- _Bridge Course_: Conducted outside school hours covering academic topics and personality development.- _Counsellor Support_: Schools designate one teacher as counsellor to resolve difficulties faced by students.- _Future Connectivity_: Students may be connected to Post Matric Scholarship Scheme or Top-Class Education Scheme for further studies. _*The applicant must pass the exams of the previous class to continue receiving funding for subsequent years._ _*The applicant must maintain enrollment in the assigned SHRESHTA school._ _*If student leaves after admission and payment of fee, it must be brought to notice of Central Government immediately and fees paid should be refunded to Consolidated Fund of India._
Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.eligibility: - The applicant must belong to Scheduled Caste community. - The applicant must be studying in recognized schools - Private or Government or Local Body schools. - The income of the parents of the applicant must not exceed ₹2,50,000/- per year. - The applicant seeking admission in Class 9th must have passed Class 8th in the academic year immediately preceding the year of admission. - The applicant seeking admission in Class 11th must have passed Class 10th in the academic year immediately preceding the year of admission. - The applicant must qualify in National Entrance Test for SHRESHTA conducted by National Testing Agency.
Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.exclusions: The applicant should not be covered under Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme of the Department.

application process.process: Step 1:  Access the official  National Testing Agency portal  and register for National Entrance Test for SHRESHTA. Complete the registration process by providing personal details, educational qualifications, and uploading required documents including caste certificate and income certificate. Step 2:  Take the National Entrance Test for SHRESHTA conducted by National Testing Agency across the country. The test will assess merit for admission to SHRESHTA schools and results will determine eligibility for school selection process. Step 3:  After the examination, check the results on National Testing Agency portal to verify qualification status and merit position. Qualified candidates will be eligible to participate in the web counselling process for school selection. Step 4:  Access the web counselling system developed by National Informatics Centre to exercise choice of SHRESHTA schools. Select preferred schools from the available options based on merit rank and availability of seats in chosen institutions. Step 5:  Once a school is allotted through the counselling process, confirm the selection within the stipulated time frame. The selected school will automatically admit the student without any further test or evaluation process. Step 6:  Report to the assigned SHRESHTA school and complete all admission formalities as directed by the school authorities. The school will provide necessary assistance for students to settle down in the new environment and hostel facilities. Step 7:  Participate in the bridge course conducted by the school outside school hours if required. The bridge course will cover topics to help catch up with the rest of the class and enhance capability to adapt to the school environment. Selection Process The applicant will be selected based on merit obtained in National Entrance Test for SHRESHTA. The applicant will be offered choices of SHRESHTA schools through web counselling system. The applicant may participate in multiple rounds of web-counselling to ensure all seats are filled.

Scheme of Developing High Quality Resear.details: The "Scheme of Developing High Quality Research (SHODH)" was launched by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to encourage Ph.D. research scholars to pursue high-quality, regular, and full-time research in the state. > **Objectives of the Scheme:** - To provide financial assistance to maximum students in the state of Gujarat to encourage them to pursue high-quality research. - To encourage students studying in all branches of knowledge to pursue high-quality regular and full-time research. - To increase the capacity and scope of quality research in higher education institutions. - To create a global identity through industry and socially useful research. - To promote research to meet the current needs and to meet the modern requirements. - To also promote research that preserves India's rich cultural heritage and embraces new dimensions.
Scheme of Developing High Quality Resear.benefits: > **Stipend:** - ₹15,000/- per month as stipend for 2 years. - ₹20,000/- per annum as contingency expense. - Total Assistance: ₹4,00,000/- per scholar at the end of 2 years.
Scheme of Developing High Quality Resear.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant should be a registered Ph.D. scholar in a recognized university of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be pursuing full-time, regular research.

application process.process: Registration Process: Visit the  official website  to apply for the scheme. Read the SHODH Guidelines and Government Resolution before applying. Click Login → select Registration (for new users). Choose the application year, fill all required fields, and click Register. Registration details cannot be changed later, so enter carefully. Password will be sent to your registered mobile number. Confirm it to complete registration. Change your password immediately after registration using the “Change Password” option. Login Process: Go to the homepage and select Login. Select Application Year. Enter registered email ID, new password, and captcha. Click Login to proceed. Filling User & Academic Details: Open User Details → fill all personal details including ration card information. Enter ration card number and your member ID only (not family member IDs). Provide Bank Details and ensure Aadhaar is linked to your account via NPCI. Open Academic Details → fill Ph.D. stream, sub-stream, thesis title (in English fonts), research lab, and guide details. Uploading Documents: Upload all required documents clearly (Aadhaar, Bonafide Certificate, SSC Certificate/Marksheet, Research Proposal, PPT, Self-declaration form, etc.). Proposal and PPT must include signatures of Guide and HOD (stamp on first page). Self-declaration must be signed by Guide, HOD, and Nodal Officer before uploading. Application Lock & Submission: After filling details, click Application Lock → check “Print Preview”. Correct errors (if any) before final lock. Once locked, no changes are allowed. Print the application form. Submit your form along with original documents to your University SHODH Nodal Officer for verification. Application Status: Track your application using the Student Status tab on the portal. If the status shows “Pending”, contact your University Nodal Officer. Nodal Officers can unlock your form for corrections only if status is pending. User Manual : English

Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.details: The umbrella scheme "Scheme for Residential Education for Students in High Schools in Targeted Areas (SHRESHTA)" was launched by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India. The scheme has a sub-scheme/component called "SHRESHTA Mode 2: Non-Governmental Organization Operated Schools". The sub-scheme aims to provide quality education and opportunities to students from Scheduled Caste communities through grant-in-aid institutions run by Non-Governmental Organizations and residential high schools, addressing the gap in service deficient Scheduled Caste dominant areas in the education sector. The scheme provides financial assistance to Non-Governmental Organization operated schools and hostels for school fees and residential charges for Scheduled Caste students, along with infrastructure support and monitoring mechanisms to ensure quality education delivery.
Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** _(Electronic transfer through e-Anudaan portal and Public Financial Management System)_ **Primary Level Students** - Residential: ₹44,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. - Non-residential: ₹27,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. - Hostel only: ₹30,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. **Secondary Level Students** - Residential: ₹55,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. - Non-residential: ₹35,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. - Hostel only: ₹30,000/- per Scheduled Caste student per year. **Non-Recurring Grants (Every 5 Years)** - Secondary Residential School (100 students): ₹3,85,000/- for fixed items plus ₹900/- per student. - Secondary Non-residential School (100 students): ₹3,07,500/- fixed. - Secondary Hostel (100 students): ₹2,30,000/- for fixed items plus ₹900/- per student. - Primary Residential School (100 students): ₹2,72,500/- for fixed items plus ₹900/- per student. - Primary Non-residential School (100 students): ₹1,95,000/- fixed. - Hostel for destitute Children (100 students): ₹2,30,000/- for fixed items plus ₹900/- per student. ##### ***Attendance-Based Grant Disbursement*** - 75% or more attendance: Full grant. - 50% to less than 75% attendance: 75% of grant. - 25% to less than 50% attendance: 50% of grant. - Less than 25% attendance: No grant (without valid grounds).
Scheme For Residential Education For Stu.eligibility: ##### ***Eligibility for the Organization*** - The applicant must be a reputed school chain, Corporate Social Responsibility foundation, or reputed organization running good quality schools. - The applicant must be registered and working in quality school education. - The applicant must have schools recognized by the State Government and affiliated to State or Central Boards. - The applicant must have a properly constituted Managing Committee with powers, duties and responsibilities clearly defined in written Constitution. - The applicant must have appropriate administrative structure and duly constituted Managing or Executive Committee. - The applicant must be initiated and governed by its own members on democratic principles. - The applicant must be a non-profit entity. - The applicant should have its own website for pro-active disclosure of information. - The applicant must be registered on the Non-Governmental Organization Darpan portal of National Institution for Transforming India Aayog. - The applicant must have been receiving Grant-in-aid and showing satisfactory performance. - The applicant must maintain higher classes up to at least Class 12th. - The applicant organization running primary schools (Classes 1st to 8th) must upgrade to Secondary or Senior Secondary Schools (up to at least Class 10th) before 2027. ##### ***Eligibility for the Student*** - The beneficiary must belong to Scheduled Caste community. - The beneficiary must be admitted in schools run by eligible Non-Governmental Organizations under this scheme. ##### ***Infrastructure-related Eligibility Requirements*** - The applicant must have one classroom for each class or section. - The applicant must have sufficient benches and desks or chairs and tables for all students. - The applicant must provide one decent cot and bed for every child in residential facilities. - The applicant must have light and fans for every classroom and residing room. - The applicant must have female service staff, wardens and chowkidars for girls' residential schools with adequate security provisions. - The applicant must have one toilet and bathroom for every 10 children maintained in clean and hygienic condition. - The applicant must have hygienic kitchen and dining room. - The applicant should provide nutritious and sufficient food to students thrice a day with maintained records. - The applicant must provide clean and safe drinking water facility to students. - The applicant should arrange regular doctor visits with maintained records and keep first-aid boxes and emergency medicines. - The applicant should provide 4 sets of uniforms including shoes per year to students with maintained distribution records. - The applicant should have games and sports facility, physical education, yoga, and playground available for students. - The applicant must install Closed Circuit Television cameras with linkage to website for live streaming. - The applicant must have Aadhaar based attendance system integrated into central portal. ##### ***School Performance Standards*** - The applicant school must have Class 10th and Class 12th pass percentage not less than average Board result of the State or Central Board. - The applicant must have qualified and well-trained teachers as per standards of State or Central Board. - The applicant must have teachers in High Schools who are at least graduates in their respective fields with Bachelor of Education qualification. - The applicant must maintain minimum 6 teachers in a school and minimum 2 teachers in a hostel. - The applicant should pay honorariums to teachers and staff in time as per minimum rates prevailing in the district.

application process.process: Step 1:   Registration and Application Submission Organizations must register on the NGO Darpan portal and get a project ID from the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment. Submit your application on the e-Anudaan portal between April 1st and June 30th. Include all required details for your organization, project, and students (both new and renewals). Step 2:   Document Preparation and Submission Gather and submit key documents like project details, budget, and previous year's performance reports. Upload all necessary forms to the e-Anudaan portal. While state government recommendations are ideal, applications may still be considered after a project inspection. Step 3:   Physical Inspection and Verification A team from the Ministry's Programme Management Unit will inspect your organization. The inspection, preferably during the first academic quarter, will assess your infrastructure and performance. Continued grant support depends on demonstrating satisfactory performance and adherence to all scheme guidelines. Step 4:   Agreement and Bank Account Setup You must sign an Agreement Bond to receive assistance. Set up a joint-operation bank account for electronic fund transfers. All bank account details must be verified through the Public Financial Management System before funds can be released. Step 5:   Grant Release and Ongoing Compliance Grants are released in three installments after the application is complete and the inspection report is submitted. Maintain separate accounts for scheme grants and submit utilization certificates to continue receiving funding. Your organization is required to maintain proper records and provide real-time updates on your website and the e-Anudaan portal. Application Deadlines:  Portal opens on 1st April for renewal students and closes on 30th June for fresh student entries annually. Application Status Tracking:  Status can be tracked through e-Anudaan portal at www.grants-msje.gov.in with real-time data management information system integration. Grievance Redressal / Help & Support:  Applications and queries to be addressed through e-Anudaan portal www.grants-msje.gov.in under Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment supervision.

Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Scholarships/.details: The scheme "Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi" was launched by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. The "Scholarships/Incentives" component of the scheme aims to provide financial support to the wards of recognized Goan artists who are pursuing higher education, thereby addressing the economic challenges faced by artist families in supporting their children's educational aspirations and ensuring continuity of educational opportunities despite financial constraints. The applications for this scheme are accepted Offline.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Scholarships/.benefits: - A monthly scholarship of ₹750/- is sanctioned to eligible wards during the currency of the academic year. - The vacation period is excluded from the scholarship disbursement period. - The scholarship is disbursed on a half-yearly basis.
Kalakar Kritadnyata Nidhi: Scholarships/.eligibility: ##### ***For the Artist*** - The artist must be a Goan, i.e., born and brought up in Goa. - The artist must be recognized by the Directorate of Art & Culture, Government of Goa. - The income of the family of the artist (from all sources) must not exceed ₹2,00,000/- per annum. - The artist must not be less than 50 years in age. (The Government may relax the age criteria for deserving cases under special circumstances.) ##### ***For the Ward of the Artist*** - The ward must be enrolled in a recognized educational institution. - The ward must be pursuing Postgraduate, Degree, or Professional courses. - The ward may be enrolled in educational institutions within the state or outside the state.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the office of the Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa, and collect the prescribed application form for the scheme. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the completed application form along with all required documents directly to the  Directorate of Art & Culture, Sanskruti Bhavan, Patto, Panaji, Goa. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  The Directorate shall forward the application to the sub-committee for scrutinizing the application thoroughly. The Director shall give its recommendations to the sub-committee. Step 2:  The sub-committee shall consider the received applications and recommend the names considered fit by the sub-committee to avail the benefits under this scheme. The committee shall decide the quantum of assistance to be released. Step 3:  After the committee decides on the quantum of assistance, the approval from the Government shall be obtained for disbursement of the financial assistance. Step 4:  After obtaining Government approval, the Director shall disburse the one-time financial assistance amount in the form of Electronic Clearing System mode to the bank account.

Laptop-e Scheme.details: The scheme "Laptop-e Scheme" was launched by the Directorate of Education, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to equip students with individual portable computer systems (Laptops). The scheme aims to enhance learning and knowledge acquisition through Information Technology tools such as the Internet, CD-ROMs, and DVDs, and fully exploit the teaching infrastructure in schools. The applications for this scheme are accepted through the Head of the Institution where the student is studying.
Laptop-e Scheme.benefits: Provision of one (1) entry-level portable computer system (Notebook or Laptop). ##### ***Details of Equipment*** - The system must be equipped with at least mid-level Processors. - The system must include a DVD-ROM Drive. - The system must include Wi-Fi connectivity. - The system must include multimedia speakers. - The system must have a 15-inch or more screen size. - The system must have a requisite Preloaded Open Standards Supported Operating System. - The operating system must be backed by premium or comprehensive technical support for at least three (3) years from reputed software companies such as Windows Operating System. ##### ***Disbursement*** - Benefits are derived immediately after the approval of the Government, depending on the availability of funds and after following all codal formalities. - The portable computer systems are supplied immediately to the students in various higher secondaries once tenders are decided and supply orders are issued to the various suppliers. ##### ***Conditions*** - _The applicant must deposit a refundable Registration Fee as decided by the Government._ - _The fee, once deposited, is not refunded in any case by the Government._ - _The student, parent, or guardian shall give a valid receipt of the portable computer system received to the Education Department._ - _This receipt must be submitted after obtaining the portable computer system through the respective Head of the Institute._
Laptop-e Scheme.eligibility: - The applicant must be a student of 11th standard. - The applicant must be studying in a recognized Higher Secondary School in Goa.

application process.process: Step 1:  The student must obtain the prescribed format of the application form of the scheme from the institution where he/she is currently studying. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, to the concerned staff at the institution. The application form should be duly approved and recommended for the supply of the portable system by the Head of the Institution. Post-Application Processes Step 1:  Processing and Government Approval The Government processes the application, decides the tenders, and issues supply orders to the various suppliers after following all formalities. Step 2:  Receive Portable Computer System The students derive the benefit of the scheme immediately after the approval of the Government, although disbursement is dependent on the availability of funds. The suppliers are directed to supply the Laptops or Notebooks immediately to the students in various higher secondaries across the state. Step 3:  Provide Valid Receipt of Computer System Received After receiving the portable computer system, the student, parent, or guardian must submit a valid receipt of the system received to the Education Department through the respective Head of the Institute.

Computer Training Scheme for Visually Im.details: The "Computer Training Scheme for Visually Impaired Persons" scheme was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Government of Madhya Pradesh. The scheme aims to provide computer-based intensive training, screen-reading software support, and a post-training laptop to visually impaired beneficiaries to enhance their education and livelihood opportunities. > **Objectives** The scheme provides intensive computer training with screen-reading software to visually impaired persons, improving their digital skills for education and employment. It helps them access information online and supports their goals in higher studies, competitive exams, and self-employment. > **Training** The program is conducted in two shifts for two months and includes computer hardware, software, trainers, internet connectivity, and study support.
Computer Training Scheme for Visually Im.benefits: **Computer Training with Screen-Reading Software** - Two-month intensive computer training is provided using screen-reading software. - Training is conducted in two batches daily, each of four hours. - Training is delivered in seven divisions: Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, Gwalior, Sagar, Rewa, and Ujjain. **Post-Training Laptop Support** - Each beneficiary receives a laptop after successful completion of the two-month training program. - The training and laptop distribution benefits are one-time and non-recurring. **Training Infrastructure Support** - Includes computer systems: Intel i3 or equivalent processor, 4 GB RAM, 250 GB or higher HDD, battery backup, and low-weight design. - Includes NBTR screen-reading software. - Includes instructor support and helper assistance. - Internet connectivity is provided during training. - Free access to an online library (provided at no cost by an external source).
Computer Training Scheme for Visually Im.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Madhya Pradesh. 1. The applicant must have 40% or more visual impairment. 1. The applicant must belong to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) household. 1. The applicant must have passed class 8th with at least 50% marks.1. The applicant is eligible to receive training only once under this scheme.
