Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for the Ch.details: The &quot;Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for the Children of Parents/Guardians Engaged in Unclean and Hazardous Occupations&quot; is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to support, through financial assistance, parents of children belonging to Other Disadvantaged Categories for education of their wards studying at the Pre-Matric stage so that their participation improves, the incidence of drop-out especially in the transition from the primary to the next level and elementary to the secondary stage is minimized, they perform better and have a better chance of progressing to the Post-matric stage of education.
Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for the Ch.benefits:
***Assistance:***
With effect from 2022-23, the students shall be given a consolidated academic allowance, as follows:

- Day Scholar: ₹3,500/- per annum
- Hosteller: ₹8,000/- per annum (For Class III-X)

**Note:** In addition, a 10% extra allowance shall be given to Divyang (Disabled) students. The disability as defined under the relevant Section of Right of the persons with Disability Act, 2016. The appropriate Government shall designate persons, having requisite qualifications and experience, as certifying authorities, who shall be competent to issue the certificate of disability.
Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for the Ch.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a student.
2.	The applicant should be a resident of Goa.
3.	The applicant’s parents/guardians should be engaged in an unclean or hazardous occupation.
4.	The student should be studying in Class I to X on a full-time basis.
5.	Scholarship will be admissible to the children/wards of parents/guardians who, irrespective of their caste/religion belong to one of the following categories:

  - Persons who are Manual Scavengers as defined under section 2(I) (g) of Manual Scavengers Act 2013
  - Tanners &amp; Flayers;
  - Waste pickers and
  - Persons engaged in hazardous cleaning as defined in Section 2(1) (d) of [Manual Scavengers Act 2013](https://www.indiacode.nic.in/bitstream/123456789/8868/1/a2013-25msact.pdf). For the purpose of classification in this category, the eligible candidates will be required to submit a certificate from District Social Welfare officer/ identified officer of Local body/ Civic Agency/any such authority as designated by the State Government.
6.	There is no family income ceiling under this component of the Scheme.
7.	A scholarship holder under this scheme will not hold any other educational scholarship for the purpose of studying in class I to X. If awarded any other educational scholarship for studying in classes I to X, the students can avail of either of the two scholarships as per his/her choice and should inform the awarding authority to the Head of the Institution about the option made.

Grant on Passing the Written Examination.details: The scheme &quot;Grant on Passing the Written Examination of Competitive Examinations for Recruitment in Armed Forces&quot; was introduced by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, a grant of ₹15,000/- is provided from the Amalgamated Fund to the children of ex-servicemen who pass the written examination of CDS, NDA, IMA, OTA, Air Force, or Naval Academy, for the purpose of coaching. This scheme is applicable to applications received on or after 1st July, 2020.
Grant on Passing the Written Examination.benefits: - A one-time grant of ₹15,000/- is provided to children of ex-serviceman who pass the written examination of CDS, NDA, IMA, OTA, Air Force, or Naval Academy, for the purpose of coaching.
Grant on Passing the Written Examination.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be the child of an ex-serviceman.
1. The applicant should have passed the written examination of NDA, CDS, IMA, OTA, Air Force, or Naval Academy.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Welfare Office. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Sainik Welfare Office to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Scholarship/Merit Scholarship Schools SC.details: Launched by the Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi, the scheme "Merit Scholarship to SC/ST/OBC/Minority students studying in recognised Colleges/Professional/Technical Institutions" aims to provide financial assistance to students from marginalized communities pursuing higher education in recognized institutions. The scheme offers monthly scholarships to hostellers and day scholars based on their course of study, with amounts ranging from ₹420/- to ₹1,860/- per month. Eligible students must have secured at least 60% marks in the previous academic year. Family income limits apply only to OBC and Minority students. The scheme is implemented by the Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC, Government of NCT of Delhi.
Scholarship/Merit Scholarship Schools SC.benefits:
> **Course of Study Group-A**


- Degree courses in medical/engineering/B.Sc. (Agri)/Veterinary Science/Forensic Science/Higher Technical and professional studies, and degree-level courses in Indian medicine (B.A.M.S. and comparable courses in Ayurvedic, Unani/Tibbia, and Homeopathy systems of Medicine): Hostellers: ₹1,620/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹900/- per month for 12 months.
- For Postgraduate courses in the above fields and other technical/professional courses: Hostellers: ₹1,860/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹960/- per month for 12 months.

> **Course of Study Group-B**


- Diploma-level courses in Indian medicine, engineering, technology, architecture, and other vocational courses, as well as postgraduate courses in science subjects: Hostellers: ₹1,110/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹720/- per month for 12 months.

> **Course of Study Group-C**


- Certificate courses in engineering, technology, architecture, medicine, and other vocational courses (minimum duration of one year): Hostellers: ₹930/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹630/- per month for 12 months.

> **Course of Study Group-D**


- General courses up to graduate level: Hostellers: ₹804/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹420/- per month for 12 months.

Postgraduate studies in Arts, Commerce, and other subjects: Hostellers: ₹930/- per month for 12 months; Day Scholars: ₹630/- per month for 12 months.
> **Conditions for Disbursement**


- The scholarship amount will be reduced to 50% if a student fails the annual examination but continues studies, except in cases of medical grounds or natural calamities.
Scholarship/Merit Scholarship Schools SC.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a resident of Delhi.
- The applicant should belong to the SC/ST/OBC/Minority category.
- The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized school, college, or institution in India.
- The applicant should be a student.
- The applicant should have secured a 60% or above marks in the previous examination.
- If the applicant is from OBC/Minority Community, his/her annual family income should not exceed ₹2,00,000/-.

Chief Minister BC & EBC Chhatravas Anuda.details: The &quot;Chief Minister BC &amp; EBC Chhatravas Anudan Yojana&quot;, implemented by the Backward Classes and Extremely Backward Classes Welfare Department, aims to support students belonging to Backward Classes (BC) and Extremely Backward Classes (EBC) residing in government hostels by providing them a financial grant to cover their essential needs.
Chief Minister BC & EBC Chhatravas Anuda.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:**  ₹1,000/- per month for students residing in government hostels.
Chief Minister BC & EBC Chhatravas Anuda.eligibility:
1. The applicant must belong to the BC or EBC category.
1. The annual family income should be less than ₹3,00,000/-.
1. The student must be residing in a government hostel.

application process.process: Step 1: The applicant must first register on the  e-Kalyan portal . Step 2: To complete the registration, the applicant must fill in the following details: Personal details & Contact details Step 3: After registration, the applicant must log in using the provided User ID and Password. Step 4: Once logged in, the applicant must carefully fill out the application form. Step 5: All required documents must be uploaded to the portal. Step 6: The application form, along with the uploaded documents, will be verified by the concerned authorities.

Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.details:
The &quot;Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana – Higher Education/Technical Education&quot; was launched by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan, with the objective of providing technical or higher education to beneficiary boys and girls under the State Government’s Palanhar Scheme, to help them become self-reliant. The scheme aims to make every possible effort to ensure employment opportunities and a dignified livelihood for these beneficiaries upon completion of their higher or technical education.
Under this scheme, the State Government provides financial assistance to eligible boys and girls enrolled under the Palanhar Scheme to pursue higher or technical education, based on their qualifications and interest in employment-oriented courses.
The scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Rajasthan, at the state level and by the Deputy Director/Assistant Director, Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, at the district level.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.benefits:
> **Higher Education /Technical Education Benefits:**


- Financial assistance for career-oriented higher or technical education (graduation/post-graduation courses). 

> **Mode of Disbursement:**


- Reimbursement of the actual course fee through bank account transfer.
Mukhyamantri Hunar Vikas Yojana- Higher.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a beneficiary under the Palanhar Scheme of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should have completed 15 years of age.
   1. The applicant’s maximum age should not exceed 21 years or till course completion (whichever is earlier).
   1. The applicant should be pursuing education from a university/college/technical educational institution recognized by the Government of India/State Government.
   1. Financial assistance is applicable for regular higher or technical education at the graduate or postgraduate level.
   1. The applicant should not be receiving any scholarships or grants for higher/technical education from the Central or State Government.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant downloads the  application form  from the official website. Step 4:  After verification, course fees will be reimbursed to the student’s bank account. Note:  Apply for fee reimbursement within 3 months of admission.

Incentive Scheme for Meritorious Student.details: The &quot;Incentive Scheme for Meritorious Students of Economically Backward Class of General Category&quot; was launched by the Education Department, Government of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, a one-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- along with a certificate of appreciation is awarded to the top 100 meritorious students of Class 10 and each stream (Science, Commerce, Arts) of Class 12, who are listed in the state-level merit list of the Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE), Ajmer. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Secondary Education, Rajasthan, Bikaner.
Incentive Scheme for Meritorious Student.benefits:
> **Financial Assistance:**


  - One-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to economically backward students from the general category studying in government and private schools.

> **Certificate of Appreciation:**


  - An official certificate is awarded along with the monetary benefit.
Incentive Scheme for Meritorious Student.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should be a student.
   1. The applicant should belong to the economically backward class from the general category.
   1. The applicant should be studying in a government or private school.
   1. The applicant should have passed Class 10th, Praveshika, Class 12th (Science/Commerce/Arts), or Varishta Upadhyay examination conducted by Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE), Ajmer.   1. The applicant should have secured a minimum of 75% marks in the qualifying examination.
   1. The applicant’s parents’ combined annual income from all sources should be less than ₹2,50,000.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  To avail of the benefits of the scheme, students should fill out the online application form through the institution head (principal) of their respective school. Step 2:  Eligible students are identified by the head of their institution. Step 3:  Submit copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required) to the respective school. Step 4:  The school will visit the  Shala Darpan, Rajasthan  Portal. Step 5:  Using the school's login credentials (Login ID and Password), the school will fill and submit the application form. Post-Application Process: Step 1:  The institution head forwards the online application to the concerned District Education Officer (DEO) Headquarters (Primary/Secondary Education). Step 2:  The District Education Officer compiles and forwards the verified applications of all eligible students from the district to the Directorate of Secondary Education, Rajasthan, Bikaner. Step 3:  Post-verification, the incentive amount is disbursed to the students' bank accounts.

Merit cum Means Scholarship: Polytechnic.details: "Merit cum Means Scholarship: Polytechnic Institutions" is a scholarship scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹600/- per month to eligible students for pursuing education from recognized Polytechnic Institutions in Chhattisgarh. To be eligible, the student must have passed the 10+2 examination or the 10th/12th examination from any recognised institution located in Chhattisgarh with a minimum of 45% marks. The total annual income of the student's father/guardian should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/-.
Merit cum Means Scholarship: Polytechnic.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native resident of Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be a Student. - The applicant must be currently studying in a recognised Polytechnic Institution in Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must have passed the 10+2 examination or the 10th/12th examination from any recognised institution located in Chhattisgarh with a minimum of 45% marks. - The total annual income of the student's father/guardian should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/-.
**OTHER CONDITIONS** - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student who is regularly studying in a recognised institution and is receiving any scholarship can be allowed to do part-time work. - In special cases not covered under the provisions of these rules, the government will provide special scholarships to eligible students at the rate prescribed for each course of study, based on poverty and merit. The total annual expenditure incurred in this regard will not exceed the budget limit.

Bicycle Distribution Scheme for Girl Stu.details: The &quot;Bicycle Distribution Scheme&quot; was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan, for girl students belonging to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, free bicycles will be distributed to 5,800 girl students from the EWS category, who are studying in government schools from Class 6 to Class 8, to facilitate their commute between home and school.
Bicycle Distribution Scheme for Girl Stu.benefits:
Under this scheme, free bicycles will be distributed to girl students from the EWS category.
***Number of beneficiaries:***

1. Total: 5,800 beneficiaries
1. Number of Beneficiaries Class-wise:


- Class 6th: 1,933- Class 7th: 1,933- Class 8th: 1,934
Bicycle Distribution Scheme for Girl Stu.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be a girl student.
1. The applicant should be studying in Class 6, 7, or 8 in a government school in Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should belong to the Economically Weaker Section (EWS) category.
1. The annual income of the applicant’s parents/guardian should be less than ₹1,00,000/-.
1. The applicant should have secured at least 60% marks in the previous examination.

**Note:** Preference will be given based on merit (marks obtained).

Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To A.details:
The &quot;Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To Afghan Students&quot; scheme under e-VidyaBharati Network Project, launched by the Ministry of External Affairs in October 2019, aims to provide 1000 scholarships annually to Afghan students for pursuing various UGC-approved online Undergraduate and Postgraduate programs from Indian universities. It promotes India as a global hub for higher education and enables Afghan nationals to receive quality education in fields such as Business Administration, Commerce, Computer Science, Arts, and more.
> **Tenure of scholarship:**

It should be the endeavor of each student to complete the UG, PG, programmes within prescribed time period of 3 years, 2 years, respectively. However, any relaxation will be strictly as per UGC guidelines.
Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To A.benefits:
The scholarship amount covers the entire degree programme fee including:

  - Tuition fees,
  - Admission fees,
  - Examination fees,
  - E-content charges,
  - Other charges like registration fee, re-examination, and award of degree, etc.

> **Note:** 


  - The passed students are awarded Degree online and physical copies of degrees/certificates are also sent to Indian Mission in Kabul, and students need to collect from Indian Mission in Kabul.
Awarding Teleeducation Scholarships To A.eligibility:
- The applicant must be a national of Afghanistan.
  - The applicant must possess a valid Afghan National ID or Passport.
  - The applicant must be between 18 to 35 years of age as on July 1 of the academic year.
  - The applicant must meet the minimum academic qualifications required by the respective Indian university for the chosen program.
  - The applicant must ensure proficiency in English to understand and complete the program, as the medium of instruction is English.
  - The applicant must apply only for one program under the e-VB project.
  - The applicant must not be enrolled in any other ongoing program under the e-VB project.

> **Note:**


  - Applicants must check the eligibility criteria/pre-requisites for admission to a particular programme/course on the respective university portal and then apply.
  - Students who have already obtained a degree under e-VB project (at the time of announcement of the new academic session) and willing to avail scholarship under e-VB project for pursuing another degree, may also apply afresh through iLearn portal to process their application

Tiatr Competition.details: The "Tiatr Competition" is organised annually by the Kala Academy under the Department of Art and Culture, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage and promote the unique Goan theatre form of Tiatr. Participation in this scheme is open to Goan institutions registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (with renewed registration). Entries are invited through press notes in local dailies. The institutions fulfilling the scheme’s requirements and submitting entries within the stipulated date are allowed to stage their Tiatr performances as per the sequence finalised by Kala Academy.

Research Fellowship Scheme for Scheduled.details:
The scheme &quot;Research Fellowship Scheme for Scheduled Tribe Candidates&quot; was launched by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to support the Scheduled Tribe candidates from Scheduled Areas and the Saheria Project Area to register themselves as research scholars with all recognized Central/State/Deemed/Private University located in any part of India for pursuing Ph.D. Programme. Under this scheme, monthly fellowships and contingency grants are provided to tribal research scholars enrolled in Ph.D. programmes at recognized universities across India. The scheme is implemented by the M.L. Verma Tribal Research &amp; Training Institute, Udaipur.
***Area's Cover:***
Banswara , Chittorgarh, Dungarpur , Pali, Sirohi, Udaipur, Baran, Rajsamand, Pratapgarh.
Research Fellowship Scheme for Scheduled.benefits:
***Financial Assistance:***

  - The selected scholar shall be paid @ ₹15,000/- per month.
  - A contingency grant of ₹40,000/- shall be given to the candidate for meeting the recurring expenditure viz. books/ Journals/Traveling/Stationery etc.

***Tenure:***
The tenure of the scholarship shall be for a period of maximum five years from the date of sanction from the Tribal Research Institute or completion of Ph.D. whichever is earlier.
***Extension of Fellowship Term &amp; Final Payments:***
The scholarship term shall not be extended under any circumstances. If, per chance, the candidate fails to complete his/her Ph.D work within the period of five years, the final installment of scholarship (equivalent to six month and last installment of contingency) shall be withheld until the Ph.D. is awarded to the candidate.
Research Fellowship Scheme for Scheduled.eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
   1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community.
   1. The applicant should be a resident of Scheduled Area of Rajasthan or a resident of Shahbad and Kishanganj tehsils of Baran district (Saheria Project Area).
   1. The applicant should have completed Post-graduation with at least 50% marks from a recognized university.
   1. The applicant should be registered in a recognized Central/State/Deemed/Private University in India for pursuing a Ph.D. programme.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should contact the M.L. Verma Tribal Research & Training Institute, Udaipur and request a copy of the prescribed format of the application form and collect filled-in applications. Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarshi.details: The scheme “Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to encourage and motivate students belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities who are studying in Sanskrit schools from Class 6 to Class 12 in Uttarakhand by providing financial scholarships to support their education.
Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarshi.benefits: **Scholarship Amount:** - Students from Class 6 to Class 12 will be provided ₹3,012/- per year, at the rate of ₹251/- per month.
Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarshi.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student studying in Class 6 to Class 12 at Sanskrit schools in Uttarakhand. 1. The student must belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community. 1. A total of 200 students studying in Class 6 to Class 12 at Sanskrit schools in the state will be eligible for the scholarship. 1. The student must possess a valid caste certificate issued by a competent authority.

application process.process: Institutional students belonging to Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe, studying in Sanskrit schools or colleges, who possess a caste certificate, Aadhaar card, and bank account, will submit their documents to the concerned Principal. The Principal will forward the documents along with their recommendation to the Assistant Director, Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand, who will then send it to the Director. After the Director’s approval, the scholarship will be disbursed online by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy.

Shodhgrantha Chayan Yojana.details: The scheme “Shodhgrantha Chayan Yojana” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to invite scholars from any state in India to submit research manuscripts on Sanskrit literature, as well as socially relevant research books related to Sanskrit literature in the context of Uttarakhand.
Shodhgrantha Chayan Yojana.benefits: For the research paper, the author receives an honorarium of ₹151/- per page, and 25 copies of the published book are provided free of cost.
Shodhgrantha Chayan Yojana.eligibility: 1. Authentic and socially relevant research books related to Sanskrit literature in the context of Uttarakhand are invited for publication. 1. Scholars from any state of the country (who write research papers within the scope of research methodology) will be eligible.

application process.process: In accordance with the thesis selection rules, advertisements are published in newspapers and on websites. Authors must submit three copies of their thesis along with the application form and an affidavit certifying the originality of the work. Eligible theses are published by the evaluation committee.

Financial Incentive to SC Meritorious Bo.details:
The 'Financial Incentive to SC Meritorious Boy Students' scheme, administered by the Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, provides financial assistance to deserving boy students from Scheduled Castes (SC). Eligibility is extended to those who have achieved 80% or higher marks in the HSSLC examination. The scheme's objective is to motivate and encourage SC boy students to pursue higher education, thereby fostering their academic parity with the broader population through a substantial incentive. Assistance is contingent upon the applicant satisfying the stipulated eligibility criteria and the successful submission of required documentation. An incentive of ₹5,000/- will be disbursed to students as approved by the Selection Committee.
**The applications will be accepted through the myScheme platform from 04/07/2025 to 31/10/2025.** ***A DigiLocker account is required for application. Please refer to the Application Process section for details.***
Financial Incentive to SC Meritorious Bo.benefits: A financial incentive of ₹5,000/- will be provided.
Financial Incentive to SC Meritorious Bo.eligibility: - The applicant must be currently enrolled as a student. - The applicant must be male. - The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste (SC) community of Assam. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 80% marks in the HSSLC examination held in 2025. - The annual income of the applicant's parents/guardians must not exceed ₹5,00,000/-. _*In instances where multiple applicants achieve an identical percentage in the HSSLC examination, preference will be given to those with a higher percentage in the HSLC examination._

Financial Assistance to OBC Students App.details:
The 'Financial Assistance to OBC students appearing in the Mains Examination of UPSC' scheme, administered by the Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, is designed to provide financial grants to Other Backward Classes (OBC) students who qualify for the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) Mains Examination. Each eligible beneficiary will receive an amount of up to ₹50,000/-, subject to budgetary provisions. The disbursement of assistance is contingent upon the applicant satisfying the stipulated eligibility criteria and the successful submission of required documentation.
***A DigiLocker account is required for application. Please refer to the Application Process section for details.***
Financial Assistance to OBC Students App.benefits: An amount of up to ₹50,000/- will be provided to each beneficiary, subject to budget provision.

- The applicant must have recently qualified for the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) Preliminary Examination held in 2025.
- The annual income of the applicant's parents/guardians must not exceed ₹5,00,000/-.

Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan.details: The scheme “Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The aim of the scheme is to promote and popularize the Sanskrit language and literature by encouraging poets who compose and recite poetry in Sanskrit.
Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan.benefits: An honorarium of ₹2501/- is given to each invited poet.
Akhil Bhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan.eligibility: 1. The fifteen Sanskrit poets from Uttarakhand and other states, who compose and recite poetry in Sanskrit, are invited.

application process.process: The Kavi Sammelan is organized by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy to commemorate national and state festivals. The program coordinator prepares a list of renowned Sanskrit poets from schools, colleges, and universities across the country. The proposed list is submitted to the competent authority for approval. Based on the approved list, poets recommended by the Secretary of the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy are invited to recite their poetry.

Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).details: The scheme "Harit Kaushal Vikas Karyakram" implemented by the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE), aims to promote sustainable and eco-friendly livelihoods through nature-based skill development. Through this scheme, free skill training is provided to farmers, students, and youth to support self-employment and prepare them for government-backed programs as master trainers. It covers subjects like ornithology, wildlife conservation, natural interpretation, and biodiversity communication. The program is aligned with the Green Skill Development Program (GSDP) and is accessible through online applications via the official portal.
Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).benefits: - **Skill Development Training:** Free-of-cost training in environment-related fields such as bird identification, wildlife conservation, biodiversity interpretation, and eco-tourism education.  - **Self-Employment Opportunities:** Empowers youth and farmers to pursue independent livelihood avenues through knowledge-based interventions.  - **Government Scheme Readiness:** Makes candidates eligible for roles under various central/state schemes and government-supported training projects.
Green Skill Development Programme (GSDP).eligibility:
- The applicant should be a student.
  - The applicant should have completed at least 10th standard.
  - The applicant should be a farmer/ youth or individual seeking self-employment.
  - The applicant should be below 55 years of age at the time of application.
  - The applicant should have an interest in environmental and ecological training topics such as wildlife, biodiversity, or natural resource interpretation.

application process.process: Step 1:  The applicant can download the prescribed  application form  or can request it from the Govind Ballabh Pant National Institute of Himalayan Environment (NIHE). Step 2:  The applicant must carefully fill out all details in the application form, including personal details, educational qualifications, address, preferred training course, and declaration. Step 3:  The applicant should affix a recent passport-size photograph on the form and attach self-attested copies of the required documents. Step 4:  The completed application form along with the required documents can be submitted offline in the concerned Institution or through can be send through the following mail ids: gbpihed@envis.nic.in maheshlyf87@gmail.com deepudun28@gmail.com Contact Us: Public Information Officer Dr. S.C. Skill Development.details: The scheme "Skill Development" implemented by the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology aims to enhance the practical knowledge and research capabilities of students pursuing Earth Science and allied subjects. Through this scheme, specialised summer and winter training programmes are offered to postgraduate and integrated postgraduate students in disciplines such as geochemistry, sedimentology, tectonics, geomorphology, environmental geoscience, and paleontology.
Skill Development.benefits: - **Research Experience:** Provides opportunities for self-sponsored research work, allowing students to gain practical experience in Earth Sciences.  - **Seasonal Training:** Offers valuable summer and winter training programs, enhancing practical skills and knowledge in specialized geological disciplines.  - **Exposure to Diverse Fields:** Exposes students to a wide array of sub-disciplines within Earth Sciences, such as structural geology, geochemistry, glaciology, engineering geology, palaeontology, and environmental geology.
Skill Development.eligibility:
1. The applicant must possess a postgraduate degree in any discipline of Geosciences, Earth Sciences, or allied fields.
   1. The applicant may also be pursuing an integrated postgraduate degree course and should be in the fourth or fifth year of the curriculum.
   1. The applicant must be from fields such as geophysics, geochemistry, structural geology, sedimentology, paleontology, environmental geoscience, and related disciplines.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the official website of WIHG at  https://www.wihg.res.in./ . Step 2:  Look for announcements or notifications regarding the Kaushal Vikas (Skill Development) programme. Step 3:  Download or access the application form or online registration link. Step 4:  Fill out the form with all required personal, academic, and institutional details. Step 5:  Upload or attach the required documents as specified in the guidelines. Step 6:  Submit the application as per instructions.

Student Program Under AcSIR.details: The scheme &quot;Student Program Under AcSIR&quot; by the Academy of Scientific and Innovative Research (AcSIR), Government of India aims to promote high-quality interdisciplinary research by enrolling eligible postgraduate candidates into PhD programmes.  Through this scheme, students receive fellowships, training, and research opportunities in Earth Sciences, with the broader goal of preparing future leaders in the geoscience domain of the Himalayas.
Student Program Under AcSIR.benefits: - **Advanced Research Opportunities:** The program provides opportunities for conducting high-quality, interdisciplinary research in various fields of Himalayan Geo-science.  - **Leadership Development:** The scheme aims to develop leaders in the field of Himalayan Geo-science through the PhD program.  - **Career Advancement:** Successful completion of the PhD program leads to a postgraduate degree, enhancing career prospects in the field.
Student Program Under AcSIR.eligibility:
- The applicant must have a postgraduate degree (M.Sc./M.Tech.) in any discipline of Earth Sciences.
- The applicant must hold a valid national-level fellowship such as:


1. NET-JRF (UGC/CSIR).
1. INSPIRE Fellowship.
1. Any other equivalent national fellowship.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit the official online  application portal  and create a Username/Application Log-In by clicking on the “Sign Up here” option. Step 2:  Log in using the credentials received on your registered email ID, and click on “Complete your application” to proceed. Step 3:  Fill out the application form as per the instructions mentioned in the portal and upload the following mandatory and applicable documents in the specified format and size Step 4:  Choose the relevant Admission Route for the iPhD Program: Fresh Candidate (Not registered in PhD at AcSIR) : Choose a research area and lab preference. Eligible for AcSIR-NIF Innovation Doctoral Fellowship. AcSIR PhD Student:  Submit Enrolment Letter and Thesis Research Proposal. Eligible for lump sum research support through AcSIR faculty. NIF Employee:  Submit Permission from Director, NIF and Proposed Research Problem. No additional financial support provided. Industry Sponsored Candidate:  Submit 'No Objection Certificate' from the employer and Proposed Research Problem. Step 5:  Confirm the application details, review the entire form carefully, and then submit the application. Note:  There is no application fee for this process. Contact no: +91 9266600847 / 9266600947

Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG studen.details: "Freeship Less than ₹1,00,000" Scheme by the Dean Student Welfare, Govind Ballabh Pant Krishi Evam Praudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious undergraduate students from economically weaker backgrounds. Through this scheme, a full tuition fee waiver is granted to selected students whose annual family income is less than ₹1,00,000. The benefit is especially extended to girls for an additional academic year. The scheme is implemented by the Office of the Dean Student Welfare in accordance with university regulations. Applications are scrutinized and the final list is approved by university authorities.
Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG studen.benefits:
Eligible students get a 100% tuition fee waiver.

Aims to reduce the financial burden on low-income families and encourage academic excellence.

The fee waiver is directly applied during fee processing.

Granted once every academic year, at the beginning of the session.

Disbursed after the final selection list is approved by the Registrar and Vice Chancellor.

Validity:

Boys: Up to 3 academic years

Girls: Up to 4 academic years
Freeship less than ₹1,00,000 (UG studen.eligibility:
- The applicant should be enrolled as an undergraduate student at Govind Ballabh Pant University.
- The applicant’s annual family income should be less than ₹1,00,000.
- The applicant must be among the best-performing students as per the university’s merit guidelines.
- The applicant must submit the application in the prescribed format within the deadline.

application process.process: Step 1: Applications are invited on a prescribed form from eligible and meritorious students. Step  2: Based on the applications, the Dean Student Welfare prepares a list following the prescribed procedure. Step  3: The list is forwarded to the Registrar and Vice Chancellor for approval. Step 4: Once approved, the final list of selected students is issued by an office order. Step 5: Approved students receive the tuition fee exemption accordingly

Sanskrit Shodh Chhaatravrtti Yojana.details: The scheme “Sanskrit Shodh Chhaatravrtti Yojana” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The aim of the scheme is to encourage and support high-quality research in Sanskrit by providing financial assistance to meritorious Ph.D. students across state universities.
Sanskrit Shodh Chhaatravrtti Yojana.benefits: - A research scholarship of ₹40,000/- per year is awarded to 20 students registered for a Ph.D. in Sanskrit at universities across Uttarakhand. - The scholarship is provided for a period of three years at ₹40,000/- per year and must be renewed by submitting an application each year/semester.
Sanskrit Shodh Chhaatravrtti Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a student registered for a Ph.D. in Sanskrit at any university in Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must belong to the General, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, and Economically Weaker Section. 1. A total of 20 research scholars are eligible for the scholarship, including 10 from the General category, 5 from Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, and 5 from Economically Weaker Section (EWS) certificate holders. 1. Selection will be based on the highest marks obtained in the NET examination.

application process.process: Applications for research scholarships are invited annually through advertisements published in daily newspapers and on the Academy's website. Applicants must submit their applications along with all required documents, including Aadhaar card, NET examination mark sheet, academic certificates, Ph.D. registration certificate, and bank account details. After evaluation by a selection committee, eligible research scholars are awarded annual scholarships to support their research in Sanskrit.

Stipends to Students of Minority Caste f.details: The scheme “Stipends to Students of Minority Caste for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC” by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote inclusive education by financially supporting students from economically weaker sections pursuing technical and vocational education after SSC. The initiative offers a stipend of ₹400 per month to aid the academic progress and reduce the dropout rate among underprivileged youth. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department. It specifically benefits those enrolled in professional or Government ITI courses and belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/-.
Stipends to Students of Minority Caste f.benefits: - **Stipend:** A monthly stipend of ₹400/- is given to Minority Caste students for one year of recognized professional and Government ITI courses.
Stipends to Students of Minority Caste f.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to Minority Caste. 1. The applicant should be a student who has passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination. 1. The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized professional or Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI) course. 1. The applicant’s individual and family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/- per annum.

Special Incentive to ST (P)/OBC/MOBC Mer.details: The scheme "Special Incentive to ST (P)/OBC/MOBC Meritorious Students" by the Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial assistance to meritorious students from Scheduled Tribes (Plains), Other Backward Classes, and More Other Backward Classes communities in Assam. The scheme offers monetary grants to students who achieve high academic marks in Matriculation, 10+2, Graduation, or Post Graduation examinations. To be eligible, the applicant must belong to the ST (P)/OBC/MOBC community and meet the specified percentage criteria for their respective educational level. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Assam. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline through prescribed formats advertised in print and electronic media.
Special Incentive to ST (P)/OBC/MOBC Mer.benefits:
> **Financial Assistance** - ₹10,000/- for students passing Matriculation (Class X) with 80% or above. - ₹15,000/- for students passing 10+2 with 75% or above. - ₹20,000/- for Graduation students with 70% or above. - ₹25,000/- for Post Graduation students with 65% or above.
> **Disbursement Conditions** - Benefits are granted on a first-come, first-served basis, subject to fund availability. - The Selection Committee may lower cut-off marks if insufficient applications are received. - Financial assistance is transferred to the bank accounts of selected beneficiaries.
Special Incentive to ST (P)/OBC/MOBC Mer.eligibility:
1.  The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (Plain) / Other Backward Class / More Other Backward Class community of Assam.
2.  The applicant must qualify as one of the following:

- Secured 80% or above in Matriculation (Class 10th).
- Secured 75% or above in 10+2 examination.
- Secured 70% or above in Graduation.
- Secured 65% or above in Post Graduation.

_*The applicant cannot claim the benefit as a right; approval depends on fund availability and Selection Committee discretion._

application process.process: Step 1:  The Directorate of Welfare of Plains Tribes and Backward Classes, Assam, will advertise the scheme in print and electronic media, along with the prescribed format of the application form. Step 2:  The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form. Step 3:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 4:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Director, WPT & BC, Assam. *Applicants are advised to retain a copy of the submitted application and acknowledgment for future reference. Scrutiny and Approval Step 1:  Applications are scrutinized by the Selection Committee. Step 2:  Approved beneficiaries are selected based on merit and fund availability.

Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe S.details: The scheme &quot;Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe Students&quot; by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to support students from the Scheduled Tribe category by reducing the burden of education-related expenses and promoting school attendance. The scheme ensures that eligible students from Classes 1st to 8th studying in government and aided schools receive ₹900/- for three pairs of school uniforms annually, enhancing their dignity and inclusion in the school environment.
Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe S.benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** ₹900/- is provided to each eligible student for the purchase of three pairs of school uniforms.
Uniform Assistance for Scheduled Tribe S.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a student.
  - The applicant should belong to the state of Gujarat.
  - The applicant should be studying in Class 1st to Class 8th.
  - The applicant should be enrolled in a government or government-aided primary school.
  - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.
