CA/ICWA CMA /CS Scholarship.details: The scheme "CA/ICWA CMA /CS Scholarship" by the Kerala State Minority Welfare Department aims to provide scholarships to students from minority religious communities studying Chartered Accounts/Cost & Management Accounts/Company Secretaryship courses. Through this scheme, a scholarship amount is provided to eligible students. The scheme is implemented by the Kerala State Minority Welfare Department.
CA/ICWA CMA /CS Scholarship.benefits: 1. The scholarship amount of ₹15,000/- is provided. 1. The scholarship is provided to students from minority religious communities.
CA/ICWA CMA /CS Scholarship.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Kerala. 1. The applicant must belong to Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Parsi, or Jain religious communities. 1. The applicant's annual family income should be below ₹8,00,000/-. 1. The applicant must be appearing for intermediate or final year examinations of Chartered Accounts, Cost & Management Accounts, or Company Secretaryship courses. 1. The applicant must have secured 60% marks in Plus Two/B.Com or other degrees. 1. The applicant should have an account in any nationalised bank in their own name.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** - Preference will be given to applicants belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. - In the absence of BPL applicants, applicants from minority religious communities with an annual income up to ₹8,00,000/- in the Above Poverty Line (APL) category will be considered. - Selection will be based on merit and income.
CA/ICWA CMA /CS Scholarship.exclusions: - Applicants who have received this scholarship in previous years are not eligible to apply.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the  official website  of the Directorate of Minority Welfare. Step 2:  Locate and click on the "Scholarship". Step 3:  Navigate to the "Scholarship" menu link and click on "CA/ICWA (CMA)/CS Scholarship (IWCS)". Step 4:  Click on "Apply Online". Step 5:  For new scholarship applicants, first complete one-time registration and log in with your candidate details. Step 6:  In the Registration Form, carefully enter the details step-by-step under Examination details (register number/roll number), Personal details, and Scholarship details tabs. Step 7:  In the Upload details tab, upload the required documents (Photo, Signature, SSLC Certificate, Income Certificate, Ration Card Copy, Allotment Memo) in JPEG format under 100 KB size each. Step 8:  Only after uploading all required documents, the registration process will be considered complete. Step 9:  After completing the application submission, use the View/Print Application link to take a printout of the application form. Submission of Application Printout After submitting the scholarship application (either through new registration or login), click on "View/Print Application" to get a printout of your registration form. Submit the printout of the registration form along with all the required supporting documents to the head of the institution where you are studying, within the specified deadline.

Mother Teresa Scholarship.details: The scheme "Mother Teresa Scholarship (MTS)" by the Department of Minority Welfare, Government of Kerala, aims to support the higher education of students belonging to minority communities. Through this scheme, an amount per annum is provided to students from minority religious communities domiciled in Kerala who are pursuing a diploma in nursing and paramedical courses from government, government-aided, and government-recognised private institutions. The scheme is implemented by the Directorate of Minority Welfare, Kerala.
Mother Teresa Scholarship.benefits: - The selected candidates will receive a scholarship of ₹15,000/- per annum.
Mother Teresa Scholarship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be domiciled in Kerala. 1. The applicant must belong to the Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Parsi, or Jain communities. 1. The applicant must have received seats in nursing or paramedical courses on a merit basis (including in Government, Aided colleges and merit quota in Self-financing colleges). 1. The applicant must have secured 45% marks or more in the qualifying examination. 1. The applicant must have an annual family income less than ₹8,00,000/- from all sources if belonging to the Above Poverty Line (APL) category. 1. For students belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category, there is no income criteria.

application process.process: Step 1:  Visit the  official website  of the Directorate of Minority Welfare. Step 2:  Locate and click on the "Scholarship". Step 3:  Navigate to the "Scholarship" menu link and click on "Mother Teresa Scholarship (MTS)". Step 4:  Click on "Apply Online". Step 5:  For new scholarship applicants, first complete one-time registration and log in with your candidate details. Step 6:  In the Registration Form, carefully enter the details step-by-step under Examination details (register number/roll number), Personal details, and Scholarship details tabs. Step 7:  In the Upload details tab, upload the required documents (Photo, Signature, SSLC Certificate, Income Certificate, Ration Card Copy, Allotment Memo) in JPEG format under 100 KB size each. Step 8:  Only after uploading all required documents, the registration process will be considered complete. Step 9:  After completing the application submission, use the View/Print Application link to take a printout of the application form. Submission of Application Printout After submitting the scholarship application (either through new registration or login), click on "View/Print Application" to get a printout of your registration form. Submit the printout of the registration form along with all the required supporting documents to the head of the institution where you are studying, within the specified deadline.

Swayam Saksham Scheme (Gujarat Gopalak V.details: The scheme "Swayam Saksham Scheme" by the Social Justice & Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to instill a sense of self-reliance among the youth pursuing vocational education/training. For Doctor (Clinic), Physiotherapy Clinic, Biomedical Laboratory, Lawyer Office, Engineering Unit, Chemist Shop, Architect Office, Chartered Accountant, Financial Consulting Level Office, etc. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam.
Swayam Saksham Scheme (Gujarat Gopalak V.benefits:
1. The scheme provides 95% of the loan amount to eligible youth, up to a maximum limit of ₹5,00,000/-. 1. The loan carries an interest rate of 6% per annum.
> **Note:** Beneficiaries are required to contribute 5% of the project cost.
Swayam Saksham Scheme (Gujarat Gopalak V.eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Rabari and Bharwad castes from the socially and educationally backward classes. 1. The applicant's age should be between 18 and 35 years. 1. The applicant's annual income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

application process.process: Step 1: Register on the Official Portal Go to the  Official Website of Gujarat Gopalak Development Corporation. Scroll down on the homepage, find the "Swayam Saksham Scheme," and click on "Apply Now". You will be directed to the application form. Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form Provide Aadhaar, Ration, Voter ID, full name (Last, First, Father/Husband), address, district, taluka, village, PIN, date of birth, age, caste, subcaste, phone, mobile, email, gender, and marital status. For each applicable qualification, tick the checkbox and fill in the Degree, Board/University Name, Academic year, and Percentage obtained. Fill in details about the college/institution admitted to, university affiliation, course name, enrollment number, organisation address, website, course duration (in years and semester), and date of admission. Specify who accredited the course/institution, their name, and address. Proof of accreditation must be submitted. Enter income certificate number, issue date, issuing officer's name, total annual family income (up to ₹ 3,00,000/-), and parent/guardian's occupation. If "Physically Handicapped," select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide the percentage (in %). Indicate if any family member works in a government or private job. If "Yes," provide their Name, Designation, Place, and Salary details. Select your Education Qualification: Uneducated, Educated, Graduation, Post Graduation, or Other Degree. If you have taken a past loan, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide loan details (date, amount, paid, remaining) and your account number. Provide bank account number, bank name, branch name, name as per account, account type (Saving/Current), MICR code, and IFSC code. Step 3: Review and Final Submission Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Fill out the provided "CAPTCHA" and Click on “Submit”. Track and Review Status Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking. Go to the  Official Website  of Gujarat Gopalak Development Corporation. Scroll down and locate the Know App Status. Click on "Know App Status". Select the Scheme name, Enter App No., and Birth Date. Fill out the Captcha and click on Submit.

Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.details: The "Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Economically Backward Class" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance to school-going students from economically backward sections to reduce the dropout rate and promote education from class 1st to 10th. Under this scheme, monetary scholarships are provided to boys and girls studying in government and aided primary schools from Standard 1st to 10th, based on class and gender.
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.benefits: > **Scholarship Amounts:** - Boys (Std. 1st to 8th): ₹750/- per annum.- Boys (Std. 9th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum.- Girls (Std. 1st to 5th): ₹500/- per annum.- Girls (Std. 6th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum.
Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be studying in a government or aided primary/secondary school in Gujarat. 1. The applicant must belong to an Economically Backward Class (EBC). 1. The applicant must be studying in classes 1st to 10th.1. There is no income limit for students of classes 1st to 10th.1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/- for classes 9th to 10th.

application process.process: Application Process: Step 01:  The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal:  https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/ Step 02:  On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. Step 03:  Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. Step 04:  After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. Step 05:  Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. Step 06:  After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). Step 07:  Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. Step 08:  Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. Step 09:  Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. Step 10:  Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. Step 11:  Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. Instructions: Note 01:  Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 02: Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. Note 03:  Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. Note 04:  In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. Note 05:  All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. Note 06:  The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. Note 07:  The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. Note 08:  Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. User Manual - English User Manual - Gujarati

Pandit Deendayal Educational Excellence.details: The "Pandit Deendayal Educational Excellence Award" scheme is implemented by the Secondary Education Department under the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote academic excellence among schools and students by providing cash awards to the best-performing schools at the high school and intermediate levels at the state level, as well as to students securing top positions in the Uttarakhand Board High School and Intermediate Examinations.
Pandit Deendayal Educational Excellence.benefits: > **For Schools:** The 3 schools giving the best results at the state level are awarded prizes of: - ₹10,00,000/-, ₹5,00,000/-, and ₹3,00,000/- at the Intermediate level. - ₹8,00,000/-, ₹4,00,000/-, and ₹2,00,000/- at the High School level. > **For Students (Intermediate Level):** - Students securing 1st, 2nd, and 3rd positions: ₹21,000/-, ₹15,000/-, and ₹11,000/- respectively. - Students securing 4th to 10th positions: ₹5,100/- each. > **For Students (High School Level):** - Students securing 1st, 2nd, and 3rd positions: ₹15,000/-, ₹11,000/-, and ₹8,000/- respectively. - Students securing 4th to 10th positions: ₹5,100/- each.
Pandit Deendayal Educational Excellence.eligibility: > **For School:** 1. The applicant school must be among the 3 best-performing schools at the Uttarakhand Board high school or intermediate level school at the state level. > **For Student:** 1. The applicant student must be among the top 10 rank holders in the Uttarakhand Board Council Examination at High School or Intermediate level examination.

application process.process: The Secondary Education Department, Uttarakhand, receives the list from the Board after the examination results are declared. After obtaining approval from the competent authority for the amount to be awarded to high school and intermediate students securing top 10 positions in the Board examinations, the list is forwarded to the Chief Education Officer. The concerned Chief Education Officer issues drafts to the respective schools according to the number of eligible students. The schools then provide these to the students directly or, in some cases, distribute the funds through award ceremonies. Under this scheme, students are not required to submit any application.

Vocational Education Programme.details: The “Vocational Education Programme” is a scheme under the Samagra Shiksha Programme, implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to impart vocational education alongside academic learning to students of classes 9 to 12 in selected government secondary schools.
Vocational Education Programme.benefits: Under the programme, 08 sectors approved by the Government of India are being implemented under NSQF to provide vocational education alongside academic education for students of classes 9 to 12 in selected schools, where they receive both vocational education and training.
Vocational Education Programme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be studying in classes 9 to 12 in one of the 200 selected government secondary schools of Uttarakhand.

application process.process: All students studying in classes 9 to 12 in government secondary schools where vocational education is conducted can take admission in the sectors operated under this programme. If a student from another school wishes to study the vocational education curriculum, they must take admission in a school where the vocational education curriculum is being conducted. Students already studying in such schools can choose vocational education as one of their subjects like other subjects. For this, no separate application is required. There is also no need to submit any documents for the selection of vocational education subject.

Scholarships to Meritorious Students of.details: The scheme “Scholarships to Meritorious Students of Sanskrit Schools” is implemented by the Directorate of Sanskrit Education under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote Sanskrit education by providing scholarships to meritorious students of Prathmik Madhyama (Class 10) and Uttar Madhyama (Class 12) in Sanskrit schools who secure the highest marks.
Scholarships to Meritorious Students of.benefits: 1. Meritorious students of Prathmik Madhyama (Class 10) are awarded a scholarship of ₹500 per month for 20 months. 1. Three meritorious students of Uttar Madhyama (Class 12) are awarded cash prizes: - **First Position:** ₹20,000/-- **Second Position:** ₹15,000/-- **Third Position:** ₹10,000/-
Scholarships to Meritorious Students of.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student of a recognized Sanskrit school under the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Shiksha Parishad. 1. The applicant must have secured a place in the top 10 in the class 10th merit list or in the top 3 in the class 12th merit list from the Board Examination of Sanskrit School. 1. The applicant must be currently studying in class 11th or 12th after clearing class 10th. <br>

application process.process: The student’s application is first forwarded and recommended by the school principal, and then by the Assistant Director of the respective district. Required documents include the Aadhaar card, bank account details, and the merit list certificate. If the student’s name appears in the merit list, they or their guardian can submit the application online through the  Apuni Sarkar portal  during the same session.

Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni.details: Launched in August 2024, the scheme "Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni" by the Higher Education Department, Government of Assam, aims to support ten lakh girl students with financial grants as admission incentives to continue their education in Higher Secondary, Graduation, and Post-Graduation studies, serving as a crucial step towards eradicating child marriage and its associated harmful practices. The scheme provides monthly financial assistance of ₹1,000 for Class 11-12 students, ₹1,250 for graduation students, and ₹2,500 for post-graduation students for a maximum of ten months per year, and ensures regular attendance and discipline among beneficiaries through institutional monitoring. The applicant must be an unmarried girl student domiciled in Assam enrolled in government and venture educational institutions (excluding private institutions) and must maintain 75% attendance in the previous year for existing beneficiaries. The scheme is implemented by the Higher Education Department, Government of Assam through a portal-based system where applications are accepted offline at respective educational institutions and verified online through institutional portals.
Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni.benefits:
> **Financial Assistance** - Higher Secondary (Class 11-12): ₹1,000 per month for maximum 10 months totaling ₹10,000 per year. - Graduation (Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science/Bachelor of Commerce): ₹1,250 per month for maximum 10 months totaling ₹12,500 per year. - Post-Graduation (Master of Arts/Master of Science/Master of Commerce/Bachelor of Education): ₹2,500 per month for maximum 10 months totaling ₹25,000 per year.
> **Disbursement Details** - **Mode:** Direct Benefit Transfer through bank accounts on monthly basis.- **Frequency:** Monthly for maximum 10 months per academic year.- **Validity:** No incentive during summer vacation or vacations extending more than one month.- **Exclusion Period:** Scheme not effective during June and July every year for academic session 2025-26.
> **Conditions for Availment/Continuation** - Regular class attendance required (75% attendance for existing beneficiaries). - Adherence to institutional discipline and rules and regulations. - No engagement in disruptive behavior, cheating, ragging, vandalism, or misconduct. - Students must not drop out of courses during benefit period. - No arrear amounts will be provided for missed periods. - Violation of rules results in withdrawal of benefits under the scheme.
> **Exclusions from Other Benefits** - Students receiving scooter under Banikanta Kakati Award (Pragyan Bharati Scheme) are not eligible unless they opt out of scooter benefit. - Higher Education Department's Mobility grant scheme has been merged with this scheme.
Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni.eligibility: - The applicant must be a girl student domiciled in Assam irrespective of economic status. - The applicant must be enrolled in government and venture educational institutions for Higher Secondary, Graduation (Bachelor of Arts/Bachelor of Science/Bachelor of Commerce), or Post-Graduation (Master of Arts/Master of Science/Master of Commerce/Bachelor of Education) courses. - The applicant must be a regular student (no correspondence or part-time students). - The applicant must be unmarried except for those enrolled in Post-Graduation and Bachelor of Education categories. - The applicant must maintain institutional discipline and adhere to all rules and regulations. - The applicant must attend classes regularly and maintain 75% attendance for existing beneficiaries.
Mukhya Mantrir Nijut Moina Aasoni.exclusions: - Married girls will not be eligible for the scheme except those in the P.G. and B. Ed. category. - In-service girls, admitted to B.Ed. course on deputation, will not be eligible for the scheme. - Daughters of Ministers/MPs and MLAs are not eligible for the Nijut Moina scheme.

application process.process: Step 1:   Application Form Collection Collect the prescribed application form from the respective educational institution (school, college, or university) where you are currently enrolled, ensuring you have all required documents ready for submission. Step 2:   Form Completion and Submission Fill up the prescribed application form with correct and complete details including personal information, academic records, bank account details, and submit the duly filled form to the Head of Institution (Principal/Registrar) of your current educational institution. Step 3:   Institutional Verification The Head of Institution will collect and verify your application form along with supporting documents, and one or two designated Nodal Teachers will be responsible for implementing the scheme at institutional level under supervision of the Head. Step 4:   Portal Upload and Auto-Verification The Principal or Registrar will submit the verified application data through their respective institutional portal for auto-verification in the centralized system, ensuring accuracy and completeness of submitted information. Step 5:   Eligibility Assessment The institutional authorities will assess your eligibility based on admission status, domicile, marital status, attendance records (for existing beneficiaries), and compliance with institutional rules and regulations. Step 6:   Approval and Database Entry Upon successful verification and eligibility confirmation, your application will be approved and entered into the beneficiary database for monthly Direct Benefit Transfer processing through the designated portal system. Step 7:   Bank Account Verification Ensure your bank account details are correctly linked for Direct Benefit Transfer, and maintain active account status for receiving monthly financial assistance without interruption. Step 8:   Monthly Benefit Disbursement Receive monthly financial assistance through Direct Benefit Transfer to your bank account for maximum ten months per academic year, excluding June and July vacation periods. Application Opening Date:  7th August 2025 Application Closing Date:  5th September 2025

Loans to Tribal Students for Higher Stud.details: The "Loans to Tribal Students for Higher Studies Abroad" scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to tribal students who wish to pursue higher education in foreign universities. Through this scheme, eligible Scheduled Tribe (ST) students can avail a loan at a concessional interest rate of 4% per annum.
Loans to Tribal Students for Higher Stud.benefits: **Monetary Benefit:** - Loan of up to ₹15,00,000 or the actual cost of study/training abroad, whichever is lower. **Interest Rate:** - 4% per annum. **Penalty Interest:** - 2.5% per annum for late repayment. **Beneficiary Contribution:** - No contribution is required from the beneficiary. **Repayment Terms:** - Repayment to be made in 60 monthly installments. - Repayment starts 6 months after completion of studies. - Early repayment is permitted.
Loans to Tribal Students for Higher Stud.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. 1. The applicant must have secured special merit in Matriculation, Higher Secondary, Indian School Certificate, or its equivalent examination. 1. The applicant must have secured admission to a recognized foreign university for higher education. 1. The applicant must have passed the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) or equivalent examination.

application process.process: Registration Process Visit the Gujarat Tribal Development Corporation  official website . Click on the " APPLY FOR LOAN ". Select the scheme name "Foreign Study". Fill the registration form: Full Name (as per Aadhaar Card), Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Number, Mobile Number, Uder name, Password for login, Confirm Password. Click on the "Sign Up. After successful registration, User ID and Password will be generated. Login and Application Process Enter User ID, Password, and Captcha Code. After login, schemes applicable to your caste will be displayed. Click on the scheme you want to apply for. Fill the "Application Form" and upload the required documents Click Save Application. The system will generate an Application Number. Click Print Application.

Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loa.details: The scheme "Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loan" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide complete financial relief to students through 100% interest subsidy on education loans for the entire moratorium period. This includes the study period and 1 additional year after course completion.
Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loa.benefits: - **Interest Subsidy Assistance:** 100% interest subsidy on education loans up to ₹10,00,000/- for the moratorium period (course duration + 1 year).
Interest Subsidy Scheme on Education Loa.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must have passed HSC (Higher Secondary Certificate) with at least 60 percentile. 1. The applicant must have taken an education loan from a recognized bank for pursuing higher education in India or abroad. 1. The applicant must have a family income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/- per year.

application process.process: Registration Process: Step 1:  Visit  https://isel.guj.nic.in  and register using your mobile number and email ID. Step 2:  Log in with OTP and change the password. Step 3:  Enter name, Aadhaar number, Ration Card number, and enrollment details correctly. Step 4:  Provide parent/guardian contact details and complete registration. Application Process: Step 1:  Log in to  https://isel.guj.nic.in  and click “Apply.” Step 2:  Enter course details and fill out the online form. Step 3:  Upload all required documents in the specified format. Step 4:  Visit the designated help center within 7 days for document verification and submit the application set and collect the acknowledgement receipt. (For students abroad – parent/guardian with Power of Attorney signs and submits documents). Contact Us: Kcg E-Mail Id:  isel-kcg[at]gujgov[dot]edu[dot]in Helpline No:  9909039380 (10:30 AM to 6:00 PM)

Mukhyamantri Gyansetu Merit Scholarship.details: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Gyansetu Merit Scholarship Yojana" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat aims to select 30,000 brilliant students who have completed their Class 5 education consecutively in government, aided, or RTE-approved schools and provide them with scholarships to study in selected government, aided, or private schools from Class 6th to Class 12th. The selection is done through a Common Entrance Test conducted by the State Examination Board, Gandhinagar.
Mukhyamantri Gyansetu Merit Scholarship.benefits: > **Government Schools and Government -aided Schools (Approved by Education Department):** - For Class 6th to 8th: ₹5,000/- per year. - For Class 9th to 10th: ₹6,000/- per year. - For Class 11th to 12th: ₹7,000/- per year. > **Private (Selected) Schools:** - For Class 6th to 8th: ₹20,000/- per year. - For Class 9th to 10th: ₹22,000/- per year. - For Class 11th to 12th: ₹25,000/- per year. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** - Disbursed annually in two installments; the first 50% is given after confirmation of at least 80% attendance in the first semester.
Mukhyamantri Gyansetu Merit Scholarship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must have studied Classes 1st to 5th in a Government/ Government-aided/ RTE-approved self-financed primary school in Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed the Common Entrance Test (CET) conducted by the State Examination Board and be listed in the merit list. 1. The applicant must have taken admission in Class 6th in a Government/ Government-aided/ RTE-approved self-financed primary school in Gujarat.

application process.process: Registration Process: Step 1:  Visit the official website:  http://gssyguj.in . Step 2:  Register online using the 18-digit CTS Aadhaar UDI number. Step 3:  Provide mobile number, verify using OTP, and set a password to complete registration. Application Process: Step 1:  Log in using the registered Aadhaar number and password. Step 2:  Fill out the online application form carefully, including personal details, school details (UDISE number), category (SC/ST/OBC/General/EWS), and residence type (Urban/Rural). Step 3:  Upload the required documents including caste certificate (if applicable). Step 4:  Preview the form, save and submit it online. Step 5:  Take a printout of the submitted form for future reference. Step 6:  Regularly check the website and registered mobile number for updates and merit list announcements. Contact Us: Commissioner of Schools Address:  Block-9, 1 st floor, J.M.Bhavan, Old sachivalaya, Gandhinagar Tel. no. :  079-23254011 Other office:  079-23254014 E-mail:  gssyguj@gmail.com

Namo Laxmi Yojana.details: The scheme "Namo Laxmi Yojana" by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage girls studying in government, aided, and private schools in Gujarat to complete their education from Class 9th to 12th by providing direct financial assistance. Each eligible girl will receive a total financial support of ₹50,000/- on completion of classes 9th to 12th under this scheme.
Namo Laxmi Yojana.benefits:
> ***Total Financial Assistance:*** - Each eligible girl will receive a total financial support of ₹50,000/- on completion of classes 9th to 12th in government, aided, and private schools.
> **Class 9th-10th Benefit:** - ₹10,000/- per annum (₹500/- per month based on attendance × 10) and the remaining 50% will be credited via DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) after passing the Class 10th board examination.
> **Class 11th-12th Benefit:** - ₹15,000/- per annum (₹750/- per month based on attendance × 10) and the remaining 50% will be credited via DBT after passing the Class 12th board examination.
Namo Laxmi Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a girl. 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be studying in Class 9th to 12th in any Government, Government-aided, or private secondary/higher secondary school in Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have an annual family income of less than or equal to ₹6,00,000/-. 1. The applicant must maintain regular attendance to be eligible for monthly assistance.

application process.process: Step 1:  Applicants should request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the School authority. Step 2:  In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the District Education Officer. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.

Advocate Graduate Stipend Gujarat.details: The “Advocate Graduate Stipend” scheme was launched by the Tribal Development Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance and practical training support to tribal law graduates who begin their legal practice. Under this scheme, tribal youth who have obtained their charter within two years of completing their LLB are given a monthly stipend.
Advocate Graduate Stipend Gujarat.benefits: > **Stipend to junior tribal advocates:** - ₹10,000 per month for the first year. - ₹8,000 per month for the second year. - ₹6,000 per month for the third year. > **Allowance to senior advocate (mentor):** - ₹5,000 per month for three years.
Advocate Graduate Stipend Gujarat.eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a Scheduled Tribe (ST) youth. 1. The applicant should have completed LLB degree. 1. The applicant should have obtained a charter within two years of graduation. 1. The applicant should begin legal practice as a junior lawyer under a senior advocate. 1. The applicant should be practicing in tribal areas of Gujarat.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office of the Project Administrator of Gujarat Tribal Development Corporation, Gandhinagar, and all tribal districts, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Tribal District Sponsorship Administrator's Office. Step 4:  Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Conducting Outreach Programmes in Variou.details: The scheme “Conducting Outreach Programmes in Various Fields” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Science Education and Research Centre (USERC) under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote scientific awareness among students, teachers, and the general public by conducting outreach programmes and activities in various fields of science through both online and offline modes, thereby making science education and research more accessible across the state.
Conducting Outreach Programmes in Variou.benefits: In order to make the benefits of science education and research accessible to every individual in the state, information regarding the development of scientific consciousness and the dissemination of scientific knowledge among students, teachers, and the general public through online and offline mediums is disseminated through various social media sites, USERC Science Awareness Centres (currently 200 in the state), and USERC Nodal Officers working in higher education.
Conducting Outreach Programmes in Variou.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student or a person (general public) from Uttarakhand.

application process.process: There is no fixed duration for outreach programs; some last one day, while others span multiple days. To participate, USERC first solicits applications through a Google form, after which all students are free to join. In offline programs, students from nearby schools and the general public can participate, with information provided by the relevant venue or USERC Science Awareness Centres.

Super-100 Programme - Uttarakhand.details: The scheme “Super-100 Programme” is implemented under the Samagra Shiksha Programme by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to identify and support the brightest Class 12 Science stream students by providing them with high-quality coaching and guidance for engineering and medical entrance examinations. The programme is a unique state-level initiative approved by the Government of India.
Super-100 Programme - Uttarakhand.benefits: Under this programme, 100 Science students were prepared for engineering and medical entrance examinations in 2023–24. Faculty members were selected from reputed coaching institutes based on their interviews and experience.
Super-100 Programme - Uttarakhand.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a Class 12 Science stream student studying in Uttarakhand. 1. One top-performing student from each block, along with the highest-scoring students from the SC, ST, and OBC categories, will be considered eligible under this programme. 1. A total of 100 Class 12 Science stream students will be selected for the programme.

application process.process: From each block, Class 12 Science stream students were selected who had secured the first position in Class 10 within their respective development block.

Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Awa.details: The scheme "Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Award Scheme To Successful Candidates for Central and All India Service Examination" was launched by the Higher and Technical Education Department, Government of Mizoram. The scheme aims to encourage educated youth among the citizens of India and bonafide residents of Mizoram who aspire to succeed entry to Central and All India Services, addressing the issue of Mizo educated youths lagging behind and becoming increasingly marginalized in examinations conducted by the Union Public Service Commission. The scheme provides an incentive cash award of ₹1,00,000/- to successful candidates and reimbursement of coaching and hostel fees.
Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Awa.benefits: **Incentive Cash Award:** ₹1,00,000/- (one-time payment) for clearance of any eligible examination. **Coaching Fee Reimbursement:** Actual fees paid to coaching institution or ₹20,000/-, whichever is less (only once, not granted on second attempt). **Hostel/Mess Fee Reimbursement:** ₹2,000/- per month for maximum 6 months (only once, not granted on second attempt). *Payment made through E-Payment by Secretary, Mizoram Scholarship Board. *Only one examination can be claimed at a time. _*Claims must be submitted within 3 months from date of result declaration._
Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Awa.eligibility:
- The applicant should be a bonafide citizen of the State of Mizoram. - The applicant should be a citizen of India and bonafide resident of Mizoram. - The applicant should have successfully cleared examinations conducted by Union Public Service Commission. ***Examination Categories*** - Civil Service Examination. - Combined Defence Service (Officers Training Academy) Examination. - National Defence Academy and Naval Academic Examination. - TCombined Medical Examination. - Central Police Forces (Assistant Commandants) Examination. - Indian Economic/Indian Statistical Service Examination. - Combined Geo-Scientist Examination. - Section Officers (20% Direct recruitment by Union Public Service Commission) Examination.
_*The applicant shall be entitled to two chances i.e. clearance of preliminary exam twice and mains exam twice._ _*The applicant shall be entitled to claim for only one examination at a time._ _*The applicant shall submit his claim in the prescribed form within a period of 3 months from the date of declaration of results._
Government of Mizoram Incentive Cash Awa.exclusions: - The applicant shall not be an employee under the Union or State Government or any Government aided Public Service Undertaking or Board etc. at the time of appearing for the exam. - The applicant shall not be covered under any scholarship or incentive scheme implemented by the Union or State Government.

application process.process: Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Alternatively, visit the Office of the Secretary, Mizoram Scholarship Board, to obtain the prescribed application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields: name of applicant, father's/mother's name, permanent residence, date of birth, Aadhaar number, examination details for which incentive is applied, roll number, month and year of examination, contact number, email address, and call letter/intimation number and date. Paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to Office of the Secretary, Mizoram Scholarship Board, Mizoram. Verification Process The Mizoram Scholarship Board will verify all submitted documents and claims as per the scheme guidelines. Payment Processing Upon successful verification, payment will be made by the Secretary, Mizoram Scholarship Board through E-Payment system directly to the applicant's bank account. Application Deadline Claims must be submitted within 3 months from the date of declaration of examination results.

Margadeepam Scholarship.details: The scheme "Margadeepam Scholarship" was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Kerala. The scheme aims to provide educational financial assistance to minority community students studying in government and government-aided schools from Class 1st to Class 8th, addressing the educational needs of Hindu, Christian (all denominations), Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, and Parsi students in proportion to their population. The scheme provides a one-time annual scholarship amount of ₹1,500/- and targets permanent residents of Kerala from minority religious communities.
Margadeepam Scholarship.benefits: > ***Financial Assistance*** - Scholarship amount of ₹1,500/- per student per academic year. - One-time Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to Aadhaar-linked bank accounts in the name of selected students. > ***Conditions*** - The beneficiary must maintain an active Aadhaar-linked bank account with a nationalized or scheduled bank in their own name for Direct Benefit Transfer. - The beneficiary must provide accurate banking details to the institutional head for successful fund transfer. - The beneficiary must not receive any other scholarship benefits under other schemes simultaneously while availing this scholarship. - The beneficiary must apply fresh each academic year if they wish to continue receiving the scholarship in subsequent years. - The beneficiary must cooperate with institutional verification processes and provide original documents when requested by authorities. - The beneficiary must immediately inform the institutional head of any change in circumstances that may affect eligibility. - The beneficiary must return the entire scholarship amount if found guilty of providing false declarations or fraudulent information.
Margadeepam Scholarship.eligibility: - The applicant must be a permanent resident of Kerala. - The applicant must be studying in Class 1st to Class 8th. - The applicant must be studying in a Government or Government-aided school. - The applicant must belong to a minority religious community (Hindu, Christian (all denominations), Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, or Parsi). - The applicant's family annual income must not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. _*If adequate applicants are not available in one category, students from other categories may be considered._ ##### **Earmarking** - 30% scholarships are reserved for female students. - The applicant (male students) may be considered for female-reserved positions if adequate female applications are not received. ##### ***Additional Merit Consideration*** - **PwD:** The applicant should provide disability certificate if having 40% and above physical/mental disability.- **Orphan:** The applicant should provide death certificate if orphaned (father/mother/both parents deceased). ##### ***Merit Point Calculation System*** Family Income: Formula = (2,50,000 - Actual Income)/25,000 (Maximum 10 points). Academic Grades: Maximum 12 points (A+ Grade = 12, A Grade = 11, B+ Grade = 10, B Grade = 9, C+ Grade = 8, C Grade = 7, D+ Grade = 6, D Grade = 5). Orphaned Students: 4 points maximum (Both parents deceased = 4, Single parent deceased = 2). Physical/Mental Disability: 4 points (40% and above disability and category 2 disability). Total Maximum Points: 30. _*Academic excellence for Class 2nd to Class 8th students will be determined based on grade points received in academic year._ _*Class 1st students will not be evaluated on academic marks but on income eligibility criteria._ ##### ***Post-Selection Conditions*** - The applicant must reapply fresh each academic year to continue receiving benefits. - The applicant must maintain eligibility criteria throughout the benefit period. - The applicant must not provide false declarations as it will result in immediate scholarship cancellation and recovery of disbursed amount.
Margadeepam Scholarship.exclusions: - The applicants already receiving benefits under any other scholarship scheme are not eligible. - The applicants whose family member is already receiving this scholarship are not eligible.

application process.process: For the Student Step 1:  The interested applicant should take a printout of the  prescribed format  of the application form. Step 2:  In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Step 3:  Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Head of the Institution. For the Institution Step 1:   Access the Portal and Log In Go to the official  Margadeepam Scholarship portal  and select "Official Login" from the dropdown menu. Log in using the last 5 digits of your Sampoorna School Code as both the username and password, then enter the captcha. You will be prompted to reset your password. Choose a new one and proceed to the Institution's Home Page. Step 2:   Add Courses and Students First, navigate to the "Add Course in Institution" menu and add all available classes (1 to 8). Next, go to the "Add Student" menu, enter the student's Admission Number, and click "Get Details from Sampoorna" to fetch their information. Ensure the Aadhaar Number, Admission Number, and Account Number are unique, as data cannot be edited after it is added. Step 3:   Add Scholarship Criteria Click on the "Add Scholarship Criteria" menu to see a list of students who need details added. Select a student from the list and click "Add Criteria" to enter the required information. Fill in all necessary details, which include family income and academic grades. Step 4:   Submit the Application After entering the scholarship criteria, go to the "Apply for Scholarship" menu and select a class. A list of eligible students will be displayed; untick any students you do not wish to include in the submission. Review the list, tick the certification mark to confirm the details are correct, and click "Process Application" to submit. Step 5:   View Status and Previous Records To check the status of submitted applications, view the list under the "Submitted Applications" menu. This list shows all applications that are awaiting verification by the Directorate. You can also view a list of students who received scholarships in previous years by clicking on "View Selected List".

Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Boys Residen.details: The Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Residential School Scheme for Boys (Class 1-8) is a centrally sponsored scheme launched in 2017-18. It targets vulnerable children like orphans, child laborers, street dwellers, and those with single parents, offering them free residential facilities to complete their primary education and reduce the male-female gap in education. The scheme operates in 52 districts with 100-bed hostels. Benefits include free stay, food, medical, books, uniforms, and daily necessities. Application is by approaching the District Project Coordinator/Warden.
Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Boys Residen.benefits: 1. These hostels admit orphans, homeless children, single parents, destitute child laborers, rag pickers, children living on railway station platforms and bus stands and provide them with residential facilities to complete their primary education. 1. Provide educational opportunities to children from educationally disadvantaged groups through residential schools. 1. Bridging the educational gap between boys and girls. 1. Provide residential school facilities to provide children with primary education.
Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Boys Residen.eligibility: 1. Boys who have dropped out of school because a middle school is not available within a 3 km radius or a high school/higher secondary school is not available within a 5 km radius of their village. 1. Boys who are identified as (Classes 1-8): - School Dropouts - Out-of-School/Non-enrolled - Destitute/Homeless - Orphans - Single-Parent Children - Divyang (Physically disabled/Orthopedically handicapped) 1. Boys identified as school dropouts and out-of-school shall be admitted to the Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Residential Hostel. 1. Children from Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) Ashram Schools that are at the primary level may also be admitted to the hostel. 1. Local resident boys shall not be admitted to the hostel.

application process.process: Application Method: To apply, one needs to ensure the child is provided with residential facilities to complete their primary education (कक्षा 1 से 8 तक). Contact/Registration: Contact the District Project Coordinator/Warden Application Fee: There is No application fee Appeal: In case of an appeal, contact the District Project Coordinator's Office/District Education Centre. Time Limit: The process is operational for the Full Year

Loan For Foreign Study (S.E.B.C.).details: The scheme "Loan for Foreign Study (S.E.B.C.)" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide students belonging to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (S.E.B.C.) with financial assistance for higher education abroad. The scheme provides a maximum loan of ₹15,00,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Lakh) for higher studies in foreign countries. The applications for this scheme are accepted online via the official website [https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/).
Loan For Foreign Study (S.E.B.C.).benefits: ##### ***Financial Assistance*** - A maximum Foreign Study Loan of ₹15,00,000/- is provided for higher education abroad. - The loan is offered at a simple annual interest rate of 4%. - The loan covers costs such as air tickets, registration fees, tuition fees, education fees, hostel fees, books, and other expenses associated with the first year of the course abroad. ##### ***Disbursement Conditions*** - The full loan amount of ₹15,00,000/- will be disbursed to the student in a single installment. - The money will be deposited into the student's bank account after the submission of the original registered mortgage deed. ##### ***Post-Selection Obligations*** - After the sanction order is received, the student's parent or guardian must obtain the prescribed mortgage deed form from the District Office. - The property presented by the student's parent/guardian or the guarantor must be registered as a mortgage in favor of the government. - The loan repayment must begin one year after the completion of the student's study. - The loan must be repaid in monthly or quarterly installments. - The principal loan amount must be fully repaid within a maximum period of 10 years. - The interest amount must be fully repaid within a maximum period of 2 years. - The student must ensure all required documentation is completed within the prescribed time limit.
Loan For Foreign Study (S.E.B.C.).eligibility: - The applicant must belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (S.E.B.C.). - The applicant's family annual income must be less than ₹10,00,000/- (Rupees Ten Lakh). - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 60% or more marks in 12th standard. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 50% marks if they belong to Notified Tribes/De-notified Tribes (NT/DNT), More Backward, or Extremely Backward categories. - The applicant must be pursuing higher education abroad. - The applicant must be pursuing a Diploma, Graduate, Post Graduate, Post Graduate Diploma, Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.), or higher-level courses in any field. - The course must be for a minimum duration of 1 (one) academic year or more, or at least two semesters. - The applicant must apply before traveling abroad or within six months of arriving abroad. - The applicant must submit one solvent guarantor.

application process.process: Registration Step 1:  Visit the Official Website of  eSamajkalyan . Step 2:  In the right pane of the home page, click " New User? Please Register Here! ". You will be taken to the Registration Form. Step 3:  In the form, provide all the mandatory fields, fill in the captcha code, and click "Submit" to complete the registration process. A popup will appear acknowledging successful registration and displaying your User ID for Login. Application Step 1:  Visit the Official Website of  eSamajkalyan . In the "Citizen Login" section provided in the right pane of the home page, provide your User ID and Password, fill in the Captcha Code, then click "Login". Step 2:  In the ribbon provided at the top of the website, click the "Corporation" menu, then click "Gujarat State Divyangjan Finance and Development Corporation". A list of schemes will be displayed. Select the scheme you intend to apply for. Step 3:  You will be taken to the online application form of the scheme. In the form, provide all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make corrections, if any. Step 4:  Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. Note down your Application Number for future reference. You can also take a printout of the submitted application form. Step 5:  Following the successful online submission, the applicant must take a printout of the final application form. Two identical physical copies of the complete application set, along with attached enclosures of all uploaded documents, must be prepared. These two copies must then be deposited at the respective District Office (District Social Welfare Officer (Developing Castes)) applicable to the student.

Establishment of Digital Learning Platfo.details: The scheme “Establishment of Digital Learning Platform” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Science Education and Research Centre (USERC) under the Department of Science and Technology, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to establish Digital Learning Platform to provide training and career counseling on various subjects, including ICT orientation, emerging technologies, and more, through both online and offline modes for students of secondary schools across the state.
Establishment of Digital Learning Platfo.benefits: Under the Digital Learning Platform, students of secondary schools are provided with training and career counseling on various subjects, such as ICT orientation, emerging technologies, and more, through both online and offline modes.
Establishment of Digital Learning Platfo.eligibility: 1. All students studying in secondary schools across Uttarakhand are eligible.

application process.process: A five- or seven-day training on digital technology shall be provided to students through both online and offline modes in various secondary schools across the state.

Mukhyamantri Chhaatrvrtti Yojana.details: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Chhaatrvrtti Yojana" has been launched by the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to support eligible NCC cadets through financial incentives to encourage continued participation in education and NCC training. Through this scheme, scholarship amounts ranging from ₹600/- to ₹2,400/- are provided annually to eligible NCC cadets at group and unit levels. Annual cash scholarships are awarded at both group and unit levels to junior and senior division NCC cadets. The scheme is implemented by designated Group Headquarters and Unit Offices under the administrative control of the State Directorate of NCC.
Mukhyamantri Chhaatrvrtti Yojana.benefits:
> **Group Level:**



  - For Senior Division/Senior Wing cadets: ₹2,400/-.
  - For Junior Division/Junior Wing cadets: ₹1,200/-.


> **Unit Level:**



  - For Senior Division/Senior Wing cadets: ₹1,200/-.
  - For Junior Division/Junior Wing cadets: ₹600/-.
Mukhyamantri Chhaatrvrtti Yojana.eligibility:
1. The applicant must be an NCC cadet.
   1. The applicant must have passed the 10th or 12th class or an equivalent examination in the previous academic session.
   1. The applicant must have completed two years of NCC training.
   1. The applicant must have maintained a minimum of 80% attendance in each year of NCC training.
   1. The applicant must be currently pursuing higher education.
   1. The applicant must not be receiving any other general or special scholarship from the State Government.

application process.process: Step 1:  The Group Headquarters/Units collect applications in the prescribed format from cadets of schools/colleges where NCC is functional. Step 2:  Each Group Headquarters constitutes a "Board of Officers" to review and verify applications. Step 3:  The board also handles the processing of cadets’ application forms and all related documents. Step 4:  The complete application set, including the filled form and caste certificate certified by the competent authority, is submitted to the Directorate. Step 5:  Upon approval at the Directorate level, the scholarship amount is sanctioned and disbursed.

Nishulk Ganavesh Yojana.details: The “Nishulk Ganavesh Yojana” is a scheme under the Samagra Shiksha Programme, implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide free uniforms to all girl students studying in Classes 1 to 8 of government and government-aided schools, as well as to all boys belonging to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes, and boys from the General category who fall under the Below Poverty Line category.
Nishulk Ganavesh Yojana.benefits: Under this scheme, two sets of uniforms per student are provided through DBT/SMC to students studying in classes 1 to 8 of government and government-aided schools, covering all girls, all boys belonging to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe categories, and boys from the General category belonging to BPL families.
Nishulk Ganavesh Yojana.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be either a girl student, or a boy student belonging to the Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, or General Category BPL family. 1. The applicant must be studying in Classes 1 to 8.

application process.process: There is no selection process; all eligible students from Classes 1 to 8 are provided free uniforms or the corresponding financial assistance.

Sanskrit Chhaatr Pratiyogita.details: The scheme “Sanskrit Chhaatr Pratiyogita” is implemented by the Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar, under the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote Sanskrit education among students by organizing Sanskrit competitions. Under this scheme, Sanskrit competitions are organized at various levels for both junior (Class 6 to 10) and senior (Class 11 to post-graduation) categories. A total of six competitions are conducted in each category, namely Sanskrit Drama, Sanskrit Group Song, Sanskrit Group Dance, Sanskrit Debate, Sanskrit Auspicious Speech, and Sanskrit Shlokacharan.
Sanskrit Chhaatr Pratiyogita.benefits: Separate six Sanskrit competitions for junior and senior categories are organized at every level. The prize distribution is as follows: **Development Block Level** - **Team Events:** Minimum prize of ₹300/- and maximum prize of ₹800/-- **Individual Competition:** Minimum prize of ₹300/- and maximum prize of ₹500/- **District Level** - **Team Events:** Minimum prize of ₹400/- and maximum prize of ₹2,000/-- **Individual Competition**: Minimum prize of ₹400/- and maximum prize of ₹800/- **State Level** - **Team Events:** Minimum prize of ₹6,000/- and maximum prize of ₹25,000/-- **Individual Competition:** Minimum prize of ₹2,000/- and maximum prize of ₹4,000/-
Sanskrit Chhaatr Pratiyogita.eligibility: 1. The institutional students studying in the junior classes (Class 6 to 10) and senior classes (Class 11 to post-graduation) of any government, private, or non-governmental school/college in Uttarakhand are eligible to participate. 1. The students pursuing B.Ed., Ph.D., or Diploma courses are not eligible for participation.

application process.process: This competition is held once a year, typically between September and November. An advertisement or notification is issued and sent to the relevant District Coordinator and Block Coordinator. After students are selected at the school or college level, they are recommended by their principal and presented to the Block Education Officer/Block Coordinator for participation. Prizes are awarded to participants or teams that secure first, second, and third place in the block-level competition. All first- and second-place finishers then advance to the district-level competition. At the district level, prize money is awarded to participants or teams securing first, second, and third place. All first-place winners at the district level advance to the state-level competition, where prize money is awarded to the first, second, and third-place winners.

Minority Scholarship Scheme for Class 1.details: The “Minority Scholarship Scheme for Class 1 to 10” was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide scholarships to students belonging to minority communities who are studying in Classes 1 to 10 in any recognized government/non-government educational institution in Uttarakhand.
Minority Scholarship Scheme for Class 1.benefits: At present, the State Government provides the following **monthly scholarships** for students from Class 1 to 10: - **Class 1 to 5:** ₹50/-- **Class 6 to 8:** ₹80/-- **Class 9 to 10:** ₹120/-
Minority Scholarship Scheme for Class 1.eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to a minority community (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Parsi, Buddhist, or Jain). 1. The applicant must be studying in Classes 1 to 10. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in a recognized government/non-government educational institution in the state of Uttarakhand.

application process.process: Minority community students studying in Classes 1 to 10 can register at any time through the National Scholarship Portal (NSP 2.0) at  https://scholarships.gov.in . Registration requires an Aadhaar number and an Aadhaar-linked mobile number. During registration, students provide basic information such as their name, parents’ names, and educational qualifications. Upon successful registration, a student ID and password are generated. For applying to the scholarship, the department publishes advertisements in newspapers or on the NSP portal, inviting online applications within a stipulated period. Students must log in using their registered ID and password or register if not already done, and select their school or institution during the application process. While applying, students are required to upload mandatory documents, including educational certificates, Aadhaar card, bank account linked with Aadhaar, permanent residence certificate, self-declaration certificate of minority community, income certificate, certificate of studying in school, and a passport-size photograph. In addition, offline copies of these documents must be submitted to the school or institution for verification. Once submitted, the application reaches the school’s Institute Nodal Officer (INO), who verifies the documents and forwards the application to the State Nodal Officer (SNO). The SNO then forwards the applications to the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India after a random selection process (2% of applications). If all documents and eligibility criteria are verified and found correct, the scholarship amount is directly transferred to the student’s bank account through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

Dr. V.N. Mathur Award (M.Sc. Mathematics.details: The “Dr. V.N. Mathur Award (M.Sc. Mathematics)” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial support and encourage meritorious students pursuing an M.Sc. in Mathematics, thereby assisting them and reducing their financial burden.
Dr. V.N. Mathur Award (M.Sc. Mathematics.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be enrolled in an M.Sc. Mathematics course at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar. 1. The financial assistance is awarded for a duration of one year only.

application process.process: Students are first invited to submit their applications on the prescribed form. A committee, constituted by the Vice Chancellor, then reviews and evaluates these applications following a defined procedure. Based on the committee’s recommendations, the Vice Chancellor grants approval, after which the selected students receive the payments.

Swanath Scholarship Scheme.details: The “Swanath Scholarship Scheme” is implemented by the Department of Technical Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial support to diploma and graduate-level students who are orphans, whose parents or either parent has died due to COVID-19, or who are dependents of martyrs from the military or central armed forces.
Swanath Scholarship Scheme.benefits: Eligible students at the diploma or graduation level will receive financial assistance of ₹50,000/- per annum.
Swanath Scholarship Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a student. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be an orphan, have lost one or both parents due to COVID-19, or be a dependent of a martyr from the military or central armed forces. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.

application process.process: These scholarships are administered by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). Applications under the AICTE schemes are invited through the  National Scholarship Portal  (NSP) between September and December, and scholarships are awarded based on merit. Applicants are required to submit their high school and intermediate mark sheets and certificates, along with an income certificate. For this scheme, the death certificate of the candidate’s parent(s) is also required. Students must first apply online through the institute where they are enrolled. The application is then verified by the concerned Principal, followed by verification by the State Level Officer (SLO), and finally forwarded to the AICTE, New Delhi.

Research Assistantship.details: The “Research Assistantship” scheme is implemented by Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar, under the Department of Agriculture, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote higher education and research through providing research assistantship to undergraduate and postgraduate research scholars.
Research Assistantship.benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to undergraduate and postgraduate researchers in the form of research assistantships.
Research Assistantship.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a graduate or postgraduate research scholar pursuing research at Govind Ballabh Pant University of Agriculture and Technology, Pantnagar.

application process.process: The selection of undergraduate and postgraduate research scholars is based on a written examination and academic performance (OGPA), in accordance with the criteria established by the university.

Samaaveshit Shiksha.details: The scheme “Samaaveshit Shiksha” is an initiative under the Samagra Shiksha Programme, has been implemented by the Secondary Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide equal and inclusive educational opportunities to all children with special needs (Divyang children) studying in government schools from Classes 1 to 12.
Samaaveshit Shiksha.benefits: - Escort facility, home-based education, sports activities, exposure visits, stipend for girls, and free equipment are provided to all children with special needs studying in government schools from Classes 1 to 12. - Marking and equipment distribution camps are also organized for such children, where assistive devices are provided free of cost as per the requirement of disabled children.
Samaaveshit Shiksha.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a child with a disability, aged 6 to 18 years, eligible for all facilities approved by the Government of India under the ‘Samaveshit Shiksha’ scheme. 1. The applicant must be studying in government schools from Classes 1 to 12.

application process.process: At the beginning of the academic session, special educators at the block level identify children with disabilities, who are then enrolled in nearby schools.

Son/Daughter Education Assistance (UKBOC.details: The “Son/Daughter Education Assistance” scheme is implemented by the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (UKBOCWWB) under the Labour Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme provides financial assistance to the children of registered building and construction workers pursuing education from Class I up to higher education or professional courses.
Son/Daughter Education Assistance (UKBOC.benefits: **Financial assistance for education will be provided to the children of construction workers at the following rates:** **Sl. No.****Class/Course****Financial Assistance (Yearly)**1Class 1 to 5₹1,800/-2Class 6 to 10₹2,400/-3Class 11 to 12₹3,000/-4Graduation/Post Graduation or its equivalent₹10,000/-5ITI, Polytechnic courses or higher educationThe course fee will be payable to the Government Institutions / College.
Son/Daughter Education Assistance (UKBOC.eligibility: 1. The two (2) children of a construction worker registered with the Uttarakhand Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board will be eligible to avail benefits under this scheme. Applications must be submitted between November of the same financial year in which admission is taken (from Class 1 to Post Graduation) and June of the next academic session. Applications received after this period will not be considered by the Board. > **Financial assistance for education is provided on an annual basis.**

application process.process: Construction workers have to apply online through Shramik Suvidha Kendras. During the application process, the following documents must be attached: Shramik Card, Aadhaar Card of the worker, mobile number, bank account details, Aadhaar Card of the children, attested copy of the children’s last year’s mark sheet (not required for Class 1), certificate of enrollment from the educational institution, self-declaration form, and a certificate confirming that no financial assistance has been received from any other department or government for this purpose. After submission, the department will conduct a verification. If the information is found correct, financial assistance for the entire academic session will be credited in one installment to the worker’s account.

“Ishan Uday” Special Scholarship Scheme.details: A scholarship scheme by the Ministry of Education and the University Grants Commission. Taking special interest with regard to the promotion of higher education in the NER, i.e. for improving the GER, promoting higher education, and encouraging children belonging to the economically weaker sections of the NE region, the UGC has decided to launch “Ishan Uday” Special Scholarship Scheme for North Eastern Region from the academic session 2014-15. Before launching the scheme the UGC undertook wide-ranging consultations with State Governments and Central & State Universities of the NE region, the Ministry of, the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region, the North Eastern Council, Shillong, and other stakeholders. The scholar would be awarded from the date of joining the course, as certified by the University/Institution/ College. > **Objectives:** - To provide equal opportunities for higher studies in the NE Region. - To increase the Gross Enrolment Ratio (GER) in the NE Region. - To focus more on professional education in the NE Region. - Optimum utilisation of NER Budgetary Allocation. > **Scope:** Ten thousand (10,000) fresh scholarships every year for general degree courses, and technical and professional courses, including medical and paramedical courses as certified by the Registrar/ Principal/ Director of University/ College/ Institute.
“Ishan Uday” Special Scholarship Scheme.benefits: 1. UGC will award 10,000 (ten thousand) fresh scholarships per year. 1. ₹5,400/- per month for general degree courses and ₹7,800/- per month for technical/medical/professional/paramedical courses. 1. The scholar would be awarded from the date of joining the course, as certified by the University/Institution/ College. 1. Scholarship (as certified by the institutions identified under this scheme) will be paid to the selected students by the UGC through DBT (Direct Benefit Transfer) Mode and will be transferred to the Bank account of the beneficiaries. This procedure will be completed through the PFMS.
“Ishan Uday” Special Scholarship Scheme.eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a domicile of NER. 1. The parental annual income of the applicant should not exceed ₹4,50,000/- per annum from all sources. 1. The applicant should have passed Class 12th or equivalent in the preceding year of study for applications called for the present year. 1. The applicant should have secured admission in the first year of any degree course, either a general degree course of 1. The scholarship shall only be provided for general degree courses, and technical and professional courses, including medical and paramedical courses, as certified by the Registrar/ Principal/ Director of University/ College/ Institute in any of the following universities/colleges/institutes: - Universities/Institutions/Colleges included under Section 2(f) and 12 (B) of the UGC Act. - Deemed to be Universities included under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 and eligible to receive grants-in-aid from UGC. - Universities/Institutions/Colleges funded by the Central / State Government. - Institutes of National Importance. - Institutions recognised by other Statutory councils within as well as outside. - The admission should have been made to a University/ Institution/ College with the AISHE code. > **Renewals:** - Scholarship granted under the scheme will be renewed during the period of the first degree course, subject to good conduct and maintenance of prescribed attendance. - The scholarship will be renewed for the next year of study on receipt of an annual progress report to be granted by the administrative head of the University/ Institution/College.(E.g. Registrar of a University/ Director of the Institution/ Principal of the College or any other officer designated by them). - Students failing to get promoted to the next class/ level would forfeit the scholarship. - Change in course of study will not be permitted. If the awardee changes the course of study, the scholarship will stand forfeited from the date of such a change. - The Scheme will be implemented and monitored by the UGC. - The awardees of previous years will continue to follow the UGC pattern of assistance through the designated bank branches of Canara Bank. > **Note:** - For students of integrated degree courses, the scholarship will be tenable for the complete duration of the course. - For dual degree courses, the scholarship will only be tenable for the tenure of the first degree. - Transgender candidates are eligible to apply under the scheme. The reservation shall be followed as per the Government of India norms. - Distribution of slots amongst the states of NER will be done on the basis of population census(last). - If slots in a particular state remain vacant due to the non-availability of eligible candidates, the unfilled slots will be distributed equitably amongst other states. - Reservation for Persons with Disability (PwD) will be made as per the Government of India norms.
“Ishan Uday” Special Scholarship Scheme.exclusions: 1. Students pursuing courses/programs through Open Universities. 1. Students already availing scholarship for pursuing the Undergraduate program under any other scheme(s). 1. Students gaining admission through "management quota‟. 1. Students pursuing courses, such as Diploma Courses, do not lead to the award of a Degree. 1. Students whose parent's income exceeds ₹4,50,000/- per annum using courses, such as Diploma Courses, do not lead to the award of a degree.
